loans.name: Working Harder - N11Tphúcttoánthóa Group

texts.en:
Ngọc is 22 years old and she is married. She lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has been working in agriculture, raising poultry for five years.

Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region and the income from this business is unstable because when some poultry disease happens, they could die, which leaves her nothing to sell. So she will be in trouble with finance.
The main hardship that Ngọc faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2012, Ngọc joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of "Working Harder - N11TPhúcTToánTHóa", which consists of five members.

In the future, Ngọc hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: To purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Married and the father of four, Ibrahim lives with his family in a camp for Palestinian refugees located in the North of Lebanon. He is 31 years old and has put all his effort into insuring the best living conditions for his family since his first son was born. He now has two sons and two daughters who all go to school while his wife is dedicated to taking care of the family's well-being at home.

Ibrahim has been working in the trade and transportation of livestock for 10 years. His business has been doing well so far. Today, he is asking for a loan of 1,234,994 Lebanese pounds for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He needs the loan to buy livestock for his trade. By taking this loan, Ibrahim will be able to increase his sales and his income, which will boost his profits. Ibrahim is well-known in the area for his honesty and determination, and is always aiming to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Huệ

texts.en:
Huệ is 25 years old and she is married. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has been working in agriculture, raising poultry for more than three years.

Her household was recognized by the local government as poor; moreover, the market need is low in this region. She has no collateral so she can't get a loan from other banks or credit institutions.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet. This is Huệ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.

In the future, Huệ hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Meatuai

texts.en: Meatuai is 32 years old with two children. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. Meatuai requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel and chemicals to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2013, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel and chemicals.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is 48 years old with three children. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. Tina requested a loan to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel and chemicals to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2012, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel and chemicals.

loans.name: Grupo Las Tejedoras De Chuabaj 1 Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 54 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de tres hijas de las edades entre 21 y 24 años de edad, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad del cantón Chuabaj.
Maria (la primera del lado derecho de la foto) por ser una mujer entusiasta y muy perseverante a su familia ha logrado sacar adelante, ella tiene 25 años de trabajar como tejedora, elaborando una variedad de atuendos típicos, a ella le gusta esta actividad porque lo realiza desde la comonidad de su hogar y esto le permite también cuidar de su tienda de abarrotes y de su venta de manzanas por mayor. Maria con el afán de elaborar unos trajes bonitos y modernos para llamar la atención de más clientes  solicita un  préstamo para la compra de materia prima como: hilos de tipo, seda, alemán y lustrina.
Maria tiene las esperanzas puestas en el crédito para poder realizar la inversión en su negocio de ropa, como también espera mejorar sus condiciones de vida para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is a 54-year-old woman who is married and has a beautiful family of three daughters who are between 21 and 24 years old. This humble family lives in a community in the Chuabaj canton.

Because she is such an enthusiastic and persevering woman, Maria (the first on on the right in the photo) has been able to raise her family. She has been working as a weaver for 25 years, making a variety of typical costumes. She likes what she does because she can do it from the comfort of her own home. This allows her to look after her grocery store and her wholesale apple selling business too.

Maria's eagerness to make beautiful and modern outfits to attract the attention of more customers is what is motivating her to apply for a loan. She will use it to buy raw materials such as various types of embroidery floss.

Maria has placed her hopes in this loan so she can invest in her clothing business and also improve her living conditions for the well being of her family.

loans.use: to buy embroidery flosses for making typical clothing.

loans.name: Musrat

texts.en:
Musrat is a 41-year-old, divorced woman. She is very talented and excels in her tailoring work. She has received a lot of appreciation from her community.

Some years ago Musrat started her business of tailoring so she could be able to run her household activities. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for the household's everyday expenses.

Musrat has now requested a loan of 40,000 PKR in order to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles, and scissors for sewing more dresses on time and thus boost her earnings. She wishes to spend her profits by providing a good quality life for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles, and scissors for sewing more dresses on time and thus boost her earnings.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 31 years old and married with one kid who is in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Mary Rose is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary Rose has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en: Pelenatete is a 42-year-old mother with two children. She operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. Pelenatete requested a loan to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, and box of vegetable oil to assist her to run the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, and box of vegetable oil

loans.name: Ane

texts.en: Ane is 26 years old and single. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Ane requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, taro roots (seedlings), and banana tubes (seedlings) to helpt her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2015 and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, taro roots (seedlings), and banana tubes (seedlings).

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Doña Maria de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hermano y cuñada, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 26 años su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su familia logran salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 52 years old. She lives in her own house with her brother and her sister-in-law. For the past 26 years, she has made a living preparing and selling tortillas. Her business is located in the place where she lives, and she has many customers. With the earnings from her sales and with the help of her family, they are able to move forward.

She is requesting a loan to buy quintals of corn as well as lime in order to continue making tortillas and, that way, to earn a higher income so that she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy quintals of corn as well as lime.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 67 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them. Lucia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lucia has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other personal care products. In the future Lucia would like to save enough money to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Zareena  is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She is working hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She and her husband (also shown in the photo) have been doing agricultural work for some years. They crop different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, currently Zareena has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Grupo Pasac Sector 1 Group

texts.es:
Francisca es una mujer de 24 años de edad, es soltera con una linda familia de un hijo de la edad de un año. Esta linda familia vive en una comunidad de la aldea Xejuyup.
Francisca (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía)  para obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su familia con los gastos de la casa, ella se dedica  a la elaboración de ropa típica, esta labor lo realizar ella porque lo hace desde la comunidad de su hogar, con esta actividad Francisca lleva siete años.
Francisca con su gran creatividad se ha destacado con sus hermosos atuendos típicos que todos los días elabora, ella para satisfacer mejor a sus clientes a decidido solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de diferentes tipos de hilos.
Francisca tiene las esperanzas puestas en este crédito para poder realizar su inversión así mejorar sus ingresos y construir su casa para la buena estabilidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 24-year-old woman. She is single, and her nice family is her son, who is one year old. This nice family lives in a community of the village Xejuyup. 
Francisca (the first on the left in the photograph), to obtain an income and to support her family with the household expenses, works in the elaboration of traditional clothing. She does this activity because she can do it from the comfort of her home. She has had this occupation for seven years. 
Francisca, with her great creativity, has stood out with her beautiful traditional costumes that she makes every day. To better satisfy her clients, she has decided to ask for a loan, which she will invest in different types of thread. 
Francisca has her hopes set on this loan to be able to make her investment, and improve her income, and build a house and provide stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase thread.

loans.name: Ghulam

texts.en: Ghulam  is 44 years old, married and the mother of four children.  Some years ago she started her business selling livestock in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She aspires to save money for providing a prosperous future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, skirts, underwear, etc., to have a more competitive business and attract new customers.

loans.name: Simativa

texts.en: Simativa is 42 years old with four children. She operates a business selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. Simativa requested a loan to buy banana tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, hand gloves, a rake, shovel, and chemicals to assist her to run the business. She joined SPBD in 2013, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, hand gloves, a rake, shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a 53-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is a mother of nine children. Out of these children, she still has four school-aged children who are 20, 18, 17 and 15 years old. Her husband works hard as a fisherman while Jocelyn sells dried fish. Aside from selling dried fish, she is starting to run a sari-sari store business to have extra income to help her husband with their daily expenses. Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy additional dried fish to sell and to buy grocery items (to start her sari-sari store business) such as laundry soap, toiletries, coffee, sugar, powdered chocolate drink, biscuits, chips, candies, canned goods, cooking oil, spices and noodles. In the future, she wishes to increase their livelihood and have her own capital to run her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, laundry soap, toiletries, coffee, sugar, powdered chocolate drink, biscuits, chips, candies, canned goods, cooking oil, spices and noodles

loans.name: Ana Yanett

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 10 años a la pesca artesanal, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, la joven vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de redes y trasmallos para continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: The young  woman whose face is pixellated, because she is 28 and lives in a high-risk zone, has been working as a traditional fisherwoman for ten years. She sells her products in the various markets near her home. She lives in her own home with her four children and is requesting a loan for the purchase of nets and drift nets so that she may continue with her work and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy nets and drift nets.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de cincuenta y siete años de edad, trabajadora y creativa, a ella le encanta experimentar con los sabores de las frutas, por eso posee un negocio de elaboración y venta de refrescos naturales. Ha trabajado con financiamientos de Kiva y MiCrédito, con su último préstamo logro abastecerse y hacer que su negocio creciera notablemente. 
Ha vuelto a recurrir a un préstamo, esta vez para invertir en un nuevo negocio, como es el de vender prendas de acero inoxidable, además de invertir en ropa alusiva a las fiestas patronales de su ciudad, es por eso que solicita el crédito para comprar aretes, anillos, pulseras y ropa en general. En un futuro desea poder optar a un crédito de vivienda, para así mejorar la infraestructura de su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Rosa is a fifty-seven year old woman, a hard worker, and creative. She loves experimenting with fruit flavors, so she opened a business making and selling natural refreshments. She has working with financing from Kiva and MiCredito. With her previous loan, she bought supplies that made her business grow significantly.

She has returned to receive another loan, this time to invest in a new business, such as selling jewelry made of stainless steel and to invest in making clothing for her city's festivals. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy earrings, rings, bracelets and clothes in general. In the future, she should be eligible for a home loan in order to improve the infrastructure of her home.

loans.use: to buy earrings, rings, bracelets and clothes in general.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Her name is Ofelia; she is age 48, and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Marcelo, a mason, with whom she has three children, two who are in high school and the youngest is still in the elementary level in school. About half of the Philippine’s population lives in rural areas and Ofelia's family is one of them.

Ofelia took advantage of the cool climate in the upland area and thought of going into the ornamental business. Ofelia has been growing ornamental plants for five years already. She grows garden plants like golden shower, ylang ylang, and bromeliads, and a variety of hanging plants. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the nearby community. To help her expand her farm, she is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 11,000 to buy fertilizer, pots, nets, and various seedlings to grow a variety of ornamentals. Ofelia puts her best efforts to protect her farm from various insects that could damage her plants. Her earnings helped cover their daily sustenance and sending her children to school.

She is thanking you in advance for supporting her livelihood. Ofelia dreams for her ornamental business to flourish in the coming years. She aims to send her children to college to allow them better opportunities to improve their lives. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for pots, nets, fertilizer, seedlings, and garden soil for her ornamental farm.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 25 year old man who currently lives with his girlfriend. They have two young kids: a six-year-old son and a two-year-old son. He works hard every day in order to be able to provide for them. He is pictured with his partner and son.

Simon make a living out of his street market stand, where he sells plants of different kinds and bonsai trees. He gets his plants from different places around the country, mostly from Puebla. He has been working his stand since he was 18 years old.

His biggest dream is to finish his house at Puebla. He plans to live there someday, but he understands that to make that dream possible, he needs to work hard now, and he does.

He thinks that if he is able to invest in his business by increasing his stock he may get a higher income and succeed on his long term goals sooner. Also, if he is able to make this improvement, he will be able to provide a better life quality for his family.

To make this possible, he is looking for a 15,000 MXN (fifteen thousand pesos) loan. At Kubo, we are confident that he will succeed because of his effort and business expertise.

loans.use: to increase stock for his plant selling business

loans.name: Milenka Teresa

texts.es:
La socia Milenka Teresa pertenece al banco comunal MARIA ELENA MOYANO.
La socia tiene 36 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es casada,la socia  continua dedicándose a trabajar para una empresa privada, la socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The member Milenka Teresa belongs to the Maria Elena Moyano communal bank.

She is still working at a private company. She is grateful for the support to be granted and likewise agrees to comply in a disciplined manner with the loan payments. She wishes to continue working, to in this way continue to support her family.

She is requesting a loan to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Urpis De Confraternidad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “URPIS DE CONFRATERNIDAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alicia, la socia sigue con su  negocio de ferreteria,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable , la socia sigue  vendiendo pinturas, clavos entre otros ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pinturas entre otros.
Los socios en general se sienten  agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron  permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo
texts.en:
The members belong to the "URPIS DE CONFRATERNIDAD" communal bank, which is located in Cusco—a district in the province of Cusco, within the region of Cusco.

Alicia is one of the members. She is a responsible person, who is still running her hardware store. She has been in this business for a while now, and the business is going well because of all the efforts that she has put into it. She continues to sell paint, nails, and other products. Alicia hopes to be able to continue working to support her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy paint, among other products.

All the members are grateful for the loan granted and are committed to make their repayments on time.

The members appearing in the embedded picture had asked permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work-related reasons.

loans.use: to buy paint, among other products.

loans.name: Silueta De Cristal Group

texts.es: Grupo ¨Silueta de cristal¨ lo integran 3 socias, quienes como meta principal esta emprender y realizar que sus negocios sean grandes para poder tener una buena estabilidad económica para los gastos familiares. Como líder del grupo esta Josseling, de 19 años, soltera y con un hijo de 9 meses de nacido, desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de derivados de maíz como chicha, pinol, pinolillo, semilla de jicaro, de manera ambulante en su comunidad. Requiere del préstamo para comprar en mayores cantidades maíz, leña y cacao, así asegura que su producción responda conforme la demanda de su clientela. Los otros socios son Candida de 56 años dedicada a la venta de frutas, y Eykel 35 años a la venta de tamales y pinolillo.
texts.en:
The group ¨Silueta de cristal¨ is comprised of three members, who have as a main goal to start and realize the growth of their businesses in order to have financial stability for their household expenses.

The leader of the group is 19-year-old Josseling, who is single and has a 9-month-old son. For 5 years she has been working as a street vendor selling corn products like chicha (a drink made from purple corn), pinol (a roasted maize flour drink), pinolillo (a drink made with cocoa and cornmeal), and jicaro seeds.

She asks for a loan to buy larger quantities of corn, firewood, and cocoa. With this, she will guarantee that her production will correspond to the demands of her clients. The other members are Candida, 56 years old, who works selling fruit, and Eykel, 35 years old, who sells tamales and pinolillo.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and cocoa in large quantities.

loans.name: Flora Argentina

texts.es: Flora, de 51 años, se siente orgullosa por los logros que ha tenido en su vida, y por los esfuerzos que le dedica a su trabajo para salir adelante. Ella y su pareja tienen 2 hijos gemelos de 18 años. Su negocio consiste en la venta de huevo, plátanos y chocobananos. El dinero lo quiere para poder invertirlo en la compra de leche, banano, palillos, huevos, plátanos y frescos. Con el fin de incrementar su producción y las existencias de productos no será escasas. Así aumentaran las ganancias y brindara mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Flora is 51-years old. She is proud of the achievements that she has had in her life, and for the effort that she dedicates to her job in order to get ahead. She and her partner have two children 18-year old twins.

Her business consists of selling eggs, bananas and chocobananos (chocolate-covered bananas). She needs the loan to invest in milk, toothpicks, eggs, bananas and beverages. She hopes to increase production and that the product stock will not be limited. As a result, the profits will increase and that will provide a better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: to buy milk, toothpicks, eggs, bananas and beverages.

loans.name: Ma. Belinda

texts.en:
Ma. Belinda and her husband are engaged in a fishing business to earn a living. They have been doing this for more than 30 years. Ma. Belinda is a 50-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo and a mother of seven children. Among these seven children she still has three school-aged children ages 20, 18 and 16 years old.

In the future, she wants to improve her business to have enough money to send her school-aged children to school. Thus, she dreams to give a better future for her children. Ma. Belinda and her husband work hard to uplift their means of living. She is also engaged in retailing dried fish to have extra income. With that, she is asking a loan to buy fishing net, boat materials and salt used in making dried fish.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, boat materials and salt.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is 28 years old, married and supports two children. She is a small-scale farmer. She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified fertilizers for top dressing her crops for a better harvest.

She plans to use the profits raised to buy a dairy cow to boost her farming activity and start a business of supplying milk for more income gain. She hopes to a lead a financially stable life.

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers for top dressing her crops for a better harvest.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un prestamo para poder cursar su carrera de medicina, esta es su historia:Mi  nombre es Gabriela, tengo 19 año de edad, vivo en el Santo Cerro,  La Vega, junto a mis padres, tengo 3 hermanos, el mayor tiene 20 años de edad,  y una  hermana gemela de 19 años  y la más pequeña tiene 18 años de edad.
 Actualmente estoy cursando la carrera de medicina en UCATECI, elegí  esta carrera porque me apasiona  atender personas y más en el área de la salud, dentro las materias que he dado y que me gustan: Psicología y  Matemática,  la necesidad que tengo es enorme ya que mi familia es de escasos recursos tengo dos hermanos discapacitados y mi padre que es el único que trabaja  como chofer en una empresa  y sus ingresos no alcanzan para cubrir todo, por lo que de no lograr este préstamo no podría continuar estudiando. 
Dentro de mis metas y sueño es que quiero ser una excelente doctora, con altos pensares hacia el futuro, trabajar en un centro de salud grande para poder desarrollarme y ayudar a las personas y también a mi familia que mucho me necesita.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a young medical student. She is asking for a loan in order to be able to attend her medical courses. This is her story:

My name is Gabriela and I am 19 years old. I live in Santo Cerro, La Vega, with my parents. I have three siblings; the oldest is 20, I have a twin sister who is 19, and the youngest is 18.

Right now I am taking a medical course at UCATECI. I chose this path because I am passionate about caring for people and more in the health field. Among the subjects that I have done and like are Psychology and Mathematics.

The need that I have is enormous because my family has few resources. I have two handicapped siblings and my father is the only one that works. He is a driver for a business and his income does not manage to cover everything, which is why if I do not get this loan I will not be able to continue studying.

Among my goals and dreams is that I want to be an excellent doctor with high hopes for the future, to work in a large health center in order to develop myself professionally, and to help people as well as my family who need me greatly.

loans.use: to cover the costs of higher education.

loans.name: Puertas Del Sol Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PUERTAS DEL SOL” iniciarán el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Betty es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, venta de ropa para niños, venta de comida, venta de dulces, venta de chinelas, venta de refrescos, servicio de transporte. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Betty es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres y hace más de quince años, la señora, decidió emprender este negocio; en la actualidad sus hijos son los que le ayudan en este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cosméticos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la  capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Puertas Del Sol credit group will begin its seventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional hub.  It is made up of eight members and is lead by a Board of Directors, of which Betty is president.  The group members have various businesses, among them: selling cosmetics, selling children’s clothing, selling food, selling candy, selling flip-flops, selling drinks, and providing transportation services.

The loan they will take out will benefit micro-entrepreneurs, one of whom is Betty.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution.  She currently has a business selling cosmetics.  She shares that she learned this line of work from her parents over fifteen years ago.  She decided to start up her business, and now her children help her in the business.

The loan she is now taking out is to increase her working capital (to buy cosmetics in bulk).  She will get these from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and will later sell them in her sales space.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family financially, because she is married and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training and the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and fry pan.

loans.name: Siolovalu

texts.en:
Siolovalu is a 28-year-old mother with 4 children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. Siolovalu has requested a loan to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and box of sausage to assist her to run the business.

She became a member of SPBD in 2013. She will expand her business using her profits.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and box of sausage.

loans.name: Priscilah

texts.en:
Priscilah is 37 years old, married and supports four children. She is a small-scale farmer. She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified fertilizers for top dressing her crops for a better harvest.

She plans to use the profits raised to buy a dairy cow to boost her farming activity and start a business of supplying milk for more income gain. She hopes to improve family health care as well as living standards.

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers for top dressing her crops for a better harvest.

loans.name: Walter Enrique

texts.es:
Walter, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañado, su pareja es empleada en una oficina, por el momento no tienen hijos y en su casa viven sus padres y dos hermanos, pero solo su esposa depende económicamente de él.

Walter, trabaja en la agricultura y se ha dedicado a este trabajo desde hace más de 15 años, el trabajo lo aprendió de su padre, porque él siempre ha trabajado en la agricultura, pero además de la agricultura, también es empleado en una planta geotérmica, en la cual trabaja cada 24 horas y eso le permite dedicar tiempo para la agricultura.

Los fondos del préstamo serán invertidos para comprar 12 quintales de abono, semilla para sembrar y herbicidas, con esto tendrá lo necesario para empezar los trabajos de la milpa, en la milpa anterior no pudieron cultivar nada, debido a la sequía que afectó el país.

Los sueños de Walter, son seguir trabajando en la agricultura y también sueña con tener un empleo fijo.
texts.en:
Walter, aged 26, studied up to high school. He is married, and his wife works in an office. For the moment, they don't have children and live in their home with his parents and two siblings. Only his wife is his dependant.

Walter earns a living in agriculture and has been following this occupation for over 15 years. He learned the trade from his father, who has always worked in agriculture. Besides this occupation, Walter works at a geothermal power plant in 24-hour shifts, which allows him to devote time to his agricultural activities.

He will use the loan to buy 12 quintals of organic fertilizer, seeds, and herbicides. With this purchase, he will have what he needs to start working in his cornfield. Last season, he was unable to grow anything in his field because of the drought that affected the country.

Walter's dreams are to continue working in agriculture and to have a steady job.

loans.use: to buy 12 quintals of organic fertilizer, seeds, and herbicides.

loans.name: Alex Omar

texts.es:
Alex tiene 37 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta bachillerato, está casado y  su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, tienen  dos hijos que ya asisten a la escuela.


Alex es empleado pero siempre trabaja la tierra con mozos, el realiza cultivos de granos básicos para poder venderlo posteriormente y así tener varias opciones de ingresos económicos para mantener a su familia.


El préstamo lo necesita para comprar abono, fertilizantes, pagar el alquiler de terreno y pagar a los mozos para la siembra de granos básicos.

El sueño de Alex es tener el sustento diario y fuerzas para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Alex is 37. He was able to finish high school. He is married, and his wife works in the home. They have two children who are in school.

Alex has a job, but he always works the land with laborers. He grows basic staple grains to later sell and have several income options to support his family.

He needs the loan to buy fertilizers, pay the rent on the land, and pay laborers to plant basic staple grains.

Alex's dream is to have enough food every day and strength to keep on working.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pay the rent on the land, and pay laborers to plant basic staple grains.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making cheese and to purchase animals for breeding.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba and her husband are engaged in a fishing business to earn a living. They use the “bubo” (fish trap) to trap the fish so they catch. They have been doing this for more than 29 years. Melba is a 54-year-old woman, and a mother of five children. She has two school-aged children ages 16 and 14 years old.

Thus, they work hard with her husband to provide the needs for their family. In the future, she wishes to improve her business to upturn their livelihood. With this, she is asking for a loan to purchase “bubo” and bamboo.

loans.use: to purchase “bubo” and bamboo.

loans.name: Edinah

texts.en:
Edinah is 35 years old, is married and supports two children. She is a small scale farmer.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides for spraying her crops to improve productivity. She plans to use the profits raised to buy a dairy cow to boost her farming activity, and to start a business supplying milk for more income increase.

She hopes to improve her family's healthcare as well as their living standards.

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides for spraying her crops to improve productivity.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 48 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines.

Mary Jane has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosali

texts.es:
Rosalí, de 43 años de edad, solo estudio hasta segundo grado, debido a diversas dificultades, su esposa es una mujer humilde, trabajadora y honesta, junto a ella tiene 2 hijos, uno de ellos todavía estudia y el otro decidió ayudarle en la agricultura.

Rosalí, es agricultor, su padre le enseño este oficio desde que era muy pequeño, pero aparte de eso también se dedica a la crianza y engorde de cerdos, para venderlos a un mejor precio.

Él necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, pesticidas, herbicidas para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de granos básicos, aunque el invierno no ha sido muy bien.

Rosalí, desea que el invierno sea favorable, para poder obtener una buena cosecha, ya que de  los primero cultivos que sembró no cosecho nada.
texts.en:
Rosalí, 43, only has a second grade education, due to various hardships. His wife is a modest woman who is hardworking and honest. Together they have two children, one who attends school and another who decided to help on the farm.

Rosalí is a farmer and his father taught him this trade when he was very young. In addition to that, he also makes a living raising and fattening pigs to sell for a higher price.

He needs the loan to buy farming supplies such as manure, pesticides and herbicides to plant 7,000 square meters of staple grains, even though the winter has not been very good.

Rosalí hopes that the winter is favorable so he can get a good crop, because he did not harvest anything from the first crops he grew.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as manure, pesticides and herbicides to plant 7,000 square meters of staple grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in shoe making supplies, including leather, string, rubber and paint, among others.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Reina, de 43 años de edad, está acompañada, estudio hasta bachillerato, su compañero de vida trabaja en una óptica, juntos tienen dos hijos, uno ya está casado y el otro vive con ellos y estudian bachillerato.

Reina, tiene una venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 8 años, este negocio lo tenía su mamá, pero cuando falleció ella decidió continuar con el desde su casa, anteriormente ella era empleada en una empresa financiera.

Reina, necesita el préstamo para comprar frutas y verduras y para hacer una tarima, debido a que las que tiene no son suficientes para tener el producto.

El sueño de Reina, es terminar de pagar su casa al fondo social para la vivienda y comprar un vehículo para salir a los pueblos a vender verduras y frutas.
texts.en:
Reina, 43 years old, is partnered, went to school through secondary school, and her life partner works as an optician. They have two children together, one who is already married and the other lives with them and is in secondary school.

Reina has sold fruits and vegetables for 8 years, her mom had this business, but when she died she decided to continue it from her house. Previously she was an employee in a financial business.

Reina needs the loan to purchase fruits and vegetables and to make a platform since the one she has now is not enough to hold the product.

Reina's dream is to finish paying off her house to the housing fund and to purchase a vehicle to leave the towns to sell fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetable and to make a platform since the one she has is not enough to hold the product.

loans.name: Rean

texts.en: Elissaint is a 56-year old man who lives in a rural area in Haiti. He is the leader of a community-based Village Savings and Loan Association that is composed of 17 men and 8 women. Elissaint has a small hardware store. He buys and resells home articles. With the profits made last year, he was able to pay school fees for two children. This year, he would like to find a soft loan inside the group to open a new store in a niche. If the loan is granted, he will be able to run bigger businesses and generate higher incomes to support his family's expenses and his children's school fees. Elissaint(middle) is pictured with Belo (left) and Gerald (right), as representatives of this group. They are linked to ZAFEN.

loans.use: To buy hundreds of hardware articles to retail.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is a 40-year-old woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married and has three children, ages 4, 17, and 18. When her children were still young, she began farming seaweed as a business. She also helps her husband in their fishing business. Merlinda is asking for a loan to use as additional capital to buy rope, straw, and seaweed seedlings. Any profit will be used for her family's healthy meals and for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy rope, straw and seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: Las Luchadoras De Santa Cruz Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 5 mujeres  responsables de distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “LAS LUCHADORAS DE SANTA CRUZ” una de ellas es la Sra. Alberta  de 26 años soltera  y con 1 hija pequeña, la Sra. Alberta  se dedica ya hace 2 años a la venta de productos de belleza. Con el mérito de salir adelante y así poder mantener a su  pequeña hija. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo la Sra. Alberta   ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y seguir incrementando más productos para su venta. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más productos de belleza  y así poder generar más ingresos. La  Sra. Alberta es la primera de la mano derecha la que lleva un bebe vestido de rosado. Se despide con un abrazo a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso y promete que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Luchadoras De Santa Cruz comprises five women who all run different businesses.

Alberta is one of the members of this group. She is 26 years old and the single mother of one little girl. For the past two years, Alberta has been working selling beauty supplies in order to get ahead and provide for her young daughter. Alberta's efforts have been fruitful in that she has been able to improve her housing situation and to continue adding products to sell.

She will use this loan to invest in purchasing more beauty supplies so that she can generate more income.

In the picture, Alberta is the first person from the right, holding a baby dressed in pink. She wants to send a hug to Kiva and Edaprospo, and to express her gratitude for their support because it makes her progress possible. She promises to achieve all of her set goals.

loans.use: buy more beauty supplies.

loans.name: Leotele

texts.en: Leotele is 53 years old with three children. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Leotele requested a loan to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals, to help her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2015 and hopes to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals,.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 20 años de edad, de nacionalidad colombiana, ella y su familia son residentes en el país, en condición especial como refugiados desde hace 3 años. Actualmente vive con su padre y su hermana. Claudia recién concluyo el bachiller universitario en estudios del idioma Inglés, además se prepara para ingresar a la carrera de enfermería en La Universidad de Costa Rica, institución que luego de un estudio socioeconómico le brindo el beneficio de una beca estudiantil, de lo contrario sería muy difícil para su padre podre solventar sus estudios, dado que asume además los gastos de su hermana que cursa la secundaria. Ella heredo de su padre el espíritu emprendedor y ambos trabajan en una pequeña empresa familiar en la cual fábrica, vende y distribuye golosinas. Productos Barrera a 3 años de iniciar sus operaciones, ha logrado darse a conocer y ganar la aceptación de los clientes, ofrece 2 diferentes tipos de golosinas, el producto estrella es el arequipe, como se le llama en Colombia al dulce de leche y el postre de fresas, producción de la que hizo cargo Claudia, hace poco más de un año. Este postre de fresas es una combinación entre gelatina y mermelada, que tiene mucha aceptación en el mercado. La pequeña fábrica está ubicada en el patio de la casa donde habita la familia,  cabe mencionar que dicha propiedad es alquilada, cuenta con maquinaria de fabricación artesanal adecuada al tipo de producción y empacado de los productos,  actualmente se pone a disposición de los clientes 2 tipos de dulces, en 10 diferentes presentaciones. El objetivo de Claudia es trabajar con su padre, fortalecer la línea de productos y aumentar la producción, con esto podría continuar con sus estudios y generar más ingresos para su familia. Por su corta edad y poco tiempo en el país no cuenta con historial crediticio, manifiestan que este es el primer crédito que solicita. Que será invertido en reforzar el capital de trabajo, para aumentar el volumen de fabricación. 
Claudia y su padre como dueños del negocio procuran recuperar la mayor cantidad de empaques de la presentación en six pack para ser reutilizados, de la misma forma el cartón de etiquetado de la presentación en tiras de 6 postres. Aunado a que las máquinas utilizadas en el proceso de fabricación no produce ningún tipo de contaminación, todo esto con la idea de perseverar el medio ambiente.
texts.en:
Claudia is 20 years old. She is Colombian and she and her family are residents of the country as of 3 years ago as refugees. Now she lives with her father and sister. Claudia recently received her college degree in English, and she is getting ready to start Nursing at the University of Costa Rica. It is a school that gives her a socioeconomic study as well as the benefit of a student scholarship. On the other hand, it would be very difficult for her Dad to pay for her studies since he also bears the costs of her sister's high school expenses.

She inherited her father's entrepreneurial spirit and together they work in a small family business where she makes, sells and distributes sweets. Productos Barrera, within 3 years of starting up, has managed to make itself known and gain the acceptance of the customers. They offer 2 different types of sweets. The flagship products are the dulce de leche, or "arequipe," as it is called in Colombia, and a strawberry dessert that Claudia took over production of more than a year ago. This strawberry dessert is a combination of gelatin and marmalade, and has a lot of acceptance in the market.

The small factory is located in the patio of the family's house. It should be mentioned that this property is rented. It has handcrafted machinery suitable for the type of production and product packaging. Currently, the two types of sweets are available to the customers, in 10 different presentations.

Claudia's goal is to work with her father, strengthening the product line and increasing production. With this, she can continue with her studies and get more income for the family. Because of her young age and little time in the country, she does not have any credit history. She expresses that this is the first loan she has asked for, which will be used to reinforce the work earnings, to increase manufacturing volume.

Claudia and her father, as owners of the business, are looking to recover as much of the six pack packaging for reuse, as well as the carton labeling strips in 6 of the desserts. In addition, the machines used in the manufacturing process do not produce any pollution, all with the idea of preserving the environment.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials for preparation, as well as product packaging.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra, de 48 años de edad, no estudio, estaba acompañada, pero su pareja falleció, actualmente tiene tres hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos ya no viven con ella porque están casados y solo uno de ellos todavía vive junto a ella.

Alejandra, desde que era muy joven era muy trabajadora, anteriormente vendía pupusas con su mamá, para suplir las necesidades básicas del hogar, pero desde hace un tiempo atras, ha iniciado otro negocio que considera será rentable, el cual es la venta de helados, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en este negocio.

Alejandra, necesita el crédito para comprar productos helados, para vender, porque se quedó sin productos.

Ella sueña con mejorar su negocio de helados y tener un local fijo.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 48 years old and did not attend school. She was married, but her partner died. She currently has three children. One still lives with her and the other two are married and have their own homes.

Alejandra was very hardworking since she was young. She got up early to work at a food stand in the market. After working at a restaurant, she worked as a domestic employee in a rich person's home. Later, her partner died and she became the only one responsible for her children, since they were young. For that reason, she decided to open her own business. She now has sold popsicles, sorbets, cones, and other frozen treats for 20 years.

Alejandra is requesting this loan to purchase frozen products to sell, since she does not have any left. Her dream is to improve her business and have a fixed location.

loans.use: to purchase frozen ice cream products to sell, since she does not have any left.

loans.name: Sarwari

texts.en:
Sarwari is a 53-year-old, married lady. Her husband, also shown in the photo, is running a small general store. He offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices, and has attracted many customers. He has a good client list, and earns a sufficient amount of income to bear their household expenditures.

For the improvement of her husband's business, Sarwari requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy stocks of rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make things available for his customers.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make things available for her husband's customers.

loans.name: Song

texts.en: Song is 54 years old, married and has six children. Song is a farmer living in Kampong Speu province. Besides growing rice, Song has worked in handicrafts for 22 years. Recently, the crop has not grown well because of drought so she cannot get good outputs to sell. She has been with VisionFund for three loans already and those previous loans helped her to send her children to school. Now her daughter is studying for a bachelor's degree in English literature at Human Resource University of Cambodia. Due to financial problems, Song is now requesting this new loan to pay her child’s school fee. She hopes that this fourth loan will help her daughter complete her bachelor's degree and get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: to pay school fees to enable her child to complete a bachelor's degree in English literature.

loans.name: Por Un Futuro Mejor 3 Group

texts.en:
Julissa is a member of the group, Por un futuro mejor (For a better future) 3. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, and the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. She makes her home here in a simple structure with one of her two children and her long term partner.

Julissa is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza. She started her business with her owns savings three and a half years ago. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying a hair dryer and hair and beauty products. She will use the profits to provide her children school materials and all that they need to succeed in their studies and to save money for unexpected events. Julissa dreams of having a successful business. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and hair and beauty products.

loans.name: Jose Toribio

texts.es: Jose de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica a la venta de chatarra desde hace 2 años ya tiene clientes establecidos y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de plastico, carton, papel, etc. para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Jose is forty-one years old and lives in his own home with his four children. He has worked for two years selling scrap and already has established customers. He manages to cover some of his household expenses with what he earns from sales. He is asking for a loan to buy plastic, cardboard, paper etc. to continue his sales and to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy plastic, cardboard, paper, etc.

loans.name: Yndira

texts.es:
a socia Yndira se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboración de tejidos,la socia por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de elaboracion de tejidos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar lana de colores y palitos de tejer.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Member Yndira still works knitting fabric. This business allows her to provide for her children. Her dream is to be able to expand her business. She is requesting this loan to buy yarn in different colors and knitting needles. She is happy with this loan and promises to comply with all of her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy yarn in different colors and knitting needles.

loans.name: Jyn Rose

texts.en: Jyn Rose is a resident of Concepcion, Iloilo, where most of the community is engaged in fishing to earn a living. Jyn Rose and her husband are in business to provide for the needs of their children. They use a fish trap known as a bubo to catch fish.  Aside from fishing, Jyn Rose also is engaged in selling dried fish for additional earnings. They are raising four children, ages 12, 10, 7 and 1.  In the future, Jyn Rose wishes to improve their catch to increase their business so she could have enough money to send all her children to college. To reach her goal, she is asking for a loan to repair the fish trap. She also will use the money to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.use: to repair the fish trap and to buy dried fish.

loans.name: Charlet

texts.en:
Charlet is a 53-year-old food kiosk owner at Kilifi, Kenya.

She is a married mother of two who has been in this business for the last two years and is doing well.

This marks her second borrowing after repaying her loan successfully.

She will use the loan to purchase maize, rice, beans, wheat flour and cooking fat and the anticipated profit to educate her children.

She hopes to be successful in business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase maize, rice, beans, wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 66 years old and married with five children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Elif

texts.en:
Elif is married and has one child. She has been selling Amway products for two years. She started this to make a contribution to the family budget and to help with her children's school needs. She expanded her social environment, gained self confidence, and is very happy to make her own money. She loves her job. She says that having good time for her home and her children is one of the advantages of this job. With the help of the third loan, she is planning to buy more products and increase her sales. Her dream is to have her own house.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Elif Hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. İki yıldır Amwey ürünlerinin satışını yapıyor. Ailesine katkı sağlamak ve çocuklarının eğitim ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak için bu işe başlıyor. Çevresi genişliyor, kendine olan güveni artıyor ve kazanmanın çok güzel olduğunu vurguluyor. İşini seviyor. Çocuklarına ve evine rahatlıkla zaman ayırabildiği için bu işin avantajlarının çok olduğunu belirtiyor. Aldığı üçüncü kredi ile tekrardan ürün alıp satışlarını arttıracak. Hayali ev sahibi olmak.

loans.use: to buy Amway products

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is a 40-year-old married woman. Her husband (the man shown with her above) operates a construction business, which is the primary source of their income. Azra's husband is responsible for building the roofs of houses during their construction. In this way, he is able to earn a sufficient income to provide for their family. However, in order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required. For the growth of her husband's business, Azra has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will allow him to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate so he can meet his customers’ demands without any delays.

loans.use: to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate so her husband can meet his customers’ demands without any delays.

loans.name: Jashar

texts.en:
Jashar has been a widower for the last six months. He has two older children, ages 16 and 18 years old.

Based on his family tradition, he plants corn and wheat to sell, and he also has a small farm. His wife was the one who primarily managed the farm, and the family has been mourning her passing, and has not been working. Now, after some months, his daughter, who has finished high school, will try to replace the work her mother did on the farm, and his son will help him to work on the land.

Jashar is requesting a loan in order to purchase a milk cow. He currently has three cows, but he is planning on selling the milk and dairy products in his neighborhood.

Jashar hopes to be able to expand his farm in the future, and he is very grateful and thankful to the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn is a resident of Concepcion, Iloilo in the Philippines. She is married and has six children ranging in age from eleven down to two.

For the past ten years Ronalyn and her husband have fished for a living. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 PHP through Kiva's field partner CEVI to repair their boat and buy an additional bubo, or bamboo fish trap. She wants to increase her earnings so she can send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to repair their boat and buy an additional bubo, or bamboo fish trap.

loans.name: Genebeth

texts.en:
Genebeth is 38 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are in school.

Genebeth is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Genebeth has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Genebeth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 64 years old and married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Tessie has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Tessie has been in this business for 27 years. In the future, Tessie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José es un microempresario residente en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla en donde funciona su negocio de Billar, el cual heredó de su padre y es muy concurrido por vecinos del sector, quienes además de practicar este deporte de mesa, departen con conocidos y amigos mientras consumen bebidas que comercializa en su establecimiento entre ellas cervezas, gaseosas y jugos.  Al inicio de las fiestas navideñas, los Barranquilleros acostumbran a celebrar una vigilia que inicia en la noche del 7 de diciembre con faroles multicolores iluminados por velas en su interior y son colocados en los frentes de las casas y en los andenes para celebrar la Inmaculada Concepción; José elabora estos faroles artesanalmente, con listones de madera dispuestos en forma de pirámide truncada, cuyas caras se forran en papel celofán de colores verde, amarillo, azul o rojo. José de 26 años es un joven dispuesto a crecer comercialmente por su emprendimiento  y dedicación, en la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en surtido de gaseosas, jugos y cervezas.  Esta inversión es muy importante para su negocio al fortalecerle el capital de trabajo y estar más cerca de crecer en su negocio. Su meta personal es continuar estudiando para ser un profesional.
texts.en:
Jose is a micro business owner, a resident in a neighborhood of the municipality of Barranquilla, where he runs his pool hall business. He inherited it from his father, and it is very crowded with neighbors from the area, who besides playing this table sport, spend time with friends and acquaintances while they consume drinks that he sells in his establishment, among them beer, sodas, and juice. 
At the start of the Christmas festivities, the people from Barranquilla typically celebrate with a vigil that starts the night of December 7th with multicolor lanterns illuminated with lights from inside, and which are placed in front of houses and sidewalks to celebrate the Immaculate Conception. Jose makes these artisanal lanterns, with wooden ribbons in the form of a truncated pyramid, whose faces are covered in cellophane paper, in green, yellow, red, or blue colors. 
At 26, Jose is a young man ready to grow commercially because of his hard work and dedication. Currently he is applying for his first credikiva through the Mario Santo Domingo foundation, to invest in a stock of sodas, juice, and beer. This investment is very important for his business, as it strengthens his work capital and takes him a step closer to growing his business.
His personal goal is to continue studying to become a professional.

loans.use: to invest in a stock of sodas, juice, and beer.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 61 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mercedita runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 17,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional goods to sell in her store. She has been in this business for 15 years, and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack food and other groceries.

In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 49 years old, married and has one child. For the past sixteen years she has worked hard fishing to make a living in the Philippines.

Rebecca has applied for a 29,500 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more fishing gear and other equipment. She is saving her money to reinvest in and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her father's breathing treatments.

loans.name: Shahid

texts.en:
Shahid is a 53-year-old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a van driver by profession.

He drives in the main city, and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. He wants to change the van's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil.

That is why Shahid has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband to buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to his customers. Shahid is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband, and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to her busband's customers.

loans.name: Naik

texts.en: Naik is 54 years old and a widow. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Now, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Naik expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Born in 1980, Ahmad lives with his wife and three daughters in a camp for the Palestinian refugees located in North Lebanon in a small apartment provided by the United Nations Reliefs and Works Agency (UNRWA). He and his wife have always put their daughter's education as a priority and both make sacrifices to make sure they can finance the school tuition.

Ahmad established his own stone factory in 2008 after working in the field for 20 years. Due to the power outages faced in the camp, which reflect negatively on Ahmad's productivity, Ahmad decided to ask for the first time for a 1,234,994 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva's partner Ibdaa. That way he will be able to buy an electric generator, which will give him more time to work in his factory and help him increase his productivity, his profit and his income.

Ahmad aims to develop and sustain his factory. He is an ambitious man who works in a professional way, and does his best to get good clients and projects.

loans.use: to buy an electric generator for his stone factory.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen de Rosario está integrado por 16 mujeres, todas ellas mujeres y jefas de familia que se unieron para poder trabajar de manera conjunta y unida, y a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lidia, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de su venta de prendas variadas que hace se gana la vida de una manera honrada. Lidia es una mujer muy luchadora que poco apoco se ha ido abriendo camino y hoy ya tiene una buena clientela formada.
La Sra. Lidia  solicita de este préstamo para la compra de Ropas para damas, caballero y niños para su posterior venta, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group named “Virgen de Rosario” consists of 16 members. These women are the heads of their families and have joined together so that they can work in a cooperative and unified manner as part of the poverty elimination program.

One of the members is Sra. Lidia. Through her effort and continuous work in her business of selling various types of clothes, she is able to earn an honest living. Lidia is a determined woman who has gradually been able to make a path for herself. Today she has an established clientele.

Sra. Lidia is requesting a loan in order to buy clothes for women, men, and children for eventual resale. This will help her to solidify her business plan and allow her to improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy clothes for women, men, and children for eventual resale.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La socia Sandra se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de medicinas, la socia es una muy trabajadora que por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia tener mas farmacias. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar medicamentos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sandra continues to work in medicine sales. She is a hard-working woman, who, through this business, provides for her family. She dreams of having more pharmacies. 

She is requesting a loan to buy medicines.

Sandra is happy to get this loan and is committed to meet her repayments.

loans.use: to buy medicines.

loans.name: Los Arbolitos Group

texts.es:
El Estado de México es una de las entidades con mayor riqueza cultural indígena, en una localidad en específico se mantienen los usos y costumbres mazahuas. La lengua originaria es símbolo de orgullo e identidad entre los habitantes y es muy interesante escuchar alguna conversación entre ellos.
   Magdalena es  una mujer muy trabajadora quien siempre se encuentra de muy buen humor. Está felizmente casada con el señor Baldomero desde hace 24 años, juntos tienen tres hijos los cuales continúan estudiando. 
   Desde que recuerda mostró un enorme gusto por las ventas, comenta “siempre tuve la iniciativa de emprender un negocio, tuve la oportunidad de conocer a una amiga que vendía productos de belleza, ella me recomendó la actividad y fue así como inicié". Actualmente tiene 15 años de experiencia en dicho negocio, cada mes adquiere un nuevo catálogo, gracias a su prestamo comprara catalogos y productos de belleza, para mostrar los productos a sus amigos, familiares, vecinos y conocidos y aprovecha cualquier lugar como escuelas, clínicas y casas. La forma de vender también le ha dado grandes beneficios ya que ofrece que sus clientes puedan realizar pagos sin intereses. 
Doña Magdalena quiere apoyar en todo lo que sea posible a su hijo pues ha obtenido excelentes notas en la preparatoria y desea que curse una carrera universitaria. El lograr ver a su hijo graduado, es el mayor sueño que alberga y es por ello que día con día entrega lo mejor de sí para lograrlo. 
   Los otros integrantes del grupo Los Arbolitos son Maximino quien invertiría en una tienda de abarrotes; Ángela, en bordados artesanales y Julia en pollos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en la tienda de Don Maximino, Doña Magdalena es quien viste un pantalón color gris.
texts.en:
The state of Mexico is one of the regions with the greatest wealth of indigenous culture. In one particular area the traditions of the mazahuas is still maintained. The original language is a symbol of pride and identity among the locals and it is really interesting to listen to conversation between them.

Magdalena is a very hardworking woman who always is in good humor. She has been happily married to her husband Baldomero for 24 years, and together they have three children who continue studying.

As long as she can remember, she has always liked sales. She commented, "I always had the initiative to start a business. I had the chance to meet a friend who sold beauty products. She recommended this activity to me and that was how I started." She currently has 15 years of experience in this business. Each month she gets a new catalog to show the products to her friends, family, neighbors and acquaintances and she takes advantage of any place such as schools, clinics and houses. The method of selling also has given her great advantages since it allows her customers to make payments without interest.

Magdalena wants to support her son as much as possible, since he has earned excellent grades in high school and she wants him to attend college. Getting to see her son graduate is her biggest dream and she gives her best every day to achieve it.

The other members of the group Los Arbolitos are Maximino, who will invest in a grocery store; Angela, in artisanal embroidery and Julia in chickens.

*The photo was taken in the store of Maximino. Magdalena is dressed in gray pants

loans.use: para comprar catalogos y productos de belleza.

location.town: Tres Estrellas, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is indeed grateful to Kiva and CCT (Center for Community Transformation) for their continued moral and financial support. They have greatly helped her to persevere in life. The proceeds of her loans have sustained her livelihood as a "buko" (coconut) dealer.

Although she sometimes encounters difficulty when some orders are cancelled, she does not lose heart. She knows that the cancellation will be offset by her good customers. Summer can be really hot in the Philippines, and coconut juice is the most refreshing drink enjoyed by both local people and foreigners. To sustain her business, she is again seeking your assistance in the amount of 19,000 PHP to pay for several sacks of "buko" from farm owners. She trusts that you will consider her request, as it will help meet her family's basic needs.

Teresita's simple dream is to grow her business to provide for their daily needs. She prays that she and her family will grow in their relationship with God. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts for resale in her business.

loans.name: Karen Fernanda

texts.es:
Karen es una joven  mujer de 18 años, es soltera vive en casa de los padres desde hace algún tiempo, nació en la ciudad de Latacunga en la parroquia La Matriz, actualmente está estudiando en la universidad y es ella quien se paga sus estudios y a la vez se dedica a la preparación de comida tiene un pequeño restaurante desde hace seis meses, esta actividad la realiza todos los días y los fines de semana.
Por motivos económicos muy duros en su familia  tuvo que trabajar desde muy temprana edad y así poder ayudar en los gastos del hogar, este negocio ha sido su gran ayuda y es por eso que hoy solicita un crédito para invertir en  la compra de una cocina nueva, mesas, sillas, lo cual le ayudará a tener una mejor atención a sus clientes.
Tiene buenas referencias del sector, tiene capacidad y carácter de pago por el trabajo extra que ella realiza, agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a KIVA por la ayuda que le brindan ya que podrá cumplir uno de sus tantos sueños emprendedores.
texts.en:
Karen is an 18-year-old woman. She is single, and has lived in her parents’ house for some time. She was born in the city of Latacunga in the parish of La Matriz. Currently she is studying at university and she pays for her studies, and at the same time works in food preparation. She had has a small restaurant for six months. She does this work every day and on the weekends. Because of difficult economic reasons in her family she had to start working from a young age, to be able to help with household expenses. This business has been a great help and it why today she asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of a new kitchen, tables, chairs, which will help her have a better customer care. 
She has good references in the sector, and she has the ability and character for the extra work that she does. She is grateful to Fundacion Alternativa and to KIVA for the help they bring to her, as she will be able to meet one of her many entrepreneurial dreams.

loans.use: Para la compra de una cocina, mesas y sillas para poder dar una mejor atención a sus clientes

loans.name: Combattant

texts.en: Elda is 37 years old and she is a single mother. Like many Zafen borrowers, Elda is member of a village savings and loan association located in Leogane, a rural suburb in Port-au-Prince. Her group fully repaid its first credit of $800 in Zafen last year. As the new school year is dawning, she has applied for a second loan in order to find funds to feed her children, pay for transportation and pay school fees. Moreover, the credit will increase the inventory of her small economic activity.
