From left to right, the committee members are portrayed as such: Elda(featured person), Gislaine, Jocelyne, Francoise and Rose. All four other members are involved in retail economic activities as well.

loans.use: To buy 100 racks of beauty lotions to retail

loans.name: Ey's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Ey is 33 years old and a mother of two children, one of whom is in school while the other is still too young to attend. For the past ten years she has been farming rice to support her family. She also works as a laborer to earn extra money. She earns around 9 USD a day and saves about 4 USD of that after subtracting her expenses.

This is Ey’s second loan through Kiva's field partner VisionFund Cambodia. With her past loan she was able to build up her farm and send her older child to school. She is the leader of this group of three and is now applying for a 5,100,000 KHR loan to be split among her partners. She will use her portion to buy seed and fertilizer and pay for laborers to enhance the productivity of her crops. With her profits she hopes to raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer and pay for laborers to enhance the productivity of her crops.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
At the age of 44, Sun resides in a rural village of Kampong Cham province, and she is a mother of five dependent children. Nowadays, she does rice farmimg and has worked at a garment factory to support her living conditions for 26 years.

The price of crops is decreasing, so she may earn less than expected. She is able to generate only about $9.00 USD per day to provide for her family’s needs.

She is now applying for a loan with VisionFund, which is the first time for her, and she will use it to buy a decent motorbike to drive herself to work on time. She hopes that this loan will help her to save more money by reducing the cost of transportation and allowing her to save for future needs.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike to drive to work on time and to save more money by reducing the cost of transportation,  so as to save for future needs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Yongondeme Group

texts.fr:
SALIF  C’est  lui   qui   est  en  débarder  orange  et  le  chapeau  à la tête    sur  la  photo.  Il  est  âge  de  27  ans.  Il  a  un  seul  enfant   en  charge,  son  activité  est  l’ agriculture,  il  veut  cultiver  le  cesâmes  comme  activité  principale. Pour  le  moment  il  n’a  pas  un  enfant  scolarisé, lui-même  n’a pas  été a  l’école. Il est  très  courageux  dans  son  activité. Sa  femme  est  ménagère ,  elle  aide  son  mari  dans  son  activité  agricole. Son  lieu  de  travail  est  un   près  de  son  village. Il  souhaite  avoir 300 000  FCFA  comme  intérêt si  l’hivernage  se  passe  dans  les  condition  normales. IL  a fait  recourt  au  RMCR  pour  acheter des semences et cultiver son champs.  Il  souhaite  assurer   avenir  de  ces enfant dans  les  jours  à  venir. 

NB:c'est le cesâmes qu'il cultive.C'est un produit agricole, s' il fait une bonne récolte dans son champs, à la vente son rêve est d'avoir 300000fCFA comme bénéfice.
texts.en: Salif is the man who is wearing the orange tank top and the hat in the picture. He is 27 years old and is raising one child. He is a farmer and wants to cultivate sesame as his main crop. His child currently does not go to school, Salif himself did not get an education. He is very hard-working. His wife is a housewife who helps her husband with his farming activities. His workplace is near his village. If they have a normal rainy season, he hopes to make 300 000 francs. He is turning to RMCR in order to buy seeds and cultivate his field. He would like to ensure his child's prospects in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds for his field.

loans.name: Ndiambou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement a été créé en 2013. Elle regroupe 18 femmes issues toutes du même village. Leur activité principal est le commerce de détail.
est la représentante du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 5 enfants dont 4 garçons. Sur la photo elle se trouve a gauche et a levé la main droite.

Mariatou fabrique de l'huile à base local. Elle achète l'arachide dans les marché hebdomadaire pour le transformer en huile.

Les bénéfice du prêt serviront a la nourriture des ses enfants, à l'épargne.
texts.en:
The group was created in 2013 and is composed of 18 women who come from the same village. They work primarily in retail commerce.

Mariatou is the featured borrower. She is 49 years old and she is a widow with five children--four sons and one daughter. In the photo she is found on the left with her hand raised.

Mariatou makes oil from local products. She buys groundnuts from the weekly markets and makes them into oil.

Earnings from the loan will feed her children and help her to save.

loans.use: to buy 200 kilograms of groundnuts to make into oil.

loans.name: Oumou's Group

texts.fr:
le banc villageois est créé en 2007. Les membres qui la compose sont issus du même village. Elle ont comme activités le commerce de détail et l'agriculture.

Niakhalin la représentante du groupe est célibataire, elle est mère d'un garçon âgé d'un mois. Sur la photo elle se trouve à droite et est habillée en rouge, levant la main droite.Comme activité elle vend des tissus teintés appelé thioub.

 Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter 3 lots de tissus à 20000fcfa l'unité.

Les bénéfices de cette activité seront épargnés.
texts.en:
This banc villageois was created in 2007. Its members all come from the same village and work primarily in retail commerce and agriculture.

Niakhalin is the featured borrower. In the photo, she is found on the right dressed in red with her hand raised.
She is single and has a son who is one month old.

Niakhalin works selling dyed fabrics called thioub. With this loan she plans to buy three bundles of fabric for 20,000 francs CFA each.

Earnings will be put into savings.

loans.use: to buy three bundles of fabric.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 26 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 28 décembre 2009. Il est composé de femmes  qui habitent le même quartier. Les membres vivent dans  la bonne entente et sont solidaires. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce, l’élevage et l'agriculture.
SATOU  debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 2  filles.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle compte acheter de l’oseille, du gingembre et du tamarin pour des jus de fruit et les embouteiller. Elle va acheter 12 kilo d’oseille à 900 FCFA le kilo et 2 kilo de sucre pour chaque litre, le kilo de sucre à 600 FCFA. Après transformation elle obtient trente bouteilles qu’elle va revendre l’unité à 2 000 FCFA. Elle fait la même chose pour le gingembre, cependant elle achète le kilo à 1300 FCFA et aussi 1 kilo et demi de sucre pour chaque litre. Elle obtient trente bouteilles revendues à 2 000 FCFA l’unité. Elle achète enfin 3 kilo de tamarin, le kilo à 500 FCFA et elle achète pour chaque litre un kilo de sucre. Après transformation, elle a dix bouteilles revendues à 2 000 FCFA l’unité. 
Les bénéfices serviront à répondre aux charges familiales et à épargner.
texts.en:
This 26-member group is part of a banc villageois created on December 28, 2009. It is composed of women who live in the same neighborhood. The members live together in goodwill and solidarity. Their main businesses are commerce, livestock farming, and agriculture.

Satou, standing on the right side of the photo and raising her left hand, is 45 years old. She is married and has two daughters.

With this loan, she means to buy sorrel, ginger, and tamarind to make and bottle fruit juices. She will buy 12 kilos of sorrel for 900 FCFA per kilo, and 2 kilos of sugar for 600 FCFA per kilo, for each liter of juice. After the juice is made, she will make thirty bottles that she will resell for 2,000 FCFA each. She will do the same for the ginger, except she will buy it at 1,300 FCFA per kilo, and 1.5 kilos of sugar for each liter of juice. She will make and sell thirty bottles at 2,000 FCFA each. Finally, she will buy 3 kilos of tamarind for 500 FCFA per kilo, and one kilo of sugar for each liter of juice. After the juice is made, she will sell ten bottles for 2,000 FCFA each.
The profits will be used for her family's expenses, and the rest will be put into savings.

loans.use: to buy various fruits to produce fruit juice

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: S’approvisionner en savons en poudre, laits nido,bonbons, etc.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 47 years old, married with seven children.

Vilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Vilma has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice and sugarcane.

Vilma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Nilgün

texts.en:
Nilgün is married and a mother of two. She sells cosmetics and beauty products via a network system.

She builds teams of women like her to conduct the same business, and to enable them to earn money. With the help of the loan, she is planning to buy bulk cosmetics and beauty products, sell them, make money and develop her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nilgün hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Nilgün hanım network işi ile kozmetik ve güzellik ürünleri pazarlaması yapıyor. Network işinde ürün satışı ve kendisi gibi kadınlarında satış yapması için ekip kuruyor ve onlarında satış yapmasına imkan sağlıyor. Aldığı mikro kredi ile toptan kozmetik ve güzellik ürünleri alarak ve satarak para kazanmak ve işini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Soké

texts.fr: Soké est une femme mariée résidant à Tokoin avec un enfant à charge. Soké est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne quatre  fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile. Pour financer son achat, Soké  nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois afin réaliser plus de bénéfice et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation à son enfant.
texts.en:
Soké is a married woman living in Tokoin with one dependent child.

Soké is a charcoal retailer. She procures her merchandise four times a month from the market, and resells from home.

Soké needs this loan to finance her purchase. She will order bags of charcoal to retail, earn more, and help her husband with the family's expenses, as well as allow a good education for her child.

loans.use: to purchase five bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Filiz

texts.en:
Filiz is married and a mother of two. Her husband works in a factory. When her children started school they had a financial crisis and Filiz had to work. She makes a contribution to the family budget by selling cosmetics and beauty products via a network system. With the help of the loan she is planning to buy bulks of cosmetics and beauty products, sell them, make money and improve her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Filiz hanım evli ve iki çocuk annesi. Eşi bir fabrikada işçi olarak çalışıyor. Çocukları okula başlayınca ekonomik olarak krize giriyorlar. Filiz hanım çalışmak zorunda kalıyor. Network işi ile kozmetik ve güzellik ürünleri satarak aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor. Aldığı mikro kredi ile toptan kozmetik ve güzellik ürünleri alarak ve satarak para kazanmak ve işini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Abigail

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 40 ans, Abigail est une femme qui a un enfant à charge. Habitant à Tokoin, Abigail prépare et vend de la pâte bandée dans son quartier afin d’avoir une bonne rentabilité. Abigail s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour commander quelques sacs de maïs, Abigail sollicite ce prêt pour réaliser son achat afin de gagner plus de revenus pour faire face aux besoins de son enfant.
texts.en:
Married and forty-five years old, Abigail is a woman with one dependent child. She lives in Tokoin.

Abigail prepares and sells "pâte bandée" (a corn-based dish) in her neighborhood. To have a good profitability, Abigail procures her supplies fourth times a month from the market.

Abigail is requesting this loan to order more bags of corn. Making the purchase will allow her to earn more money and support her child.

loans.use: to buy five bowls of corn.

loans.name: Dexter

texts.en: With his desire to expand his business and serve his customers, Dexter wishes for additional computer units in his stall. This reason has driven him to borrow a loan of P25,000 to buy one computer for his computer shop business. Dexter has been operating the business for six years. His goal is to grow the business to have a lifetime source of income. His profit from the business serves his family needs, and he will save some of it for his child's education in the future.

loans.use: to buy one unit of computer for his computer shop business.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita raises and sells pigs to earn a living. She also runs a sari-sari(variety) store, selling commodities like seasonings, toiletries, biscuits, candies, sugar, and toiletries. She is a married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 25 and the youngest is 16. She hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed, piglets, and supplies like soft drinks, liquor, canned goods and noodles. With these, she could maintain the stocks of her store and be able to raise quality hogs. Thus, she could be able to provide healthy meals and continue to support the education of her children.

She is determined that she could expand her business for the welfare of her whole family.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, piglets, and supplies like soft drinks, liquor, canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.en:
Timoteo is a resident of Trinidad, Bohol. He is married with two children; the youngest is 21 years old.

Timoteo has been farming rice and vegetables to earn a living. He works hard to provide for his family, since his youngest is still attending college. He is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer and to pay for school fees.

Timoteo is expecting to have a boost in his business with the help of the loan. His harvest will give him food to eat and income for household expenses and school fees.

In the future, he hopes to continue and expand his business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer and to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin is a 36-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband. She has been helping in her husband's business of furniture making. They have been doing it together for many years. Over time they have become famous for providing good quality furniture in her community. She is a responsible mother of 4 children and is liable to provide them with the basic necessities of life.

Currently she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf foundation to purchase good quality wood along with packs of polish and nails in larger quantity to increase their production. In this way they would be able to cater to more customers without delay which ultimately helps in bringing more cash home. Yasmin dreams of providing a bright and prosperous future to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood along with packs of polish and nails in larger quantity to increase their furniture production.

loans.name: Rajan

texts.en:
Rajan is a 46-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all the household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good-quality milk in her locality.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité es un grupo nuevo, las integrantes se unieron para poder mejorar sus vidas a través del trabajo en conjunto, son de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una zona rural alejada, que aún está en crecimiento, de difícil acceso.
La Sra. Elena es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a criar animales,  comenta que poco a poco esta luchando para poder crecer y darle a su familia una vida digna y sin necesidades. Sabe que aunque su trabajo es muy humilde, es honrado y digno.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar balanceados para sus animales y también para comprar animales para la cría. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de capacitarse y poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The communal bank is a new group. The members joined the group for the purpose of improving their lives by working together. They are from the city of Curuguaty, a remote rural area, that is still growing, and difficult to get to.

Elena is one of the members, and she raises animals. She says that she is striving to grow, little by little, and provide her family with a decent life free from privations. She knows that although her work is very humble, it is honest and decent.

She is requesting this loan to buy balanced feed for her livestock, and also to buy animals to raise. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be trained, to be able to grow and to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy livestock for raising, as well as balanced feed

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a 47-year-old charcoal dealer in Kilifi, Kenya. She is a widow with three children. She has been in this business for the last eight years and is doing very well.

This is her second loan to finance her business. She will use the money to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale and will use the anticipated profit to educate her children. She hopes to see her children get a good education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is 43 years old and married with three children. All of her three children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Melody is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Melody has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo). Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop.

Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good-quality products, and they make enough to meet the expenses of their eight children.

Currently, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more grocery items, including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea, to cater to the maximum number of customers for generating a healthier source of income.

She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items, including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea, to cater to the maximum number of customers for generating a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Jelisa

texts.en:
Jelisa is 50 years old and married with four children; one child is still in school. Jelisa works very hard to provide for them.

Jelisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo, bread, eggs, etc.

Jelisa has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo, bread, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 53 years old and married with three children.

Josefina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo, bread, eggs, etc.

Josefina has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from auto repair and cake vending.

Josefina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo, bread, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 30 years old and married.

Lea is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine, and other supplies to raise her pig.

Lea has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine, and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy one bale of shoes

loans.name: Ruth De Kuiti Group

texts.fr:
Mme S.LUCIENNE est la nouvelle représentante du groupe RUTH DE  KUITI. Elle a remplacée Mme RUTH qui était l'ancienne responsable du groupe. Mme S.LUCIENNE est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 18 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 03 enfants vont à l’école  et elle a 06 personnes en charge.
Mme fait du jardinage et pratique aussi l’élevage depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte acheter 03 sacs d’engrais, 01 boîte d’oignon et 01 boîte de choux.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne acheter une moto.
texts.en:
Lucienne is the new representative of the Ruth de Kuiti group. She replaced Mrs Ruth who was the old group leader. Lucienne is married and the mother of four children. The eldest is 18 years old and the youngest is 2 years old. Three children attend school, and she is responsible for six persons.
She has been a gardener and also reared livestock for over ten years. She gets her supplies at the neighbouring markets. With the money from the loan, she intends to buy three bags of fertilizer, one box of onions and one box of cabbage.
She wants to use the income from the loan to build her activity. She also wishes to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy three bags of fertilizer, one box of onions and one box of cabbage

loans.name: Wend Ya Wende Group

texts.fr: Mariam est une femme âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère d'un enfant. elle exerce son activité depuis 15 ans.ce que qui fait marcher son  activité c'est l'emplacement de  son restaurant dans une gare ou il ya des ouvriers et des transporteur, elle diversifie ses plats et les clients aiment le goût particulier qui ya dans sa nourriture, elle est toujours propre et maintient son lieu de commerce propre. elle veut le prêt pour acheter des condiments et divers à 50 000 F et le reste des 100 000 f pour acheter des sacs de riz et des paquets de spaghetti. l'utilité du prêt c'est de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin de renforcer son activité. elle a déjà reçu le prêt deux fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Mariam is a woman of 40, married and the mother of one child. She has been in her business for 15 years. What makes her activity do well is the location of the restaurant in a station where there are workmen and road hauliers. She diversifies her dishes and her clients like the particular taste of her food. She is always clean and keeps her premises clean.

Mariam wants the loan to buy condiments and miscellaneous for 50,000 francs, and she will use the rest of the l00,000 francs to buy sacks of rice and packages of spaghetti. The loan's usefulness is that it will let her purchase a sufficient quantity to reinforce her activity. She has already received a loan twice and has reimbursed ACFIME on the due dates.

loans.use: to purchase condiments and miscellaneous for 50,000 francs, using the remainder to buy rice and spaghetti for 100,000 francs.

loans.name: Esmeralda Group

texts.en:
High in the mountains of Western Guatemala lies the large town of Totonicapán.  Last year, the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Esmeralda” was formed. The ladies requested their very first loan from KIVA and many generous investors responded to their request.  These hardworking small business women have now paid off their loans and are requesting a second one. 

The group elected 35 year old Josefa to be President.  She is married with three children.  Like so many Maya business women, Josefa has a number of small businesses to generate income.  Her principal business is a mini-mart where she sells items needed on a daily basis.  She also has a corn mill to grind corn for masa (to make tortillas and tamales), as well as an animal husbandry business (pigs and cattle).   Her mini-mart is doing well but she needs a loan to increase her inventory to meet the demand of her clientele.  She wants to buy juices, eggs, noodles, rice, sugar, beans, soft drinks, children’s snacks, and other products.  In the short term, Josefa wants to generate enough income from her mini-mart to buy more pigs and bulls to sell and generate more income. 

Josefa and her friends in the Trust Bank look forward to their monthly meetings. After transacting business on their loans, the ladies participate in educational trainings taught by a Facilitator from Friendship Bridge. 

All of the women of “Esmeralda” are extremely grateful to KIVA investors for believing in their ability to progress in their lives, develop their small businesses and raise their standard of living. They are poised to step into a brighter tomorrow, benefitting themselves, their families and their community. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: To increase her mini-mart inventory by buying uices, eggs, noodles, rice, sugar, beans, soft drinks, children’s snacks, and other products

loans.name: Grupo Ilusión De Portes Group

texts.es:
Los productos utilizados para la limpieza del hogar son mejor conocidos en México como productos de jarcieria. Una comunidad mexiquense es famosa debido a que sus habitantes son los principales comerciantes de dicha mercancía, ellos se caracterizan por salir hasta otras localidades en busca de clientes que soliciten, entre otras cosas, trapos de cocina, fibras, cucharas, escobas, jergas, etc. 
   El grupo Ilusión de Portes es originario de la comunidad antes mencionada y está integrado por mujeres trabajadoras cuya alegría es contagiada a quienes las rodean. El nombre fue propuesto por Verónica y responde a la “ilusión” de enriquecer las actividades de los miembros por medio de la oportunidad del préstamo con VF México. 
   Vero, como la llaman de cariño, cuenta con diez años con la venta de tortillas en su comunidad. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la cría de aves pero el negocio no resultó rentable y tiempo después se percató de la falta de negocios que ofrecieran tortillas y masa de maíz. De esta manera comenzó su negocio con mucho éxito, "cuando inicié mis clientes eran muchos y mis ganancias eran muy buenas porque mi negocio era el único, no tenía competencia" comentó entusiasmada. Tras todos sus años de trabajo no sólo ha ganado experiencia, también ganó clientes que, con seguridad, acuden diariamente a comprar su producto. La constancia es otra característica de Vero ya que labora durante todo el año, incluso en días festivos. Su mayor sueño es continuar apoyando a su hija quien se encuentra estudiando derecho en la universidad, de igual forma quiere adquirir un local en donde pueda generar mejores ganancias.
   En esta ocasión desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de gas, papel y maíz para incrementar su producción, sobre todo, para las fiestas patrias de septiembre. 
   Las demás integrantes del grupo son Alicia quien invertirá en una tienda de abarrotes; Sofía y Mayra, en fibras y mallas; María Dolores, en ropa y una farmacia y Claudia, en fibras de aluminio. 
*La fotografía fue tomada dentro de la tortillería de Vero.
texts.en:
The team "Ilusión de Portes" is made up of women who work very hard, but above all, they are always joyous and in high spirits. They live in a very small community, but one with great traditions and customs. Most of the population is engaged in buying and selling cleaning supplies, such as kitchen rags, scrubbers, spoons, etc. There is a large wholesale store that sells all types of cleaning supplies where people buy products to later sell them in other areas of their community.

Veronica was the one who named her team, she says she hopes that with the assistance this loan will provide for each of the team members, they will be able to invest in their businesses and thus get ahead.

Vero, as she is affectionately called, is 42 years old and has been married for 25 years to Mr. Nicanor, who works as a cab driver. Together, they have formed a family with a child who is still in school. 10 years ago, she started selling tortillas, she tells us that before then, she tried raising chickens, but unfortunately, they died due to the cold climate of the region. She noticed there wasn't anyone selling tortillas in her community, that's why she decided to start this business. At the beginning, she bought gas, paper, firewood, corn, etc. with her own savings.
"When I started, I had many clients and my revenue was very good, since mine was the only tortilla shop in the area and i had no competition", Vero happily tells us. "Unfortunately, as time goes by, my revenue has dwindled a little". However throughout those 10 years, she has gained a solid clientele which buys tortillas every day for their family meals. Something she features is that she works the entire year without a day of rest, including holidays.
.
With this loan, she will be able to purchase gas, tortillas, paper and corn, to continue on and she won't have to worry about gathering money to invest in her tortilla shop.
Her biggest dream is to have a formal tortilla factory so that she can continue supporting her daughter, who is presently attending law school.

This is how the members of this team will invest in their businesses: Alicia, in her small grocery store. Sofia and Mayra, in scrubbers and mesh. Maria Dolores, in clothing and pharmacy items and Mrs. Claudia in scrubbers.

*The picture was taken in Vero's tortilla shop.

loans.use: purchase corn, paper, gas, firewood, etc.

location.town: Emilio Portes Gil, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis es un hombre de 50 años de edad, domiciliado en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla en donde funciona su taller de Ebanistería, oficio que aprendió al observar la labor de un carpintero quien le dio la oportunidad de participar en el proceso productivo; cortar, pegar, pulir, armar y pintar.  Cuando se sintió totalmente capacitado para ejercer esta profesión, utilizó unos ahorros producto de sus anteriores empleos y adecuó su taller en el que ofrece los servicios de diseño y elaboración de alcobas, closet, multimuebles, puertas y demás.  Genera sus cobros de contado o conforme al contrato que haya realizado con el cliente y como su capital le es insuficiente para cumplir con la cobertura de pedidos, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para la compra de materia prima, un compresor y una cortadora.  Esta inversión pretende mejorar los tiempos de entrega y con ello la rotación de cartera.  Luis es padre de un hijo de 18 años a quien desea continuar ofreciendo una buena educación y su meta a futuro es construir una vivienda de dos plantas para que en la parte baja funcione su negocio.
texts.en:
Luis is a 50 year-old resident of a neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla where he works in his carpentry workshop.  

This trade he learned by observing the work of a carpenter who gave him the opportunity to participate in the production process: cutting, pasting, polishing, assembling and painting. 

When he felt he was fully qualified to practice the profession, he used his own savings earned from previous jobs and started his own workshop that offers the services of design and development of bedroom sets, closet, room furniture, doors and others. 

His charges his clients in cash or according to the contract that he has made with his client.  Since his capital is enough to meet the coverage of orders, he is implementing his first credikiva, through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, for the purchase of raw materials, a compressor and a cutter. 

This investment aims to improve delivery times and thus portfolio turnover. 

Luis is the father of an 18 year old son whom he wants to continue to offer a good education for.  His future goal is to build a two-story house, so that the lower half will function as his workshop.

loans.use: with the purchase of raw materials, a compressor and a cutter

loans.name: Nora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nora, de 62 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a una escuela, está soltera, tiene 3 hijos, pero actualmente solo una hija vive con ella y trabaja, pero además de ella también viven dos nietas más en su casa. 

Nora, se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa durante muchos años y aprendió desde muy joven, antes tenía una pequeña tienda en su casa, pero por motivos de problemas de delincuencia la cerró, ahora ella sale a vender ropa cada 8 días a otros municipios y viaja en bus desde muy temprano.

El préstamo lo ocupara para comprar ropa como camisas de hombre y faldas para mujeres, está inversión le ayudará porque ahora no cuenta con los recursos necesarios, porque estaba enferma e invirtió en medicinas. 

Los planes para futuro son, tener los insumos para vender y cubrir los gastos del hogar y ayudar a su hija y a sus nietas.
texts.en:
Nora is 62 years old. She didn't have the opportunity to go to school. She is single and has 3 children, but right now only one daughter lives with her, and she works. Two granddaughters also live in her home.

Nora has sold clothing for several years and she learned it when she was very young. Previously, she has a small store in her house, but due to problems with crime, she closed it. Now she goes out to sell clothes every week to other towns and she gets there by bus, leaving very early.

She will use the loan to buy clothing such as men's shirts and women's skirts. This investment will help her because now she doesn't have the necessary resources, because she was sick and she invested in medicine.

Her plans for the future are to have the products to sell and to cover the household expenses and help her daughter and granddaughters.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as men's shirts and women's skirts.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Premier De Luxe Extensions is an upscale hair extension brand, pioneered by Monica. The motivation behind the brand was sparked by a desire to produce celebrity quality hair at an affordable price.

This makes the hair extensions ideal for the everyday woman, who may possess the confidence to be natural, chic and sophisticated at the same time. Not only is Premier De Luxe Extensions the exemplar of sexy, stylish and high quality luxurious extensions but it is also meticulously evaluated to satisfy every woman's hair needs while fitting their budget

Prior to going active duty six years ago, she wanted to own her business when she separated from the military. Monica has been doing hair and hair extensions since the age of 11, and so when she started the business, she knew exactly what women wanted.

The initial process of starting the business was indeed hard. She tried to find a business loan everywhere and was turned down. Monica's Kiva loan will be used to purchase more inventory and for marketing purposes.

Since launching this endeavor, her business started off good and it keeps getting better and better every day. With the purchase of inventory and additional marketing capital, Monica will be able to successfully grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory.

loans.name: Rafiqan

texts.en:
Rafiqan , 63 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base.

In order to avoid shortages, Rafiqan needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc., to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy spices, rice, tomatoes, corn and other ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es: Isidro de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maiz y maicillo desde hace 25 años comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene clientes establecidos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de insumos agricolas como: semillas, fertilizantes, abonos y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografia y asi tener una buena cosecha para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Isidro, 53 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and their four children. He has earned his living by growing corn and sorghum for 25 years.

Isidro sells his products in nearby towns and has established customers. With what he earns through sales he can cover some of the costs at home. He is asking for a loan to buy farm materials such as seeds, fertilizers, manure and to improve the soil seen in the photograph. Isidro will then get a better harvest for an improved quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, and manure and to improve the soil.

loans.name: Ana Bertha

texts.es: Ana de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su nieto y su hija quien trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, ella se dedica a la venta de medicinas y productos de uso personal desde hace 12 años, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor como: perfumes, lociones, cremas, desodorantes, medicina, etc.  y asi poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 53, lives in her own home with her daughter and grandson who work and help her financially. Ana has been selling medicines and personal use products for 12 years. She sells them as a street vendor around the different neighbourhoods near her home.

Ana is asking for a loan in order to buy more products in bulk, such as perfumes, lotions, creams, deodorants, medicine etc. and so be able to have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, deodorants, medicine etc.

loans.name: Rina Esperanza

texts.es: Rina de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace 5 años su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logrs solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mazi y frijol para la elaboracion de las pupusas y asi poder seguir con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Rina is 42 years old. She lives in a house that she owns with her husband and three children.

Rina has been making a living selling "pupusas" (a corn tortilla stuffed with meat or beans) for five years. Her business is located in her home and she has many customers.

With income from sales, Rina is able to cover some household costs. She is applying for a loan in order to buy corn and beans to produce "pupusas" and to continue with sales and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos desde hace 25 años comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de abono, herbicidas, insecticidas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografia para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Roberto, 49 years old, lives in his own house with his daughter. He has worked growing basic grains for 25 years. He sells his products in the nearby areas to the zone where he lives. With what he earns from his sales, he manages to cover some of the household expenses. He is asking for a loan to purchase manure, herbicides, insecticides and improve the land which is shown in the photo, to be able to continue with his sales and, so, to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase manure, herbicides, insecticides and improve the land.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María de 56 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su esposo y su nieta de 15 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida gracias a su negocio en el que vende gallinas, patos, golosinas, es así como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que ha llevado todos los insumos básicos a su familia. María desea ampliar su vivienda para brindarles mayor comodidad a su familia, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillos, puertas, ventanas, cemento, hierro, para realizar la ampliación de su vivienda para mayor comodidad de su familia.
texts.en: María is 56 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and her 15 year old granddaughter. She is a hardworking woman who warns her living with her business selling chickens, ducks, and snacks. That is how she generates her income with which she has paid for all of her family's basic needs.  María wants to add on to her house to make her family more comfortable. That is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in bricks, doors, windows, cement, and iron, to add on to her house so her family will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to invest in bricks, doors, windows, cement, and iron to add on to her house so her family will be more comfortable.

loans.name: Jose Remberto

texts.es: Jose de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol desde hace varios años, su padre le ayuda en la siembra, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de insumos agricola, pago de mano de obra y pago de arrendamiento de parcela para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Jose is 35 years old. He lives in his own home with his partner and son. He has been growing corn and beans for several years. His father helps with him with the planting. He sells his products around the area where he lives. With the profits that he obtains, he is able to cover his household expenses. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural supplies, pay for labor, and pay for the lease on a plot of land, to be able to continue his work and therefore have better income.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies, pay for labor, and pay the lease for his plot of land.

loans.name: Elva Del Carmen

texts.es: Elva cuenta con 61 años de edad y vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su hijo, la esposa de este y dos nietos, por lo que se siente feliz de contar con esta compañía, ya que sus nietos son su mayor alegría. Elva se dedica a la venta de ropa y peluches desde hace 5 años, actividad que realiza en los mercados y colonias cercanas, por lo que gracias a su experiencia y buenos precios sus ventas son muy buenas. Elva desea terminar de instalar energía eléctrica, pero además lo que a mayor prioridad desea darle es a la instalación de agua potable, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tuberías, grifos, cable eléctrico y mano de obra para instalar agua potable en su vivienda y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y cuidar de la sanidad de su hogar.
texts.en:
Elva is 61 years old and lives in a house on her property with her son, his wife and two grandchildren. She feels happy to have their company because her grandchildren are her greatest joy. Elva has made a living selling clothing and stuffed animals for 5 years. She does this in the markets and nearby communities and thanks to her experience and good prices, her sales are very good.

Elva wants to finish installing electricity, but installing drinking water carries a greater priority. She is asking for a loan through FUSAI to invest in: pipes, taps, electrical cables and labor to install drinking water in her house. This way she can improve her quality of life and take care of the health of her home.

loans.use: to invest in: pipes, taps, electrical cables and labor to install drinking water in her house.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene de 37 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su hijo de 17 años de edad y su nieta 5 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora  que se gana la vida como empleada de una empresa de diseño gráfico, los ingresos que genera los utiliza para brindarle todo los insumos básicos a su familia y ha sacado adelante a su hijo. Marlene desea realizar unas reparaciones a su vivienda ya que su techo tiene problemas de goteras en época de invierno es por eso que solicito un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, polines, clavos, para realizar las reparaciones del techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Marlene is 37 years old. She lives in her own home with her 17 year old son and her 5 year old granddaughter. She is a hardworking woman who earns a living as an employee at a graphic design business. She uses the income she generates to cover her family's basic needs and she has gotten her son ahead. Marlene wants to make some repairs on her home because her roof has problems with leaks in the winter. That is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in sheeting, rods, and nails to make repairs on the roof of her home.

loans.use: to invest in sheeting, rods, and nails, to make repairs on her home.

loans.name: Artesanos Del Oro Group

texts.es:
En el Estado de México existe un municipio nombrado recientemente “pueblo mágico” debido a su riqueza cultural y sus hermosos paisajes que evocan tranquilidad y alegría. Antiguamente era un pueblo minero cuya principal extracción era el oro, y hoy en día, como testimonio de su pasado, se localiza un vagón de locomotora adaptado como restaurante. Uno de los miembros del grupo Artesanos del Oro ubicado allí comenta, “ese vagón era un cachito de tren que se detuvo y ahora funciona como restaurante, lo mejor del lugar son sus ricos cafés”. 
   Abigail es una joven dedicada a su trabajo y su familia integrada por su esposo Carlos y su pequeño hijo quien acude al prescolar. Actualmente su alegría aumentó pues está esperando gemelos, según le aseguran los médicos. 
    Desde hace 15 años se ha dedicado a la elaboración de artesanías cuya materia prima son el latón y el ocochal, éste último resultado de las hojas de distintos tipos de árboles. Algunos de los productos que realiza son servilleteros, tortilleros, tapetes, porta calientes etc. La idea de comenzar con esta actividad provino de sus padres quienes le enseñaron la técnica y transmitieron la pasión por las artesanías. Su negocio mejoró considerablemente, ahora tiene un taller más grande donde varios miembros de su familia ayudan a la fabricación de la mercancía. "Estoy muy contenta sobretodo porque nos han invitado a expos donde hemos podido dar a conocer nuestros productos, para nosotros la difusión de las artesanías es lo más importante" comentó muy contenta Abigail.
   De igual forma se encuentra agradecida con VF México ya que gracias a los préstamos pudo comprar maquinas pulidoras y utensilios que le eran necesarios. Su meta actual es obtener mayores ingresos con el aumento de la producción, también planea vender en distintas partes de la república y seguir acudiendo a exposiciones. Con la oportunidad del nuevo préstamo compraría más latón para continuar con su labor.
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Tiburcio quien invertirá en artesanías; Antonio, en una veterinaria; Angélica,  en una papelería;  Austroberto, en cerdos; Magalli, en material para artesanías; Ana Laura, en borregos y Carmen, en una carpintería.
*La fotografía muestra algunas artesanías de Abigail quien viste blusa color café a cuadros.
texts.en:
There is a municipality in the State of Mexico recently denominated as a “magic city” due to it's cultural richness and it's beautiful landscape which evokes quietness and joy. It was a mining town before whose main product was gold. And today as testimony to it's past a train car has been adapted as a restaurant. One of the members of the "Artesanos del Oro" group located there said " this wagon is a small piece of a train that stopped and now serves as a restaurant. The tasty coffees are the best thing in the place"

Abigail is a youth who is dedicated to her work and her family which is made up of her husband Carlos and her young son who is in preschool. At present her joy is growing as she is pregnant with twins, the doctors tell her. For 15 years she has been making handicrafts with brass and ocochal as the raw materials. The second material is produced from the leaves of several types of trees. Some of the products she makes are serviette holders, tortillas baskets, rugs, pot holders, etc. The idea to start this business came from her parents who taught her the techniques and instilled her with enthusiasm for handicrafts. Her business has improved considerably and she now has a much larger workshop where different members of the family help making the merchandise. "I am very happy especially since we have been invited to expositions where we have been able to make our product known. For us the dissemination of crafts is the most important" commented Abigail happily.

At the same time she is grateful to VF México as thanks to the loans she could buy polishers and the tools that are necessary. Her current goal is to obtain greater income by increasing production. She also plans to sell in different parts of the Republic while continuing to attend expositions. With the opportunity of the new loan she plans to buy brass to continue her work.

The other members of the group are: Tiburcio who will invest in handicrafts; Antonio who is a veterinarian; Angélica has a stationary shop; Austroberto will invest in pigs; Magalli in materials for crafts; Ana Laura in sheep and Carmen has a carpenter shop.

The photograph shows some of Abigail's crafts. She is wearing the brown checked blouse.

loans.use: to buy brass.

loans.name: Zoila Etelvina

texts.es: Zoila tiene 47 años de edad es casada vive con sus dos hijos ella mantiene su negocio de venta de productos agricolas de la sierra y costa solicita el dinero para aumentar su negocio con mas productos como son papas, zanahoria, col, lechuga. Tener un local grande para su negocio es su sueño. En sus pocos momentos libres pasa con su familia.
texts.en: Zola is 47, married and lives with her two children. She manages a business selling agricultural products from the mountain and coastal regions. She is requesting this money to increase her stock of products such as potatoes, carrots, cabbage and lettuce. Her dream is to have a large location for her business.  She spends the little free time she has with her family.

loans.use: productos como son papas, zanahoria, col, lechuga

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor es un agricultor con más de 30 años de experiencia, reconocido en el sector por su producto el plátano, gracias a estos cultivos que inicio por necesidad económica ha podido generar los recursos necesarios para el mantenimiento de su familia, pero debido a las condiciones climáticas que se viven en estos momentos (sequía), tiene que tomar decisiones y actuar pronto para salvar su cultivo, por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas para darle mantenimiento a sus campos y aplicar productos que hagan más perdurables los productos contra la sequía.
texts.en: Víctor is a farmer with more than 30 years of experience, known in the sector for his product - plantains. Thanks to these crops, which he began from economic necessity, he has been able to generate the necessary resources to support his family. But, due to the climactic conditions they are experiencing at the moment (drought), he has to make decisions and act quickly to save his crops. So, he is asking for a loan to purchase agricultural supplies to provide maintenance to his fields and apply products which make the products more lasting against the drought.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies, necessary to confront the environmental problem at the moment.

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es:
Luis es un joven de 20 años de edad, una persona perseverante y activa que con su negocio de producción de alimentos saca a su familia adelante, a pesar de ser tan joven es padre de dos niños uno de 7 y otro de 1 año de edad, con su negocio genera los ingresos suficiente para el mantenimiento de sus seres amados. 
Luis trabaja para que su familia nunca le falte un bocado de comida, es feliz viendo a sus hijos estudiar y cada que puede invierte capital para mejorar su vivienda.
Con el entusiasmo y el ánimo que siempre lo caracteriza, el señor Luis quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de un molino carnicero, este producto mejorara los tiempos de producción, sacara mayor cantidad de productos diarios y mejorara mucho su utilidad.
texts.en:
Luis is a young man, 20 years old, a persevering and active person who, with his food production business, gets his family ahead. Despite being so young, he is the father of two children, one who is 7 and the other is 1. With his business he generates sufficient income to support his loved ones.

Luis works so that his family never lacks a bite of food. He is happy seeing his children study and whenever he can, he invests capital to improve his house.

With the enthusiasm and energy that always characterizes him, Luis wants to ask for a loan to purchase a meat grinder. This product will improve his production times, it will get out a larger quantity of products daily and will improve his profits a lot.

loans.use: to purchase a meat grinder, this product will improve his production times.

loans.name: Arledys

texts.es:
Arledis es una joven entusiasta y emprendedora que con acciones cambio el futuro de su familia, ella proviene de un hogar humilde, pero con su mentalidad ganadora la conllevaron a iniciar un negocio de venta de panes, los cuales fabrica desde su hogar en el horno que se ve en la foto, vende sus productos desde su hogar y también en tiendas cercanas.
Gracias a los ingresos que genera, en su hogar gozan de una mejor calidad de vida, de una mejor alimentación y lo que la llena de orgullo es que ha podido sacar adelante a sus dos muchachos de 3 y 2 años de edad.
Arledis quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de activos fijos como enseres y latas y un horno para mejorar su producción.
Con este apoyo aumentara su producción, tendrá mejores ventas y probara suerte con sus productos en otros barrios.
texts.en:
Arledis is an enthusiastic and enterprising young woman who, with her actions, changed her family's future. She comes from a humble home, but her winning mentality brought her to begin a business selling bread, which she makes from her home in the oven which is seen in the photo. She sells her products from her home and also in nearby stores.

Thanks to the income that she generates, in her home they enjoy a better quality of life, better nutrition, and what fills her with pride is that she has been able to get her two kids, ages 3 and 2, ahead.

Arledis wants to ask for a loan to purchase fixed assets such as basic tools and cans and an oven to improve her production.

With this support, she will increase her production, she will have better sales and will try her luck with her products in other neighborhoods.

loans.use: to purchase fixed assets such as basic tools and cans and an oven to improve her production.

loans.name: Rovira Emilsen

texts.es: Ella es Emilsen es una empresaria de 37 años de edad que necesita un apoyo económico para dinamizar y aumentar su producción de aves, nunca ha tenido un préstamo con ningún otra entidad, para ella ha sido difícil encontrar ese apoyo para mejorar su negocio, pero ahora que Interactuar está dispuesto a darle una mano dará lo mejor de sí para que empresa mejore y sea lo suficientemente rentable para cubrir las necesidades económicas que se presentan en su hogar el cual está constituido por su pareja con quien vive en unión libre y sus dos amados hijos que son el motor de su vida.
texts.en: Emilsen is a 37-year-old businesswoman who needs a loan to boost and expand her poultry production. She has never had a loan from any other institution. It has been difficult for her to find this support to improve her business, but now Interactuar is ready to give her a hand. She will give the best of herself so that the business improves and is sufficiently profitable to cover the economic needs that come up in her household, which is made up of her partner with whom she lives in a common-law marriage and their two beloved children who are the driving force of her life.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and fattening feed, she wants to improve her rotation of fattening the chickens.

loans.name: Luis Arturo

texts.es:
Luis Arturo está casado con Esperanza con quien han procreado 2 hijos Luis Arturo tiene 41, Él se dedica a la producción de café rubro en el cual tiene 21 años de experiencia y que se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos, A sus 41 años Luis Arturo sueña con trabajar para contribuir al mejoramiento del planeta, “Es importante reparar un poco el daño que hemos realizado al planeta” menciona don Luis Arturo.
La producción de café bajo sellos de certificación es la opción que la caficultura está adoptando para hacer las fincas más sostenibles y amigables con el ambiente, Luis Arturo está interesado en iniciar en su finca un proceso de conversión a orgánico de su cafetal lo cual sumado al sello de comercio justo que ya posee le dará muchas más oportunidades de mercado a su café.
En la actualidad Luis Arturo solicita un crédito para comprar equipos necesarios para un buen tratamiento de las fincas orgánicas estos equipos le harán más fácil la aplicación de los insumos  y por lo tanto harán que la finca sea más fácil de manejar. 
El crédito le ayudara a Luis Arturo a adquirir equipos necesarios para hacer más fácil el manejo de su parcela que está en proceso de conversión a producción orgánica y por lo tanto tendrá la posibilidad de hacer su cafetal más productivo y rentable.
texts.en:
Luis Arturo is married to Esperanza, with whom he has two children. He is 41 years old. He produces coffee, work in which he has 21 years of experience and which has become his only source of income. At the age of 41, Luis Arturo dreams of working to contribute to the improvement of the planet. "It is important to repair a little bit the damage that we have done to the planet," Don Luis Arturo mentions.

The production of coffee under seals of certification is the option that coffee growers are adopting to make their farms more sustainable and environmentally friendly. Luis Arturo is interested in beginning a process of converting his coffee plantation to organic [production], which, added to the fair trade certification mark that he already possesses, will give him many more opportunities to market his coffee.

Luis Arturo is now applying for a loan to purchase equipment necessary to give good treatment to the organic farm. This equipment will make the application of the supplies easier and thus make the farm easier to manage.

The loan will help Luis Arturo to acquire necessary equipment to make the management of his parcel of land, which is in the process of being converted to organic production, easier, and thus he will have the possibility of making his coffee farm more productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy materials necessary to convert his coffee plantation to 100% organic production, such as coffee plants of organic origin and organic compost, among other items.

loans.name: Zaldy

texts.en: Zaldy is a 50-year-old fisherman from the town of Carles in Iloilo. He is a widower with a son who is 18 years old. Zaldy is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets and a new engine for his fishing boat. The income will help him buy food and pay for water and electricity. In the future, he hopes to have a bigger business which will allow him to earn a better income so he can save and at the same time reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and a new engine for his fishing boat.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 34 years old and married with three children, two in school.  Mary Joy works very hard to provide for her family

Mary Joy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

Mary Joy has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Mary Joy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Elfa

texts.en:
Elfa is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elfa is 57 years old and has four children who are in school.

Elfa has a videoke rentals business in the Philippines. Elfa requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business such as microphone, songbook, etc.

Elfa has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Elfa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business such as a microphone, songbook, etc.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a 61-year old married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rebecca has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, bamboo, and other fishing supplies. Rebecca has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Rebecca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, bamboo, and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 33 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Julieta works very hard to provide for them.

Julieta buys and sells coco lumber in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more coconut wood to sell.

Julieta has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wood to sell

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.en:
Eulogia is 56 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. For the past year, Eulogia has run a general store in the Philippines. 

Eulogia is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Rofina

texts.en:
Rofina is 49 years old and has seven children. Rofina is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Rofina is in the agricultural business, farming banana in the Philippines. Rofina requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rofina has been farming banana for 10 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rofina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a rural woman from Falakata. She is 31 years old and a mother of two sons. One of her sons is studying in grade 7 and other one is in grade 6. She is married to Dipak, a 33 year old farmer. They live in a small village Ramthenga in Falakata,West Bengal. Anita attended school until seventh grade.
 
Anita is a homemaker who looks after her children, does all the household works and in her spare time helps her husband in his farm work. Her husband is engaged in farming, growing vegetables and crops. He has his own farmland which he inherited from his parents. He struggles hard to grow good quality crops and vegetables. But the income generated from the farming is insufficient to run the family of four members. So they decided to grow paddies in order to earn more profits. 

Thus, Anita requests a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy good quality seeds, fertilizers, and manure for paddy cultivation. They believe that the loan will help her to provide all of their farming needs and in that way obtain higher revenues.  They will be able to improve the well-being of their family.

In the future Anita wants to construct a concrete house with the profit and she is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs for growing paddies (rice).

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Khorn, 49, is a farmer living in Kampong Cham province and she has three children. 

Khorn has been growing cassava to support her living conditions for twenty-nine years. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two loan cycles already, and she repaid her past loans completely. With her previous loans, she could keep her children in school. 

Due to a lack of funds, Khorn decided to apply for a new loan. She will manage her entire loan to buy school materials and pay the school fees for her children’s education. She hopes that her children will get good jobs after their graduation so that her family conditions can be improved.

loans.use: to buy school materials and to pay for school fees for her children’s education.

loans.name: Mabin

texts.en:
Mabin is a 35-year-old married woman. Her financial condition is not good. She has to think many times to start any task. Now her husband has just started to drive a Rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw that includes a motorbike). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and for small distances. Its body is made of polyester, which is not strong enough to bare the jerks over the roads. Now, the rickshaw body needs to be replaced because it rattles when driven. This is the reason he wants to buy a new body for his Rickshaw.

Mabin has requested a loan so that her husband can buy the rickshaw body and drive it smoothly. 

Mabin thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Jlg-003-Veerambur Group

texts.en:
Kamalagandhi, aged 29, from Kulithalai, in rural Tamil Nadu, has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Kamalagandhi's family of four are among millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse.

Joining hands with two others whose families face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Kamalagandhi has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue. Seeking to improve their situation, they are requesting a loan of Rs. 42,000 to build toilets in their homes. As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses, and they will repay the loan amount on time. Your loan will provide all three families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: to build a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Tounwende Group

texts.fr: pawanyimdi, est une femme âgée de 36 ans, mariée mère de 3 enfants. Elle exerce  son activité depuis 15 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est l'emplacement de son lieu de commerce de son dolo en face d'une grande voix, elle fait très bien son dolo qui un goût particulier très bon, elle est propre même dans son lieu de commerce, aussi elle est accueillante et respectueuse. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter le mil en gros à 75 000 f et le reste des 25 000 dans la préparation du dolo. L'utilité du prêt c'est de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin de renforcer son activité. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 3 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Pawanyimdi is a woman of 36, married and the mother of three children. She has been in this business for 15 years.

The thing that makes her activity do well is the location for her dolo (millet beer) business across from a grande voix. She makes her dolo very well and it has a particularly good taste. Even her business premises are clean, and she is welcoming and respectful.

Pawanyimdi wants the loan to buy millet wholesale for 75,000 francs and spend the remaining 25,000 francs for the preparation of her dolo. The usefulness of the loan is that it will allow her to stock up on a sufficient quantity to boost her business. She has already received a loan three times and has reimbursed ACFIME on the due dates.

loans.use: to buy millet wholesale for 75,000 francs and use the remaining 25,000 francs for the preparation of dolo (millet beer).

loans.name: Señor Del Rimac Group

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 41 años de edad es soltera con dos hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejido a base de lana a pedido de centros educativos y a pedido de sus conocidos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más lana hilo. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Elizabeth es la primera persona parada del lado derecho.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 41, is a single mother of two dependent children. She makes a living from woolen weaving at the request of education centers and people known to her. The loan will be invested in the purchase of more woolen yarn.

The group thanks the Kiva investors for the loan offered.

Elizabeth is the first person standing on the right side.

loans.use: to buy more wool and yarn.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Jorlan is 18 years old. His mother Fe supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Jorlan is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Criminology and is currently in his second year of this four-year course.

Her mother is borrowing PHP 11,500 to pay for his tuition fees for this school year.

When he graduates, Jorlan plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 25,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Nancy successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is listing Nancy's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Cherly is 19 years old and is the first of two children in the family. Her mother, Ritchel, supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Cherly is studying for a bachelor of science in tourism management and is currently in her first year of this four-year course. Her mother is borrowing 14,500 PHP to pay her tuition fees for the first semester.

When she graduates, Cherly plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 51 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marilyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business like flour, oil, sugar, etc..

Marilyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business like flour, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Merlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of cashew nuts business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing. Merlyn is borrowing PHP 14.000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of cashew nuts to sell.

Merlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Rafaela is 58 years old and single.

Rafaela is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Rafaela requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rafaela has been raising livestock for 7 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rafaela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Impore Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel fait partie du groupe  Impore et  habite à  Muravya. Il a 30 ans et est marié à Joselyne, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 1 à 7 ans. 

Il fait le commerce de la bière de banane et de la bière industrielle ”primus  ‘’depuis  5 ans. 

Il est son à deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bière à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is a member of the group Impore and lives in Muravya. He is 30 years old and is married to Joselyne, a farmer. They have three children together, ages 1 to 7 years old.

He has been selling banana beer and commercial "Primus" beer for five years.

He is on his second loan with Turame. With the loan that he receives from KIVA, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of beer for resale to make a profit.

loans.use: to increase his capital and to buy a large quantity of beer for profit resale.

loans.name: Essi Elise

texts.fr: Célibataire et sans enfant de 38 ans, Essi est une femme qui habite à Baguida. Essi est une revendeuse des objets en plastique et des bassines qu’elle s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Essi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sceaux en fer, des bassines en aluminium et des plats en plastique afin de satisfaire parfaitement les attentes de ses clients et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour subvenir aux charges et besoins quotidiens qu'elle éprouve.
texts.en: Essi is a single, 38-year-old woman with no children. She lives in Baguida. Essi resells plastic objects and bowls that she sources three times a month at the market and then resells from home and in the nearby neighborhoods. Essi is asking for this loan to order iron seals, aluminum bowls, and plastic plates in order to meet the needs of her customers and to make a good profit margin to support her daily expenses and needs.

loans.use: to buy six units of aluminum bowls and two iron seals.

loans.name: Agbodealo

texts.fr: Divorcée et sans enfant, Agbodealo est une femme qui vit à Tokoin. Agée de 41 ans, Agbodealo  est une revendeuse des pâtes dentifrices, brosses à dent et des cures à dent qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et les revendent en circulant les quartiers environnant. Agbodealo demande ce prêt pour réaliser ses achats des douzaines de pattes dentifrices et des morceaux de cures à dent afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière considérable pour pouvoir supporter ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en: Divorced and without any children, Agbodealo is a woman living in Tokoin. She is 41 years old and sells toothpastes, toothbrushes, and toothpicks, which are gotten once a month at the market. She resells the products by going from one neighborhood to the next. Agbodealo is asking for this loan to realize her purchases: dozens of toothpastes and pieces of toothpicks in order to respond favorably to the needs of her customers and to have considerable financial autonomy to support her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase 5 dozen toothpastes and 3 pieces of toothpicks

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anitha is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up alongside her six sisters and one brother in rural Rwanda. Because of Anitha's tremendous academic record, she was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year.

Anitha plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. She chose Kepler because she wanted to learn the professional skills that will help her stand out over her career. After graduating, Anitha hopes to help manage a telecommunications company or an NGO that provides educational support to children from vulnerable backgrounds.

She admits to sometimes working so hard that she forgets to rest and have fun. But this level of focus has allowed her to achieve so much, despite any setbacks in life.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Nogueille

texts.en:
Nogueille is a first-year student at Kepler in Rwanda. He grew up in Kigali with his mother, who operates a small boutique, and will be the first in his family to attend university. He was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year, and chose Kepler because it offers the opportunity to gain work experience and connections as you learn.
