Yenny, 34, has a partner and three small children. She works raising cattle. She began this work from a very young age alongside her parents, and thanks to her constant dedication, she is able to offer a better quality of life to her family.

She has applied for this loan to buy seeds and balanced feed for her cattle.

This group is grateful to Kiva lenders for giving them the opportunity to achieve their goals. Yenny is the second from the left, wearing a red top.

loans.use: to buy seeds and balanced feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Progressive Ladies Group

texts.en:
Susan is a 40-year-old business woman. She is a member of Progressive Ladies solidarity group. Progressive Ladies solidarity group has five members who are all women. Susan (in the middle) sells drinks to many households. Susan has been in this drinks business for the past seven years. She opens her business six days in a week from 9 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

Susan established her business to help support her children in school. She buys learning materials and provides food from the profit she gets from her business.

Susan and her group members need a loan totaling 6,500,000 SLL, of which Susan is entitled to 1,300,000 SLL. She will use it to buy additional crates of soft drinks for her business.

She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Susan is single with two children, ages 18 and 14, who are secondary school children.

In the future, Susan plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.

Susan and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional crates of soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a male, aged 52, living in Kagadi, Uganda, with his family.  He sells cattle and also earns from farming, having started this business in order to provide his family with their daily needs. He requests a loan to buy more cattle to sell. This is a business that has seen him develop steadily even though he faces setbacks of unpredictable weather changes and unfavorable market prices. He desires to trade from the city where he is assured of better prices compared to the local market.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en: Ayda is 52, married to a plaster laborer, and has two sons. She has a small fattening project and previously requested 5000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it on due dates. She is requesting another loan (10,000 EGP) to buy a head of cattle to expand her project and help her son with his marriage expenses

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Nabawy

texts.en: Nabawy is 28, single, has a poultry sales project, and helps his father in covering the expenses of his younger siblings. He previously requested a 7000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it on due dates and is requesting 12,000 EGP to buy more birds such as hens, ducks, and geese to generate more income and save for his marriage.

loans.use: To buy more birds such as hens, ducks, and geese.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 64 years old, a resident of Batasan, Philippines, and a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT).

While her husband, Rogelio, is at work, Teresita is in charge of the household chores while involving herself in a direct selling business. She sells personal products like lotion, soap, makeup and such to her friends and neighbors. She is earning for about PHP 7,000 every month.

Since there is always an increase in market prices, Teresita always dreams of having her business expanded so she could have a complete product line to put on her display cabinet. This would result in an increase in her daily sales. (A customer will wait for a week or two to have the products ordered, but if the product is available, there is no need to wait, and this will improve customer experience and result in loyal clients.)

Therefore, Teresita applied for a PHP 15,000 loan and prays that she will be granted that amount. Teresita also wants to have more knowledge in managing the business so she takes advantage every time CCT conducts seminars for new entrepreneurs.

Teresita has been consistent in attending the CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears about religion and testimonies from partners. This made her strong spiritually and dependent on God on every occasion.

loans.use: To buy personal products to add to her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Ryskul

texts.ru: Рыскуль, 39 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. Супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. Живут одной большой дружной семьей. Каждый член семьи пытается внести свой вклад в развитие благоустройства семьи. У Рыскуль среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она с 1994 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Рыскуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 6 коров, на 2,15 Га земли выращивает кукурузу, лук и клевер для реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 15,700 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рыскуль обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Рыскуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также в будущем намерена приобрести необходимый в хозяйстве трактор.
texts.en:
Ryskul is 39 and married with two children. Her husband and children help her with her farm. They live as one big happy family. All members of the family try to contribute toward the whole family's well-being. Ryskul has a high school education and has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture since 1994 as a source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has six cows and 2.15 hectares of land where she grows corn, onions and clover for sale. Her total monthly income is 15,700 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her farm, Ryskul has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 110,000 KGS to purchase cows to increase her head count of livestock. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock, and also, in the future, intends to buy a tractor, which is needed for her work.

loans.use: to buy additional cows in order to increase her head count of livestock

loans.name: Maria Yesenia

texts.es: Maria de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado y cerdos desde hace 8 años, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su casa, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de ganado para seguir con la crianza y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Maria, 35, lives in a home of her own with her three children. She earns a living raising cattle and pigs, which she sells in the neighboring towns. She's done this work for eight years, and with the income she is able to cover household expenses.

She is applying for a loan to buy livestock so that she can continue with her work and get better income.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blaca de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tre hijos, ella posee desde hace 18 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como logra salir adelente con los gastos del hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Blanca, 34, lives in her own house with her three children. For the past eighteen years, she has owned a small store near her home. She has many customers, especially neighbors. With her sales earnings, she is able to cover her household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, pastries etc. to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos, vive con su familia compuesta por su esposa e hijos, él es el hombre de la casa y tiene la responsabilidad de abastecer su hogar con alimentación, vestuario y salud, es propietario de un comedor, negocio que emprendió hace un año, lo atiende de siete de la mañana a ocho de la noche.
Como es un negocio que requiere de un inventario bien surtido, opta por solicitar un crédito en Padecomsm para poder comprar carnes, aceite, verduras, especias, arroz, frijoles, etc., para preparar un menú más agradable al paladar de sus clientes, su esperanza es que las ventas incrementen y pueda tener estabilidad económica.
Carlos sueña con tener un restaurante familiar y tener mejores circunstancias de vida junto a sus seres queridos.
texts.en: Carlos lives with his wife and children. He is the head of the household and is responsible for providing his family with meals, clothing and healthcare. He owns a food stall, a business he opened a year ago. He works there from seven in the morning until eight o'clock in the evening. Since it is a business that needs to be well-stocked, he has decided to apply for a loan with Padecomsm to buy meats, oil, vegetables, spices, rice, beans, etc. to prepare a menu more pleasing to his customers' tastes, with the hope of increasing sales and achieving financial stability. Carlos dreams of having a family restaurant and a better standard of living for his loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase meats, oil, vegetables, spices, rice, beans, etc. to prepare a menu more pleasing to his customers' tastes.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La Sra. Benita es comerciante y tiene en su casa una despensa que con mucho sacrificio monto, y que poco a poco ha ido mejorándola. Vive con su marido y sus dos hijos, y se ayudan ambos de esa manera para poder dar a sus hijos una buena vida sin privaciones.
Ella comenta que se esfuerza para poder mejorar su pequeño negocio, y de esa forma y en conjunto con su marido poder dar a sus hijos todo lo que ellos no pudieron tener, y darles una vida digna.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de productos varios para la venta en su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, enlatados, panificados, lácteos, y otros.
texts.en:
Benita sells groceries. She has in her home a store that she set up with a lot of sacrifice, and little by little she has been upgrading it. She lives with her husband and her two children, and both parents help each other with the work to be able to offer their children a good life without deprivation.

She comments that she's making efforts to improve her small business, and together with her husband, to be able to give their children all that they could not have, and to offer them a decent life.

Benita is applying for this loan to buy various products to sell in her store, including vegetables, fruits, canned food, baked goods, dairy products, and more.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, canned food, baked goods, dairy products and more.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 29 años de edad, conviviente, vive con su cónyuge e hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, la población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Oscar se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de café, hace 15 años cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Oscar espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is twenty-nine years old. He is common-law-married, and he lives with his spouse and children in the district of Pomahuaca, which is located in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca Region of Peru's northern sierra. Life in the district is tranquil. The residents mainly work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock-raising.

Oscar works in agriculture. He has been growing coffee for fifteen years, and he has very good personal and work references in the zone. He will use the loan that he will be granted for the purchase of compost and fertilizer in order to perform proper maintenance of his coffee crop, as well as for hiring workers during the harvest season.

With this, Oscar expects to offer a higher quality coffee to his customers, which will have a positive impact on his income level, and will thus improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizer in order to maintain his coffee crop properly.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, 31 years old, is married and supports three children. He has been in a motorcycle transport business for the last 10 years earning an income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

Stephen has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to buy spare parts for repairing and maintaining his motorcycle so as to satisfy his customers and increase his income. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and buy a dairy cow to meet his family's demand for milk. He hopes to improve his family's health care and living standards.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for repairing  and maintaining his motorcycle so as to satisfy his customers and increase his income.

loans.name: La Esperanza (La Paz Centro) Group

texts.es:
G.S.  LA ESPERANZA ESTA CONFORMADO POR TRES INTEGRANTES MADRES RESPONSABLES CON SEIS HIJOS, TODOS MENORES DE EDAD  LOS CUALES ESTAN ESTUDIANDO, SON ORIGINARIOS DE LA PAZ CENTRO, SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, LAMENTABLEMENTE NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR PARA SALIR ADELANTE CON SUS FAMILIAS, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN PARA CUMPLIR SUS SUEÑOS Y METAS COMO BRINDARLES ESTUDIOS A SUS HIJOS, Y HACER CRECER SUS NEGOCIOS.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES LIZANIA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA ROPA NUEVA EL NEGOCIO LO DESEMPEÑA DE FORMA AMBULANTE Y EN SU CASA DE  HABITACION, ELLA DEDICA UNAS DIES HORAS OFRECIENDOS SUS PRODUCTOS  COMO : PANTALONES, CAMISAS, CAMISETAS, SHORES, FALDAS, VESTIDOS, ROPA DE NIÑO, ROPA INTERIOR ETC. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA PAR QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS ,Y MAYOR CLIENTELA. LA ESPERANZA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
G.S. La Esperanza is comprised of three responsible mothers, with six children among them, all of whom are young and in school. They are from La Paz Centro. They are known to be hardworking and responsible, with the desire to better themselves. Unfortunately, they were not able to go to school, and saw the need to work to get ahead with their families. Currently they fight to achieve their dreams and goals, such as providing education to their children, and making their businesses grow.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, the group's coordinator is Lizania, who sells new clothes. She works both as a street vendor and from her home. She spends some 10 hours each day offering her products such as pants, shirts, tee shirts, shorts, skirts, dresses, children's clothes, underwear, etc. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business by purchasing merchandise, so that in the not too distant future she can obtain increased income and more customers. La Esperanza is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide to people with limited economic resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua, to have dignified means of work.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as pants, shorts, skirts, tee shirts, shirts, dresses, bed linens, children's clothes, etc.

loans.name: Nohemi Rosalia

texts.es:
La socia Nohemi Rosalia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de materiales de construccion,la socia es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de materiales de construccion.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar yeso, clavos y arena.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nohemi Rosalia continues with her business of selling construction materials. She is a hardworking woman who provides for her family by means of  this work.

Her dream is to expand her business. Nohemi is applying for this loan to buy plaster, nails, and sand. She is happy for the loan and committed to making her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy plaster, nails, and sand.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 26 years old, married and has four children (three children are currently in school). She is in an agricultural business: pig fattening in the Philippines.

Mary Jean has been pig fattening for three years now and has borrowed six times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to sustain it. She has requested an 11,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. In the future, Mary Jean would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Almegene

texts.en:
Almegene is 28 years old and married with one child. Almegene works very hard to provide for them.

Almegene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, feeds, canned goods, diapers, coffee, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Almegene has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items.

Almegene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like rice, feeds, canned goods, diapers, coffee, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman and has been blessed with five children. Three of her children attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

Mwanajuma operates a business selling fish, which has been operational for more than six years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge for her business. Mwanajuma dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of dry fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of dry fish for resale

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is a married woman. She has four children, three of whom attend school. Munira owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Munira has operated a firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators. With this 50,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shelves, basic grains, snacks, cooking oil, drinks, vegetables, and sugar, etc. in order to have more adequate inventory in the store and to make food.

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es:
La socia Maria Salome se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Borrower María Salomé is still in the grocery store business. She sells staple products like rice, sugar, milk, and biscuits. She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. María Salomé already has 5 years in this business and is doing very well.

Her dream is to expand the grocery store business. She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and biscuits. María Salomé is happy for the loan and commits to meet her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and biscuits.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a 27-year-old married woman with three children; two children are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Analiza has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Analiza requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional variety of fish to sell to her customers.

Analiza has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional variety of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jeramie

texts.en:
Jeramie is 28 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Jeramie works very hard to provide for them.

Jeramie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Jeramie has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Jeramie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is married with two children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashewnuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.  Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase ten sacks of cashewnuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase ten sacks of cashewnuts for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman; she has two children, one of whom attends school. Fatuma owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Grettel

texts.es: Grettel vende artículos de limpieza y abarrotes. Ella solicita un préstamo de cuatrocientos mil colones (₡ 400 000), para la compra de mercadería que le permita aumentar su volumen de ventas y de esta manera incrementar los ingresos familiares que dependen de esta actividad.
texts.en: Grettel sells cleaning products and groceries. She is requesting a loan of four hundred thousand colones (₡400 000) [$750 USD] for the purchase of merchandise that will permit her to increase her sales volume.  In this way, she will increase the income for her family, who depend upon this activity.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning products and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lucia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Lucía es dueña de una tienda de productos varios para uso doméstico, lo abrió aproximadamente hace tres años, lo hizo con apoyo de su madre, trabaja de lunes a domingo; es una mujer soltera que tiene la responsabilidad de sostener a tres hijos de 6, 4 y 2 años de edad, solamente vive con ellos.
Para mantener su negocio con vida pide apoyo con un financiamiento para poder comprar huevos, detergentes, jabón, sal, azúcar, granos básicos, jugos, y otros productos que sean de ayuda para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes y generar nuevos ingresos.
Sus sueños son mantenerse trabajando, cancelar su deuda y darles a sus hijos la educación adecuada para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Lucia owns a store that she opened about three years ago with her mother's help, where she sells various products for the home. She works from Monday to Sunday. She is a single mother responsible for the support of her three children, ages six, four, and two years. She lives alone with them.

To keep her business viable, she is requesting support in the form of a loan to buy eggs, detergents, soap, salt, sugar, basic grains, juices, and other products that will help cover her clients' needs and thus generate new income.

Lucia's dreams are to keep working, pay off her debt, and offer her children an adequate education so they will have a better future.

loans.use: to buy eggs, detergents, soap, salt, sugar, basic grains, juices, and more to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Kusikoyllor Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KUSIKOYLLOR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Erika ella es conviviente y tiene 34 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia es una persona trabajadora y responsable que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de ladrillos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Kusikoyllor communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Erika, age 34, is in a common-law marriage and has three children. She works in her handicraft business. She sells fabrics, sweaters, and looms. She sells different fabrics. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. She is a hard-working and responsible person. Through her business she gets her family ahead. She has been in this business for eight years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her fabric and loom sales business. She is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, sweaters, and looms.

The member who appears in the accompanying photo asked permission due to work reasons, thus the photo was taken after the meeting.

The other members work in businesses such as clothing sales, brick sales, grocery stores, and restaurants.

Erika is thankful to those who take part in her dream through this medium, and she promises to make her scheduled payments in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and woven goods.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with five children. She is 46 years old and all five of her children are in school.

Lolita is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 36 years old and has one child. She is married and her child is in school.

Jennifer is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jennifer has been fattening pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cherelita

texts.en:
Cherelita is 53 years old, and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Cherelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothes.

Cherelita has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this one. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a married woman with five children. She is 41 years old and four of her children are currently in school.

Fatima is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She buys and sells ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines. Fatima requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of clothes to sell to her customers.

Fatima has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of ready-to-wear clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mastoura

texts.en:
Mastoura is 39 years old and married to a farmer. She has five sons.

Mastoura has a small poultry project. She previously requested a 2,000 EGP loan, which she successfully repaid on the due dates.

Now, Mastoura is requesting a 4,000 EGP loan to buy birds such as chickens, geese and ducks. This will increase the income for her family, and help cover her daughter's marriage expenses.

loans.use: To buy birds such as chickens, geese and ducks.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
This nice and smiling woman is 27 years old and she lives in Zovaber village in Gegharkunik region. Ani lives here with her large family; she lives with her husband, two children and parents-in-law.

Ani has a higher education; she graduated from Gavar State University faculty of Finances and Loans. Despite her being engaged in farming with her family, Ani never stopped doing her beloved work; it is already many years that she has worked as an accountant at their village kindergarten.

Ani also is skilled in farming work and she takes care of her farm cattle (she has cows, calves, a heifer, a bull, a pig, sheep, lambs, goats, chickens and also several bee hives), with the help of her family members. The assortment of her farm products is great; she has milk, meat, curd, cheese, macun (a national dairy-product), eggs and honey for sale, and also her potatoes and tomatoes that she cultivates on her land with her husband.

Now Ani asks for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams as she wants to buy potato seedlings for her autumn sowing work, and she also must buy fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings for her autumn sowing work, and to buy fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a 25-year-old landlady based in Mombasa, Kenya. She is a single mother of two children.

Edith has rental houses which she lets out, a business she has done for the last three years, and it has been profitable.

This marks her first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to renovate her rentals by repairing broken facilities as well as repainting some of the rooms to attract more clients.

She will use the loan to renovate her rentals and the anticipated profits to service her loan.

She hopes to give her children a good education in future.

loans.use: to renovate her rentals by repairing broken facilities as well as repainting some of the rooms to attract more clients.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alavard lives with her beloved husband in Kapan city of the Syunik region. Their son is already married and he lives separately from his parents with his family.

Alavard has a vocational medical education but she never worked in the medical sphere. She used to work as a cook but she now has her own clothes trading business. She rents a stall at the city’s wholesale market. There she sells clothes and underwear for women, men's clothes, shoes and slippers, also children's clothes and bags. She brings all her stall’s merchandise from Yerevan in her husband’s car once a month. She mentions that the business has brought a constant income for the last few years since she already managed to have a great number of regular customers who never do their shopping from any other stalls.

Now Alvard is asking for this loan of 300.000 AMD as she wants to buy a new assortment of Autumn season clothes. In this way she will refresh her stall and make it more attractive with clothes proper for the colder season.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of autumn season clothes and, in this way, refresh her stall.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to grow her working capital and buy a lot of goats for later resale, so as to earn more.

loans.name: Marina Lissette

texts.es:
Marina, vive actualmente con dos hijos de corta edad, ella está acompañada pero su pareja vive en el extranjero, ambos aportan para sostener su hogar, por su parte ella se dedica a comercializar semilla de marañón, actividad que práctica desde hace cinco años, ya cuenta con prestigio en su comunidad.
Necesita de capital de trabajo para comprar semilla de marañón en mayor cantidad para ahorrar y tener mejores ingresos, la finalidad de la inversión es atender a nuevos clientes y cubrir las demandas existentes.
La visión de Marina es mejorar su negocio y guiar a sus hijos para que sean personas de bien en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Marina currently lives with two young children. She is in a relationship but her partner lives abroad. They both contribute to support their household. On her side, she makes a living commercializing cashew nuts, an occupation she has carried out for five years now. She already has prestige in the community.

Marina needs working capital to buy cashew nuts in larger quantities to save and have a better income. The purpose of the investment is to serve new customers and meet existing demands.

Marina's vision is to improve her business and guide her children to be good people in society.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts in larger quantities to save, have a better income, serve new customers, and meet existing demands.

loans.name: Nagwa

texts.en:
Nagwa is 26 and married to a farmer.

She is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy some birds such as geese, ducks and chickens to start a poultry project in a place she prepared in her house to help her husband with the family income.

loans.use: To buy some birds such as geese, ducks and chickens

loans.name: Onofre

texts.es: Don Onofre se dedica a la siembra y producción de chayotes. Solicita doscientos cincuenta dolares $250 para la compra de materiales necesarios para ampliar su sistema de riego y darle así un mejor mantenimiento a su cultivo. Esto le generará mayores ingresos provenientes de esta actividad.
texts.en: Don Onofre plants and produces chayotes [a type of squash, also called vegetable pear or mirliton]. He is requesting two hundred and fifty dollars ($250) in order to expand his irrigation system, and in this way, provide better maintenance for his crop. In this way he will generate better earnings from his work.

loans.use: to expand his irrigation system for his chayote crop.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is 56 years old and she lives with her husband in the city of Vanadzor of the Lori region. Ruzanna graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute, where she focused on Armenian Language and Literature.

For 30 years, she has worked at the school as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature. Ruzanna says that, despite her age, she is still busy with self-development and she uses all the pedagogical and methodological skills to make her lessons informative, interesting and attractive for her pupils. Ruzanna also gives paid private courses for pupils at her house, where she prepares the pupils for their entrance exams.

She is now seeking this loan in the amount of 700,000 Armenian drams to buy a new computer (her computer has broken down). With the loan proceeds, she also wants to buy professional literature for her private courses at home.

loans.use: to replace her computer and to purchase professional literature for her private courses at home

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Adjowa est une femme mariée dynamique qui vit à Agoè  avec ses deux enfants à charge. Adjowa est âgée de 41 ans et  s’active parfaitement  pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Adjowa est une revendeuse de pagnes qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Adjowa sollicite ce prêt pour commander des séries de pagnes afin de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Adjowa is a dynamic married mother to two children who lives in Agoè. She is 41 years old and works hard so that she can find herself in a good financial situation. She sells pagne cloth which she purchases three times per month from market.

In order to meet her goals, Adjowa is requesting this loan to purchase lengths of pagne cloth so she can better meet her customers' demands and have greater financial autonomy. By doing this, she will be able to support her children in their educations.

loans.use: to purchase two lengths of traditional pagne cloth.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est une femme mariée âgée de 39 ans qui habite à Baguida. Mère de trois enfants, Akouvi est une marchande de pains accompagné de la mayonnaise et du beurres. Akouvi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend de quartier en quartier et à domicile pour gagner des revenus. Pour commander des unités de pains, des boîtes de mayonnaises et des cartons de beurres, Akouvi nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Akouvi is a married 39-year-old woman with three children who lives in Baguida. She sells bread with mayonnaise and butter. She buys her supplies three times a month from the market and sells her products from neighborhood to neighborhood, as well as out of her home, to earn her income. Akouvi needs this loan to order units of bread, jars of mayonnaise, and boxes of butter. It will help her finance her business and earn a good profit margin so that she can provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy 60 units of bread, 3 units of mayonnaise jars, and 2 boxes of butter.

loans.name: Abd El Salam

texts.en: Abd El Salam is 38, married to a housewife, and has two children. He has a small grocery store, where he and his wife take shifts. He previously requested 5,000 EGP and successfully repaid it on time. He is requesting another 5,000 EGP loan to buy some grocery products such as oil, cheese, and pasta to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy some grocery products such as oil, cheese and pasta.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 25-year-old fish monger at Mikindani Mombasa. She is a married mother of two children whose husband provides additional income. She has been in this business for the last two years and is doing well.

This marks her first loan to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase fish for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children. She hopes to grow her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale

loans.name: Asiati

texts.en:
Asiati is a 36-year-old woman with six children. She notes that she also looks after another child whose parents died. She describes herself as hardworking and honest.

She is a teacher by profession, having taught for 13 years in Kagadi, Uganda. She also gets additional income from farming. Her dream profession was nursing, which she could not pursue due to lack of funds for tuition.

She would like to receive a loan to pay for her children's school fees ahead of the promotion term. She is working extra hard to have well-educated children in the future, and she firmly believes that this loan will help her achieve that goal. However, she has been facing challenges due to the longer distances she must travel, which reduces her savings.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to add to her inventory by buying a half a bale of used clothing.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr:
Jeannette a une famille nombreuse. Elle a 48 ans et vit avec son mari, ses 7 enfants et ses 2 petits-enfants. Elle exerce une activité de vente de produits très diversifié tels que des fournitures scolaires, des radios, des vaisselles et des piles. Depuis 2 ans, elle élève aussi des porcs.
Jeannette est emprunteuse chez Vahatra depuis longtemps et avec les bénéfices, elle a pu acheter un terrain productif ou elle cultive du riz. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 4 porcs, de la farine alimentaire et des produits phytosanitaires et pense pouvoir les vendre dans 6 mois.
Elle espère gagner beaucoup de bénéfices et constituer de l’épargne pour faire face aux imprévus et réaliser des projets d’avenir.
texts.en:
Jeannette has a large family. She is 48 years old and lives with her husband, their seven children and their two grand-children. She earns a living through selling various products, such as school supplies, radios, crockery and batteries. For the past two years, she has also been rearing pigs.

Jeannette has been borrowing from Vahatra for a long time and with the profits, she has been able to purchase a plot of land on which she grows rice. With this loan, she plans on purchasing four pigs, flour and phytosanitary products which she believes she will be able to sell within six months.

She hopes to earn a large profit and put together some savings so she can face unforeseen expenses and carry out future projects.

loans.use: to purchase four pigs, flour and phytosanitary products.

loans.name: Mékplowodo

texts.fr: Veuve et mère de six enfants, Mekplowodo est une femme âgée de 39 ans résidant à Baguida. Marchande de condiments, Mekplowodo s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend là. Mekplowodo sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de piment vert et des paniers d’oignons. Mekplowodo  profitera du bénéfice pour prendre bien soin de ses enfants en les inscrivant dans des écoles de qualités supérieures.
texts.en: Mekplowodo is 39 years old, a widow and a mother of six children living in Baguida. She sells condiments, which she buys four times a month from the market where she also sells her products. Mekplowodo is requesting this loan to buy bags of green peppers and baskets of onions. She will use her profits to take care of her children by enrolling them in high-quality schools.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of green peppers and 40 baskets of onions.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a 23-year-old, who owns a cereal-grinding machine in Voi, Kenya. He is a single man, who has been in this business for the last five years and is doing well.

This would be his first loan to finance his business. He plans to use the loan proceeds to purchase dried maize seeds for grinding into maize flour, which he would then sell. With the profits he expects to generate as a result of the loan, Joshua will be able to purchase more sacks of dry maize to grind into flour. He hopes to prosper in his business and to expand the business, such as by beginning to grind millet and sorghum for sale.

loans.use: to purchase dried maize seeds for grinding into maize flour

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramon tiene 35 años vive con su conyuge y sus cinco hijos, en casa propia, dedicado al cultivo de café, en el caserio de san Cristobal, distrito de Cañaris, Provincia Ferreñafe, region Lambayeque, Costa norte de perú.

Ramon se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente al cultivo de café, desde hace 15 años, con muy buenas referencias laborales y personales,el crédito solicitado tendrá como propósito invertir en compra de abonos y pagar mano de obra en su cultivo de café.Con esto lograra incrementar los rendimientos en su cultivo de café, aumentar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ramon is 35 years old, and he lives with his spouse and their five children in their own house. He grows coffee in the small village of San Cristobal, which is in the province of Ferreñafe in the Lambayeque Region of Peru's northern coast.

Ramon has worked in agriculture, growing coffee specifically, for more than fifteen years, and he has very good professional and personal references. The loan that he is requesting will be for the purchase of compost and for paying workers to help with his coffee crop.

With this he will be able to increase the yields from his coffee crop and increase his income, thereby improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase compost and to pay workers to help with his coffee crop.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 57-year-old, married woman. To earn a living, she has been purchasing and selling animals with the help of her husband (pictured with her) for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent lifestyle. She is a mother of four children. She works very hard to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of 45,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats and calves in order to attract more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future, especially with the help of the requested loan.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional animals (e.g., baby goats and calves)

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr: Thérèse est une femme mariée qui vit à Baguida avec ses six enfants à charge. Agée de 43 ans, Thérèse est une femme dynamique et courageuse  qui vend des habits en parcourant les quartiers environnant afin de disposer d’une bonne capacité financière. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Thérèse s’approvisionne six fois par mois au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des douzaines d’habits pour femmes afin de financer son commerce et trouver un bon rendement pour subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et celui de ses enfants.
texts.en: Thérèse is a 43-year-old married woman who lives in Baguida, where she cares for her six children. She is a dynamic and brave woman who sells clothing throughout nearby neighborhoods so that she can make use of her solid financial capacity. To achieve her goals, Thérèse buys her supplies from the market six times a month. She is requesting this loan to order dozens of women's clothing items so that she can finance her business and earn a decent income so that she can provide for the daily needs of herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy 5 dozen women's clothing items.

loans.name: Sada

texts.fr: Sada est une femme mariée âgée de 37 ans résidante à Agoè. Mère de  six enfants, Sada prépare du riz mélangé du haricot qu’elle revend au marché. Sada s’approvisionne du nécessaire trois fois par mois  au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des sacs de riz et des bols d’haricot.  Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Sada compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider ses enfants à avoir un épanouissement et une bonne éducation.
texts.en:
Sada is a 37-year-old married mother to six children who lives in Agoè. She cooks rices and beans which she then sells at market. She purchases the necessary supplies three times per month from market.

Sada is requesting this loan to purchase bags of rice and bowls of beans. With the resulting profits, she wants to improve her sales performance and give her children a good education and the things they need in order to flourish.

loans.use: to purchase four bags of rice and 19 bowls of beans.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Don Wlfredo vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la venta de gas propano desde hace 27 años su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas gas propano por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Wilfredo lives in his own home with his wife. For 27 years he has worked selling propane gas. His business is located in his home, and he has many customers. With the earnings he makes he is able to meet some of his household expenses.

He is seeking a loan to buy propane gas wholesale, in order to continue with his sales and obtain greater economic earnings.

loans.use: to buy propane gas wholesale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 41 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Her business is farming.

She has been farming for 18 years. She earns a monthly income of twelve thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay her children's school fees.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a financially stable family and have all her children be well educated.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
Kubra a is 36-year-old married woman. She is the mother of 7 children.

Some years ago, she started her business of selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work.

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more livestock such as baby goats for reselling in the market.

She aspires to save money to provide a prosperous future to her family.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock such as baby goats for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Maria Julissa

texts.es:
María, mantiene su núcleo familiar y las circunstancias de vida son casi iguales, pues su negocio es de subsistencia, el préstamo anterior le permitió tener materia prima para elaborar la venta de pan, mantiene clientes satisfechos y ayuda a cubrir las necesidades familiares.
Hace la solicitud de un crédito para pagar la reparación del horno eléctrico que utiliza para cocer el pan, con ello su equipo de trabajo se mantendrá en óptimas condiciones y María seguirá trabajando.
texts.en:
María supports her family unit. Life circumstances are almost the same since her business is of subsistence. The previous loan allowed her to have raw material to make and sell bread. She keeps customers satisfied and helps meet the family needs.

She is making the request for a loan to pay for the repair of the electric oven she uses for baking the bread. With it, her work equipment will remain in optimal condition and María will continue to work.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the electric oven used to bake bread.

loans.name: Irimiya

texts.en:
Irimiya is a Babban Gona farmer from Dogon Juri Vilage. He joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Irimiya will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer.

With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Irimiya would like to use his extra earnings to ensure his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase superior farm inputs which will increase his farming yields.

loans.name: Koudama

texts.fr: Agée de 50 ans, Koudama est une veuve femme  qui vit à Agoè avec un enfant à charge. Pour favoriser son épanouissement, Koudama vend des produits d’alimentations et réalises son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Koudama s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des tas des oignons et de piment vert, Koudama demande ce crédit pour financer son achat et avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour subvenir à ses propres besoins et celui de son enfant.
texts.en:
50-year-old Koudama is a widow who lives in Agoè with one child in her care. In order to support this child, she sells food products and is able to earn a living thanks to this business. Koudama gets her supplies four times per month from market.

In order to buy onions and green hot peppers, Koudama is requesting this loan so that she can earn a large profit. By doing this, she will be able to meet both her own and her child's needs.

loans.use: purchase 33 piles of onions and eight piles of green hot peppers.

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr: Béatrice est une femme âgée de 33 ans résidant à Agoè. Mariée, Béatrice vit avec ses trois enfants et son mari. Béatrice est une revendeuse  de chaussures qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant et à son domicile. Béatrice demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat des douzaines de chaussures en vue de gagner des bénéfices et pouvoir aider son mari à bien prendre soin de leurs enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Béatrice is a 33-year-old married mother to three children who lives in Agoè with her family. She earns a living through selling shoes which she purchases four times per month from market. She then resells these shoes both as a street vendor and out of her own home.

Béatrice is requesting this loan to purchase shoes so she can earn a profit and support her husband in providing for their children's educations.

loans.use: to purchase six dozen pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of rice.

loans.name: Yverose

texts.fr: Yverose, 37ans, vit en union libre. Elle a un enfant. Elle habite à Delmas avec son compagnon et leur enfant. Elle revend des produits alimentaires depuis tantôt 5 ans. Elle souhaite développer son commerce progressivement. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock de lait concentré.
texts.en:
Yverose, 37 years old, lives in a common-law relationship. She has one child. She lives in Delmas with her partner and their child.

Yverose has been selling foodstuffs for almost five years. She would like to develop her business little by little. She is asking for a loan to grow her stock of condensed milk.

loans.use: to buy a stock of little bottles of milk.

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna runs a small business selling women's clothing merchandise. She used to have a vending location at an open air marketplace, but now she has moved into a store right downtown in Vinogradovo where her sales went up because of more customers in that part of town.

Previous assistance from Kiva helped Ganna increase her income and invest much-needed funds in her business. Now Ganna needs 30,000 UAH (Grivnyas) to buy a good-quality heater for her house and install it.

With chilly fall and winter weather coming, she wants to make sure her family has the convenience of hot running water throughout the cold seasons. Moreover, gas prices are going up, which is why Ganna has to think of a different option to save money from her family budget.

loans.use: to buy a good quality heater for her house and install it

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan is from Vinogradovo. He previously used financial assistance from Kiva to develop his business which has witnessed considerable growth in profit since 2012.

This time Stepan is seeking additional funding for housing purposes. He wants to remodel two rooms in his house: to install drywall on the ceilings, to buy and substitute two interior doors, to plaster and paint the walls, to sand and lacquer the floors, and to change the wiring and sockets.

These remodeling plans are pretty cost-consuming which is why Stepan needs help with funding – he needs 40,000 UAH (Grivnyas) to finish the project.

loans.use: to remodel two rooms in his house

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 43 years old. He is married and has one child.

His business is selling used clothes and household utensils. He has been in this business for ten years. He earns a monthly income of 8,000 KES. This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya.

He will use the loan to buy a stock of house buckets, saucepans, basins, mats, etc., for sale.

He will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for his child. His hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of house buckets, saucepans, basins, mats, etc., for sale.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tashar Bakwake Village. Jonathan joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.

In the past, Jonathan suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Jonathan will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds. This will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. It will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Jonathan now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income. He will use his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs which will increase his farming yields.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old. She is married and has 5 children.

Her business is operating a quarry. She has been in the business for 4 years. She earns a monthly income of ten thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her 3rd loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to rent a quarry plot and buy more digging and stone curving tools.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to take care of her family needs including school fees, medical care and food.

Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business to such a level as to secure her children's future.

loans.use: to rent a quarry plot and buy more digging and stone curving tools.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
Mirian tiene 55 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Mirian se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con varios años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Mirian espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mirian is 55 years old and she is married. She lives with her husband in a rural zone of the Cayaltí District, which is located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque Region of Peru's northern coast. The residents of this district primarily work in agriculture, livestock-raising, and commerce.

Mirian raises and sells small animals, such as chickens, hens, ducks, turkeys, and others. Her business is located at her own place of residence and she has several years' experience in the business, with very good personal and professional references in the zone. The loan that she is requesting will be used for the purchase of more animals, such as hens, ducks, turkeys, and chickens, along with other items, such as feed for them.

With this, Mirian hopes to offer her customers a better product, which will allow her to generate more income, and thus improve the quality of life for herself and for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Salomi

texts.en:
Salomi is a Babban Gona farmer from Gidan Yawa Vilage.

Salomi joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Salomi will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer.

With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase her net income, Salomi would like to use her extra earnings to ensure that all her children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farm’s yields.

loans.name: Sule

texts.en:
Sule is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tashar Bakwake Village. Sule joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.

In the past, Sule suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Sule will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Sule now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income. He will use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs which will increase his farming yields.

loans.name: Telate

texts.fr: Mariée, Telate est femme de 55 ans qui vit avec ses six enfants à charge à Agoè. Pour vivre et venir en aide aux besoins des enfants, Telate prépare et vend de la boisson locale alcoolisée appelée « Tchoukoudou» à son domicile. Telate s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et réalise une bonne marge bénéficiaire grâce ce commerce. Telate désire ce crédit pour commander des sacs de mil afin de maximiser son profit et aider son mari à bien s’occuper de leurs enfants et favoriser ainsi leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Telate is a 55-year-old married woman who lives in Agoè, where she cares for her six children. In order to make a living and attend to the needs of her children, Telate makes and sells a local alcoholic drink called "Tchoukoudou" from her home. She buys her supplies from the market twice a month and earns a good profit margin thanks to her business. She is requesting this loan to buy bags of millet in order to maximize her profit and help her husband take care of their children, particularly by furthering their education.

loans.use: to buy three bags of millet.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en: Oksana is from Belaya Tserkov, Ukraine. Her business is selling lingerie, pajamas and bathrobes at two different locations in her home town, a kiosk in the central marketplace and a shop at a local mall. Oksana is an experienced salesperson. She has been in business for 10 years. She tries to diversify her merchandise systematically by adding variety to the items she has on display for her customers. Oksana reinvests all her profits in the growth of her business. However, at this point she needs an additional 20 000 UAH (Ukrainian Hryvnia) to buy new women's bathrobes and pajamas to sell this season.

loans.use: to buy new women's bathrobes and pajamas to sell this season.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en: Yelena is an entrepreneur from Melitopol, Ukraine, selling women's clothing at the town's biggest marketplace. Yelena owns her kiosk. She worked in this business for 14 years. She is 59, a widow with two grown children. Yelena needs 10 000 UAH (Ukrainian Hrivnias) to restock her merchandise of dresses, blouses and sweaters for the upcoming fall season.

loans.use: to buy dresses, blouses and sweaters for the fall season.

loans.name: Luida

texts.es:
Luida continúa estudiando peinados y cosmetología. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en el pago total de toda su carrera técnica y también para la compra de materiales de estudio de peinados. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo estudiar y trabajar con tranquilidad. Actualmente trabaja en su propio salón situado en su casa, esta cuenta con tijeras, ruleros, cepillos y otros materiales de peinados que utiliza, “terminé de estudiar y sólo me faltan los trámites de titulación para obtener mi título profesional…” comenta. La ventaja de sus actividades es que no se cruzan entre sí, la desventaja es la falta de capital para pagar los trámites de titulación. Su sueño es equipar su propio salón de belleza, ella desea pagar los gastos de titulación. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que estudia y trabaja. 
Es por esos motivos que Luida solicita un préstamo para pagar los trámites de titulación para obtener su título profesional.
texts.en:
Luida continues studying hairstyling and cosmetology. She used her prior loan to pay all costs of her technical training, and to buy materials for the study of hairstyling. She made her loan payments on time because she could work and study in peace.

She now works in her own salon, located in her house. She has scissors, rollers and brushes, among other materials for hairstyling, that she uses. "I finished school and now all that is left are the licensing procedures to obtain my professional license," she comments. The advantage of her current situation is that her activities don't interfere with each other. The disadvantage is her lack of capital to pay for the licensing procedures.

Her dream is to set up her own beauty salon. She wants to pay for the licensing procedures. This is the second round of loans with the institution in one year of her studying and working. For these reasons, Luida seeks a loan to pay for the licensing procedures in order to obtain her professional license.

loans.use: to pay for the licensing procedures in order to obtain her professional license.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo de nombre La Esperanza está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo, que lucha para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y la de sus seres queridos. Ellas quieren ir mejorando en los pequeños emprendimientos que vienen haciendo.
La señora Antonia, una de las integrantes del grupo, comenta que es modista, tiene su lugar de trabajo en su casa. Comenta que con mucho esfuerzo se pudo montar para su humilde taller, y a través de el ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder hacer un mantenimiento a su máquina de coser, para poder seguir trabajando y dando a su familia lo que necesitan para una buena vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The group named "La Esperanza” [Hope] is in its first loan cycle with the women’s committee.  It is a new group, fighting to be able to improve their own living conditions and those of their loved ones.  They want to go about improving the small enterprises they have been doing.

Antonia is one member of the group.  She says she is a fashion designer.  She has her place of work in her home.  She says that with great effort, and with the help of her family and loved ones, she managed to set up her humble workshop.  

She is asking for this loan to be able to perform maintenance on her sewing machine so that she can keep working and giving her family what they need for a good life without hardships.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on a sewing machine

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a 34 year old second hand clothes dealer in Voi Kenya. She is a mother of two wonderful children. Her husband supports the family.

Laura has sold clothes as her core business for the last five years and it has been great. This is her fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase bales of second hand clothes.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to expand her business and start selling ladies shoes and handbags. She hopes to own a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 41 years old. She is married and has seven children.

Her business is farming. She has been farming for five years. She earns a monthly income of 25,000 KES.

This is her third loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and part of it to pay school fees.

She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children to tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay school fees.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Veuve de 48 ans, Akoua est une femme qui vit à Agoè avec quatre enfants à charge. Akoua est une marchande des produits alimentaires qui achète ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché et les revendent à la devanture de son domicile. Akoua sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs d’oignons afin de réaliser un bon revenu pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation  scolaire.
texts.en:
Akoua is a 48-year-old widow who lives in Agoè with four children in her care. She earns a living through selling food products which she purchases twice monthly from market then resells out of her own home.

Akoua is requesting this loan to purchase bags of onions so she can turn a good profit and support her children with their educations.

loans.use: to purchase three bags of onions.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 37 years old. She is married and has three children.

Her business is selling clothes. She has been in the business for 17 years.

She earns a monthly income of 37,000 KES. This is her fifth loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of clothes for sale.

She will use the profits from expanded business to improve the family standard of living.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a good life style.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 73 years old. She is a widow and has two children.

Her business is fruit farming. She has been farming for 20 years.

She earns a monthly income of 4,000 KES. This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya.

She will use the loan to buy a water tank and seeds. She will use the profits from expanded business to plant tomatoes.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and seeds.

loans.name: Katina Del Carmen

texts.es: Katina de 32 años es una microempresaria residente en un barrio de Cartagena de Indias un municipio del departamento de Bolívar en donde la gastronomía tiene bases tradicionales llegadas de España y varios sitios del África.  Con esta herencia ancestral Katina se unió a un grupo de vecinas de su comunidad para dar inició a su microempresa de dulces típicos entre ellos ajonjolí, casabe, bolas de tamarindo y conservas, las cuales son distribuidas entre tiendas de barrio y supermercados. Hoy en día cuenta con 11 años de experiencia en esta sociedad y su éxito está ligado a su compromiso y pasión por el trabajo. Ella es madre soltera responsable de la crianza de su hija y al no contar con la compañía y el apoyo de su pareja, su hija ha estado ceñida a un estilo de familia monoparental, lo que le exige ser muy entregada a su labor para poder brindarle un bienestar y un buen futuro. En la actualidad está aplicando su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará insumos para la elaboración de sus dulces, inversión que le permitirá ampliar la gama de productos.  Su meta  a futuro es tener más asociadas y seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Katina is a 32 year old micro entrepreneur. She resides in a neighborhood of Cartagena de Indias, a municipality in the department of Bolívar where the gastronomy has traditions that originate from Spain and various parts of Africa. With this ancestral inheritance Katina got together with a group of neighbors to start her traditional sweets micro business. Amongst them are ajonjolí, casabe, tamarind balls and preserves which are distributed to neighborhood stores and supermarkets.

Today she has eleven years experience in this partnership and her success depends on her compromise and her love for her work. She is a single mother responsible for raising her daughter and not having the company and support of her partner, her daughter has become accustomed to the one parent lifestyle. It demands that Katrina be very dedicated to her work to be able to offer her well-being and a good future.

She is currently applying for her first loan from KIva which she will use to buy supplies to make her sweets, an investment that will allow her to expand her range of products. Her goal for the future is to have more associates and to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make her sweets, an investment that will allow her to expand her range of products.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en: Galina is a farmer from Chkalovo, in the Melitopol region of Ukraine. She grows grapes, peaches, apples, and plums. She also breeds livestock and has 40 pigs. Galina, 51, is married and has two grown children. Galina is applying for a loan of 30,000 UAH (Ukrainian Hryvnias) to buy more young pigs to breed. She is a very experienced farmer and stock breeder. Galina wants to see her business grow, to bring in a stable income to support herself and her family of four.

loans.use: to buy more young pigs to breed

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es: Rosa de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de retazos de tela desde hace 18 años su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y ya tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como puede salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas retazos de tela por mayor para poder continuar con su tabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 61 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner. For 18 years she has worked selling fabric remnants. Her business is located in her home, and she has many customers. With what she obtains through sales she can move forward with the household expenses.

She is seeking a loan to buy more fabric remnants wholesale, in order to be able to continue with her work and thereby increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy fabric remnants wholesale.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 53 years old. He is married and has four children.

His business is farming. He has been in this business for 31 years.

He earns a monthly income of 13,000 KES. This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy chemicals to spray against mango weevils and pay for labor.

He will use the profits from the expanded business to educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to have at least 1,000 mango trees.

loans.use: to buy chemicals to spray against mango weevils and pay for labour.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses, 59, is married and has three children. His business is farming, and he has been in this business for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of 22,000 KES (Kenya shillings). This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy pesticide to spray on his crops. He will use the profits from his expanded production to improve his standard of living. His hopes and dreams are to have a stable family.

loans.use: to buy pesticide to spray on his crops.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes, 31, is married and has five children. Her business is farming – growing maize, cow peas and mangoes. She has been in thia business for six years. She earns a monthly income of 19,000 KES (Kenya shillings). This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. She will use the profits from her expanded production to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to become a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Dan Asabe

texts.en:
Dan Asabe is a Babban Gona farmer from Tashar Bakwake Vilage.

Dan Asabe joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Dan Asabe will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer.

With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Dan Asabe would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Charisma

texts.en:
Charisma is 42 years old and a member of CCT's Silang, Cavite Branch. She is happily married to Dennis, a PNP officer with whom she has two children of which the eldest is already at college level and the other one is not of school age yet. With the high cost of living and low purchasing power of peso in the Philippines, Charisma found ways and means to augment their income.

She has been into buy-and-sell durable Pyrex and Corelle glassware for twenty years already. People who can afford these imported brands prefer this type of glassware for its durability and beauty. Although not a lot of Filipinos buy them, she still perseveres in selling because it is still an additional income and will help somehow in her child's schooling.

Charisma hopes to avail a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP to pay for a number of boxes of glassware to be delivered to her new customers. She hopes for your favorable response. She thanks God for the people of Kiva who gives access to loans to small business people like her.

Just like most Filipina mothers, Charisma's dream is for her child to earn a college degree to allow her a better future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for glassware and cooking utensils to sell.

loans.name: Dharmanand

texts.en:
Dharmanand is 46 years old, He lives together with his wife and one child in a neighborhood where there is no electricity.

Dharmanand is a very hardworking man who does rice cultivation on 10 hectares of land. Beside rice cultivation, he also works as a field worker with his tractors for his colleagues, other rice farmers. This gives him extra income for the household and for the his child's studies.

Next season, Dharmanand wants to continue with his rice cultivation but he lacks the finances for buying fertilizer. For this he needs a loan of SRD 8.000.
