loans.use: to buy fertilizers for rice cultivation.

loans.name: Delmi Del Carmen

texts.es: Delmi de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 3 años a la crainza de pollos y gracias a ese trabajo es como ella puede salir adelente con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas pollos y concentrado para continuar con la crianza ya que esa es su unica fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Delmi is 32 years old.  She lives in her own house with her husband and three children.  Since she was three, she has worked raising chickens.  And thanks to that job, this is how she is able to get ahead with the expenses that she has in her house.  

She is requesting this loan to buy more chickens and concentrate to continue raising them, since that is her only source of work.

loans.use: To buy more chicken and concentrate.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William has received a number of loans in the past, which he has fully repaid on time. He is indeed grateful to Kiva and CCT (Center for Community Transformation) for their continuous moral and financial support of his "buko" (coconut) and school supplies business. The income from his business has allowed his child to go to college.

Although he sometimes encounters difficulty when some of his "buko" are rejected, he continues to persevere and puts his heart into his business. He trusts that he can avail a PHP 50,000 loan to pay for several sacks of "buko" from farm owners and school/stationery supplies to sell at his store. He trusts again for your positive response to his request.

William dreams for his child to finish college. He knows that education is the path for his child to have a better future. He faithfully meets every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for "buko" (coconut) and school/office supplies to sell.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando tiene 32 años de edad, soltero vive en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Santo Tomás que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Rolando se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 11 años y 04 años en el cultivo de café, con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Rolando espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rolando is 32 years old and single. He lives in his own house, made from rustic materials, in the district of Santo Tomás, which is located in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca Region of Peru's sierra norte. Life in this district is tranquil. The residents primarily work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock-raising.

Rolando works in agriculture, specifically, coffee growing. He has eleven years' experience in this occupation, and he has been growing coffee for four years, with very good personal and professional references in the zone. He will use the loan that he will be granted for the purchase of compost and fertilizer in order to maintain his coffee crop properly, and for hiring workers for the harvest season.

With this, Rolando expects to offer a better quality coffee to his customers, which will have a positive impact on his income level. Thus, he will improve the quality of life for himself and for his family.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizer in order to properly maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Suurakan

texts.ru: Сууракан, 54 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, на сегодняшний день занимается полеводством и животноводством, в хозяйстве есть 3 дойные коровы, 3 теленка, 30 овец, 4 лошади, а на 3,0 Га земли, она выращивает клевер. Бизнес начала с 50,000 сом (KGS) в 1989 году. Благодаря непосильному труду, Сууракан достигла хороших успехов, ее прибыль 21,800 сом (KGS) в месяц. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для увеличения реализации экологически-чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Сууракан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своей деятельности.
texts.en: Suurakan is 54 years old, married, and has three children. She has a secondary education, and currently farms and raises livestock. She owns three dairy cows, three calves, 30 sheep, four horses, and grows clover on 3 hectares of land. The business began in 1989 with investment of 50,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her incredibly hard work Suurakan has been very successful, and now has a monthly income of 21,800 som (KGS). She asked Bai Tushum Bank for a 150,000 som (KGS) loan to buy dairy cows to expand her sales of organic milk. She plans to invest proceeds from use of the loan into further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows in order to increase her volume of organic milk sales

loans.name: Rabiétou

texts.fr: Rabiétou est une femme mariée qui vit à Agoè avec trois enfants à charge. Agée de 41 ans, Rabiétou vend des bijoux pour gagner son revenu quotidien. Pour s’approvisionner, Rabiétou se rend quatre fois par mois au marché. Rabiétou demande ce crédit pour commander des séries des boucles d’oreilles et des garanties en vue de se faire une marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir aider son mari à supporter les charges quotidiennes de la famille et de bien prendre soin des enfants.
texts.en:
Rabiétou is a 41-year-old married woman who lives in Agoè with three children in her care. She sells jewellery in order to earn her daily income. Rabiétou gets her supplies four times per month from market.

She is requesting this loan to purchase earrings and other jewellery so she can earn a profit and thereby support her husband with their daily household expenses and take good care of their children.

loans.use: to purchase two sets of earrings and other jewellery.

loans.name: Chinara

texts.ru: Чинара, 33 года, замужем, есть 3 детей. У нее высшее образование. Занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Чинары и ее семьи, на данный момент в хозяйстве имеется  корова, 20 овец. На участке мерою 2,87 ГА выращивает кукурузу, фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 22,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чинара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели и 10 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Чинара планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Chinara is 33 years old, married, and has three children. She has a college education, and now is a farmer. Thanks to her tireless work Chinara and her family currently own a cow and twenty sheep, as well as 2.87 hectares of land where she grows corn and beans. Her monthly income is around 22,000 som (KGS). To further develop her business, Chinara asked Bai Tushum Bank for a 120,000 som (KGS) loan to buy a heifer and ten sheep to expand her herd. She plans to invest income from use of the loan into further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase one heifer and ten sheep in order to expand her herd

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres. Está ubicado en la Cuidad de Caacupé, donde las 19 integrantes del comité realizan muchos esfuerzos para así poder salir adelante junto con sus familias. Ellas son mujeres luchadoras que quieren mejorar sus vidas a través del trabajo en equipo y con la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya a través de sus capacitaciones.
La señora Dionicia, junto con su familia se dedican a la venta de plantas en su casa, es muy emprendedora, y estando en el comité ha superado varias etapas de su vida y la de su familia. Ella y su familia están trabajando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través de su negocio. Comenta que poco a poco se ha hecho de muy buena clientela y es muy conocida en su barrio por las hermosas plantas que tiene.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar semillas, abonos, y otros tipos de plantas, para poder seguir con su venta, y de esa manera tener una mayor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group called "Kuña Guapa" is in their second loan cycle with the Woman's Committee Program. It is located in the city of Caacupé, where the 19 members of the committee make great efforts to get head with their families. They are fighters who want to improve their lives through their team work and with the help of the Fundación Paraguaya through their training.

Dionicia together with her family works selling plants from her house. She is very enterprising and being in the committee she has gotten past a variety of stages in her life and that of her family. She and her family are working to improve their living conditions trough her business. She comments that little by little she has gained a good clientele and is well known in her neighborhood for the beautiful plants she has.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy seeds, manure and other types of plants so she can continue with her sales. In this way she will have greater variety to offer her clients. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure and other types of plants to sell.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Cesar se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 15 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Cesar espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar is 37 years old.  He lives with his partner and children in his own home, which is built from rustic materials.  His home is in the Pomahuaca district, located in the Jaén province of the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Perú.  Life in this district is calm, and the people there work mainly in agriculture, trade, and ranching.

Cesar works in farming, specifically in cultivating coffee.  He has fifteen years of experience in this line of work, with great personal and work references from the area.  The loan that he will be granted will be used to buy soil amendments and fertilizers to improve and maintain his coffee plants, as well as for contracting field hands for the harvest season.  With this, Cesar hopes to sell higher-quality coffee to his buyers, which will have a positive impact on his income level and, in the end, will improve his own quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and fertilizers to care for his coffee crop

loans.name: Carme-Suze

texts.fr: Carme-Suze est âgée de 33 ans. Elle est mariée et a un enfant.  Pour trouver de quoi faire vivre sa famille, elle a ouvert une petite boutique de produits alimentaires chez elle. Cette activité l’aide à gagner des revenus pour contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en: Carme-Suze is 33 years old. She is married and has one child. Looking for a way to support her family, she opened a little grocery store at her home. This activity helps her to earn income to contribute to covering family expenses.

loans.use: to buy some cases of soft drinks.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De San Nicolas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se formó en la ciudad de Encarnación, se formó con la unión de amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando y esforzándose para poder ir mejorando y creciendo en el emprendimiento que cada una hace.
Una de las que integra este grupo es la Sra. Ramona, una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha por sus seres queridos, ya que quiere darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Comenta que formo con mucho sacrificio su pequeña despensa, y hoy ya tiene una clientela bien formada, a través del cual sostiene a su familia y otros seres queridos. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y es por ello que decidió unirse a este grupo.
La Sra. Ramona solicita este préstamo para la compra de Harina, arroz, fideos, frutas, verduras, etc., lo que le ayudará a incrementar sus ventas, el cual ayudara a  mejorar sus ingresos y seguir de esa forma con sus ventas.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the city of Encarnación.  It is made up of a group of friends and neighbors from that city.  They are in the Elimination of Poverty program, making an effort and struggling to be able to go on improving and growing the businesses that each one has.  

One of the group members is Ramona, a very hardworking woman who struggles on for her loved ones because she wants to give them all that she couldn’t have.  She says that she created her small store with great sacrifice, and today she has a well-established customer base.  Through this business she supports her family and other loved ones.  Her goal is to be able to keep growing, and it is because of that that she joined this group.

Ramona is asking for a loan to buy flour, rice, noodles, fruit, vegetables, etc., which will help her to increase her sales, in turn helping to improve her income and keep on going with her sales.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, noodles, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Frankli Antonio

texts.es:
FRANKLIN DE 42 AÑOS DE EDAD, ORIGINARIO DE MANAGUA, PADRE SOLTERA CON DOS HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, DE 10,16 AÑOS LOS CUALES ESTAN ESTUDIANO RESPECTIVAMENTE, SON  SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORA, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, LO CUAL HA DEMOSTRADO EN LAS FORMAS DE PAGO EN LOS CREDITO ANTERIORES  SIEMPRE HA CUMPLIDO EN TIEMPO Y FORMA, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHA POR SALIR ADELANTE, HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO,  Y SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA UNA PULPERIA ES UN PEQUEÑA TIENDA QUE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES COMO: ARROZ, FRIJOLES, AZUCAR, LECHE, PAN, HUEVOS, DETERGENTES, JABON, JUGOS, GASEOSAS, GALLETAS, ETC.  EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN UN LUGAR ESPECIFICO DE LA LOCALIDAD, TIENE OCHO AÑOS DE DESEMPEÑAR DICHA ACTIVIDAD, EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO PARA SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES, FRANKLIN AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO
texts.en:
Franklin is 42 years old and is originally from Managua.  He is a single father with two young children, ages 10 and 16, who are both going to school.

He is known to be hardworking, responsible, with a drive to improve himself.  He has demonstrated this through paying previous loans.  He has always paid them on time.  His attitude is to strive to get ahead, grow his company, and satisfy the demands of his customers.  Thanks to his drive to get ahead, he has a "pulpería" which is a small store that sells consumable products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergents, soap, juices, soda, crackers, etc.  His business is located in a specific place in the town.  He has worked for eight years in this job.   

The objective of the loan is to invest the working capital to stock his business to satisfy the demand of his customers.  Franklin is thankful for the help that the Kiva investors give to people of few resource and poor countries like Nicaragua to have the means to dignified work

loans.use: To buy consumable products such as rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, juice, crackers, etc.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es de la ciudad de Encarnación, es una persona muy trabajadora, que se esfuerza por medio de su negocio para poder ayudar a su familia. Tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta muy tarde en la noche.
Francisca trabaja en su negocio hace dos años y ya tiene una muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella en su pequeño negocio. Desea seguir mejorándolo, y es por eso que pide este préstamo, para poder ampliar su local de despensa, y de esa forma poder seguir ofreciendo una buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
La señora Francisca is from the city of Encarnación.  She is a hardworking person who works through her business to be able to help her family.  She has a well stocked convenience store that she works in every day from very early hours of the day until very late at night.

Francisca has worked in her business for two years, and she has a good clientele that always buy from her small store.  She wishes to continue improving it, and that is why she is requesting this loan to be able to increase the size of her store, and in that way to able to continue offering good service to her customers.

loans.use: To increase the size of her store.

loans.name: Erkinbubu

texts.ru: Эркинбубу, 55 лет, замужем. У нее среднее образование, по характеру очень спокойная, трудолюбивая и доброжелательная женщина. Эркинбубу начала свой трудовой стаж с работы продавцом в магазине, с 2007 года стала работать в ЖКХ, с 2014 года начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Эркинбубу, на сегодняшний день у нее имеется 5 коров, 25 овец. На 4,34 Га земли выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Эркинбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на закуп коровы и 10 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Эркинбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, чтобы накопить на постройку сарая.
texts.en: Erkinbubu is a fifty-five year old married woman with a secondary education. She is a very quiet, hardworking, and friendly person. Her first job was as a shop clerk, in 2007 she began working for Department of Housing and Communal Services, and since 2014 she has been farming and raising livestock. She began the business with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Erkinbubu's tireless work she now owns five cows and twenty-five sheep, as well as growing beans to sell on 4.34 hectares of land. Her monthly income is around 20,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Erkinbubu asked Bai-Tushum bank for a 100,000 som (KGS) loan to buy a cow and ten sheep to expand her livestock herd. She plans to invest the income from use of the loan into further expansion of her business, in order to save up to build a barn.

loans.use: to buy one cow and  10 sheep in order to increase her livestock herd

loans.name: Marie Paulette

texts.fr: Marie Paulette est revendeuse de produits alimentaires. Elle a 57 ans.  Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle travaille sans relâche pour améliorer ses conditions financières. Elle cherche un financement pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Marie Paulette is a small-scale retailer of foodstuffs. She is 57 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. She works constantly to improve her financial situation. She is looking for financing to grow her inventory.

loans.use: to buy some sacks of wheat.

loans.name: Nelien Pelignon

texts.fr: Nelien a 51 ans. Il est marié et a trois enfants. Il vit à Delmas avec sa femme et ses enfants. Il gère une petite imprimerie. Il fait des impressions, des copies et vend aussi des livres. Cette activité lui procure des revenus suffisants pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il demande un microcrédit pour acheter du papier et des cartouches d’encre.
texts.en: Nelien is 51 years old. He is married and has three children. He lives in Delmas with his wife and his children. He manages a small print shop. He does printing, makes copies, and also sells books. This business brings in enough income to support his family. He is asking for a small loan to buy paper and ink cartridges.

loans.use: to buy paper and ink cartridges.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es: Rosalba de 52 años, reside en compañía de su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en Cartagena, un municipio ubicado en el departamento de Bolívar con gran afluencia turística por su belleza natural y sitios cargados de historia.  Esta emprendedora consideró que una alternativa de generar ingresos para su familia podría ser vender pescado en su vivienda, propuesta que recibió de una amiga oriunda de Magangué, quien le provee de gran variedad de pescados entre ellos mojarra, bagre, jurel y bocachico, los cuales comercializa a sus vecinos, conocidos y transeúntes.  Ella conserva las diferentes especies de pescado en un enfriador y los vende según su peso, de este modo Rosalba cuenta con seis años de funcionamiento ofreciendo bienestar a su familia. Ella está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en surtido de pescados; mojarra roja, bague y jurel. Esta inversión dinamizará las ventas y la acercará a su meta de continuar creciendo en su negocio y adquirir un enfriador en cuanto su cobertura se amplié.
texts.en:
Rosalba is 52 years old.  She resides in the company of her partner and their three children in Cartagena, a municipality located in the department of Bolívar, which has a big tourist affluence due to its natural beauty and sites filled with history.  

This entrepreneur considered that an alternative to making money for her family would be to sell fish from her home.  This was a proposition that she received from a friend native to Magangué, who provided her with a big variety of fish, among them crappie, catfish, mackerel, and small mouth, that she sold to her neighbors, acquaintances, and passersby.  She keeps the different species of fish in a freezer and sells them by weight.  In this way, Rosalba has worked six years providing for the well being of her family.

She is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo so that she can invest in a stock of fish including red tilapia, catfish, and mackerel.  This loan will increase the sales and get her closer to her goal to continue increasing her business and get a freezer for when her coverage expands.

loans.use: To invest in a stock of fish: red tilapia, catfish, and mackerel.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Hayin Ade Village. She joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children. In the past, Naomi suffered from poor yields that crippled her ability to expand her farm. With help from Babban Gona, she will have access to the best farm supplies in the market, including fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will increase her household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Naomi now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy better supplies that will increase her farm's yields.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en: Andrea has a son and she lives with him; her son is an adult.  Andrea makes cheese and sells milk but two of her cows died because of an illness and that is why she is making money by selling candy, soft drinks, and other snacks at a stand she owns at her community. Now she needs a loan to buy a milk cow because she would like to be in the milk business again.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Maykol

texts.en: Maykol works as a teacher at a school in his city. He is 27 years old, single and lives with his parents. In the past, he helped his parents build a house, and now he needs a new loan to continue construction work. Maykol supports his parents and works hard as a teacher. He is grateful for any assistance provided by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to continue construction work on his house.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is 31 years old, single, and he lives at his parents' house. Roger makes backpacks for children. He is good at sewing because he has been practicing since he was very young.

Roger needs a loan to buy a couple of sewing machines. He is single but he supports his parents. Both of them are senior citizens and they are retired.

loans.use: to buy a couple of sewing machines

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 30 years old and the mother of one son who lives in her parents' house and helps them with expenses. She owns a library and needs a loan to buy supplies. Maria works hard and runs her business by herself, but believes she will do well because she knows what kinds of products are most popular. She is grateful for help provided by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her library

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 70 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge, no tiene hijos bajo responsabilidad, vive en una comunidad en el distrito de Cañarís,rural contando con luz y agua, provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Francisco se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con terreno agricola, en la cual posee fincas de cafe variedad catimor,tiene 15 años dedicandose a este rubro por lo que presenta muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. El destino del crédito es para la compra de abonos y mantenimiento de su finca de cafe, invirtiendo en su negocio y podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptale para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco is 70 years old, and he lives with his spouse. He is not responsible for any children. He lives in a community in Cañarís, a rural district in the province of Ferreñafe in the Lambayeque Region of Peru's northern coast. It has electricity and water. His community is primarily devoted to agriculture, livestock-raising, and commerce.

Francisco works in agriculture. He has agricultural land, on which he grows Catimor coffee. He has been working in this field for fifteen years, so he has very good personal and professional references.

This loan is destined for the purchase of compost and for maintaining his coffee farm. By investing in his business, he will be able to earn a fair profit, so that he may thus improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase compost, and to maintain his coffee farm.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is grateful to Kiva and CCT for their tireless financial and moral support. She has received a number of loans which helped her have a productive harvest of pine apples and thus provided income to feed her children and send them to school. To sustain and increase her crop, she is again seeking assistance in the amount of Php 19,000 to buy seedlings and fertilizer and hire workers. Although her farm suffers when hit by typhoons, she maintains her faith that they can make it through. After the storm, the sun rises again and gives new life and renewed hope for better days.

Emelita's goal for the future is to have a bigger farm and see her children to finish their schooling. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who study religion, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.name: Ishaku

texts.en: Ishaku is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Hayin Ade Village. He joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his business. With Babban Gona’s help, he will have access to the best farm supplies on the market, including fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ishaku now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income, and use his extra earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy improved farm supplies that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Solange

texts.fr: Solange est une femme divorcée qui vit à Agoè. Agée de 25 ans, Solange est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne une  fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Solange nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice et pouvoir aider aux charges de sa famille et de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
Solange is a 25-year-old divorcee who lives in Agoè. She earns a living through selling wood charcoal which she purchases monthly from the local market then resells out of her own home.

In order to pay for her purchase, Solange needs this loan to buy sacks of wood charcoal so she can earn a profit, meet her family's expenses and see to her own daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase 11 sacks of wood charcoal.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Divorcée et mère de trois enfants, Abla est une femme qui vit  à Agoè. Agée de 35 ans, Abla est une revendeuse  des coussins qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois  au marché et le revend dans les quartiers environnant. Abla demande ce crédit pour commander des séries de coussins afin de répondre aux attentes de ses clients et gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour pouvoir supporté les charges quotidiennes de ses enfants et elle-même.
texts.en:
35-year-old Abla is a divorced mother to three children who lives in Agoè. Abla earns a living through selling cushions which she purchases four times per month from market then resells as a street vendor.

Abla is requesting this loan to purchase cushions in order to meet her customers' expectations and earn a solid profit so she can see to her children's daily expenses as well as her own.

loans.use: to purchase two sets of cushions.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is 43 years old. He pays rent and he is in the meat business.

Juan is a good butcher and he offer his services at many markets.

He also is the owner of his own business and he needs a loan to buy a cutting machine for the meat he sells.

Juan is single; he doesn't have children, but he is alone so he hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy a cutting machine for the meat he sells

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 43 years old; he is the owner of the house where he lives. He is father of two sons.

Rogelio is in the jewelry business; he trained a lot of years, so he is an experienced person.

Rogelio would like to have a garage at his house, and he needs a loan to buy construction materials.

Rogelio would like to finish the construction of his house because is taking a lot of time.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a garage at his house

loans.name: Mujeres De Chinimajul Group

texts.en:
The town of Sacapulas is located in the center of the department of Quiché in the western highlands of Guatemala. The population has been described as very active and hard-working. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, “Mujeres de Chinimajul”, was formed by 10 women who have a strong work ethic. These ladies, who have a variety of small businesses, are requesting a loan from KIVA investors to purchase supplies, increase income and meet the daily needs of their families.

Elisa is a 37-year-old member of the group who was able to attend school until the 3rd grade. She is divorced and supports her four children, who are all enrolled in school. Some are in elementary school while others are in high school. It was 10 years ago that she became both mother and father to her children. They are her motivation for working hard, so that they can have a more prosperous future.

Elisa buys and sells beans, vegetables, chickens and pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase 15 chickens, 2 pigs and a large quantities of beans. With the earnings from the sale of these items, she will re-invest the funds in additional inventory and will be able to cover the personal and educational needs of her four children.

Elisa and her friends in the Trust Bank look forward to their monthly meetings. After transacting business on their loans, the ladies participate in educational trainings conducted by a facilitator from Friendship Bridge. These sessions focus on four key pillars: family, women’s rights, health and business development.

KIVA investors are greatly valued for their generosity in providing funds for these much-needed loans. Elisa and the ladies in the Trust Bank will step into a brighter and more prosperous future benefitting themselves, their families and their community in Sacapulas, Guatemala. Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase 15 chickens, 2 pigs and large quantities of beans to sell.

loans.name: Diamantes Group

texts.en:
There are seven hardworking women in the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Diamantes” or “Diamonds”, who live Huehuetenango in the western highlands of Guatemala. The ladies have various small businesses, including a convenience store, tortilleria (tortilla shop), sales of watches, and shoe sales by catalogue and sales of silver items. These women are a very unique and special group, as 90% are studying at the university level. They are determined to create a more prosperous future for themselves and their families.

Mirna is a member of “Diamantes” and has a business selling silver items including bracelets, rings, and chains. She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory. This is especially important at this time of the year when the holidays are fast approaching.

Mirna shares that she really likes to participate in the Trust Bank as the ladies are committed, responsible and motivated to improve their lives. She enjoys participating in the educational trainings held at each monthly Trust Bank meeting. “Microcredit Plus” is how Friendship Bridge defines the combination of small loans and education. Some of the subjects covered include effective business tools and development, health, hygiene and nutrition as well as women’s rights.

Gratitude to KIVA investors for funding much-needed loans for the ladies in the Trust Bank “Diamantes”. It would be impossible for them to secure a loan from a bank.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of silver items including bracelets, rings, chains, etc to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase supplies in order to make shish kebabs, such as meat, condiments, yuca, bread, and other items.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Ayawa est une femme mariée âgée de 28 ans qui vit à Agoè. Ayawa est une cultivatrice des légumes qui s’approvisionne du nécessaire deux fois par mois au marché. Ayawa livre le rendement de sa culture aux détaillants. Pour commander les graines de légumes et  de l’engrais chimique, Ayawa sollicite ce prêt pour financer son achat et gagner des bénéfices en vue d’aider son mari à payer les frais scolaire des enfants dès la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en:
Ayawa is a 28-year-old married mother to three children who lives in Agoè. She earns a living through growing vegetables. She gets her supplies twice monthly from market and delivers her crops to retailers.

In order to buy vegetable seeds and chemical fertilizer, Ayawa is requesting a loan to finance this purchase so she can earn a solid profit and thereby aide her husband in paying for their children's school fees for the upcoming academic year.

loans.use: to purchase two packets of vegetable seeds and one sack of chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Carole

texts.fr: Carole, 45 ans, vit union libre. Elle habite dans la ville de Delmas avec son compagnon et leurs deux enfants  et ses enfants à Delmas. Carole revend des produits alimentaires pour pouvoir prendre soin de sa famille. Sa boutique est très achalandée. Elle souhaite la développer davantage pour augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en: Carole, aged 45, lives in common-law marriage. She resides in the town of Delmas with her partner and their two children and her children in Delmas. Carole sells grocery items to be able to care for her family. Her shop is heavily patronized. Her wish is to develop it further in order to increase her revenues.

loans.use: to purchase cases of oil and sacks of sugar

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru: Лола, 51 год, замужем. У нее высшее образование, в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, работает экономистом в сельской управе, также занимается разведением скота и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Лолы, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 3 коровы, 10 овец. На земельном участке мерою 2,0 Га собственной земли выращивает перец и клевер. Также есть сад, выращивают фрукты для собственного потребления. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 21,000 сом (KGS). Лола обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и на обработку почвы. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и ремонт жилого дома.
texts.en:
Lola is 51 years old and married.  She has a university education and works as an economist in the local village council to provide the main source of income for her family.  She also raises livestock and grows crops for a living.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, Lola currently has 3 cows and 10 sheep, and grows pepper and clovers on a 2.0-hectare plot of her own land.  She also has a garden where she and her family grow fruit for their own use.  All their activities bring in a monthly profit of 21,000 som.

Lola has requested a loan of 120,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy livestock and prepare the soil for cultivation.  She plans on using her extra income due to the loan to further expand her business, as well as renovate her home.

loans.use: purchase some livestock and cultivate her land in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.fr: Rose Marie est âgée de 52 ans.  Elle vit en union libre. Elle a 5 enfants avec son compagnon. Il y a de cela six ans, elle a démarré un petit commerce de produits alimentaires. Elle vend aussi des boissons gazeuses. Elle a besoin d’un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Rose Marie, aged 52, lives in a common-law marriage. She has five children with her partner. Six years before, she began a small-scale business involving grocery items. She also sells carbonated drinks. She needs a loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to purchase carbonated drinks

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is working at a school as a secretary. She is helped by her daughter because the two of them sell shoes every weekend. They go to El Alto to sell the shoes. Maria is a single mother, and she is not working as a hairdresser anymore.

Some time ago, Maria purchased a house. Now she needs a loan to make repairs at her house because the place needs a lot of work. She hopes you can help her again.

loans.use: to make repairs at her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell, such as jeans, shirts, pants, and other items.

loans.name: Aidana

texts.en:
“I (have been) interested in psychology from the fifth form. I still remember how we used to play many games, take tests and make small psychological researches with our teacher. In addition to this, the love to psychology I have inherited from my mother, I think.

I am the only child in my family and I live with my mother. My parents divorced when I was two years old, and my mother never married another man again. As everybody knows, the divorce process brings a lot of stress and depression, which my mother also faced. My mother had a great grief, but she promised to devote her life to me, so started to read psychological books as needed support from someone or something.

My mother is an economist by her profession. Currently, she is unemployed, which caused big problems in our expenses, and we have difficulties in paying my university tuition fee. Currently, she is attending job fairs and going to the interviews.

I believe in fate that if someone tries and does his/her best, for sure God will bless him/her later. I have always studied well and was an active student at school. I believe that study at AUCA will open new perspectives in the future and will allow me to have exchange programs to different countries, and get experience in my field. I thank Kiva for the given opportunity and wait for the lenders' support.”

loans.use: to pay for her tuition in the psychology department at AUCA.

loans.name: Marie Francienne

texts.fr: Francienne est commerçante. Elle vend des produits alimentaires. Elle a 52 ans, est mariée et mère de deux enfants.  Elle se bat quotidiennement pour améliorer sa situation financière. Elle souhaite développer son activité pour en tirer plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Francienne is a merchant selling grocery items. She is 52 years old and the married mother of two. She struggles each day to improve her financial situation. Her wish is to develop her business in order to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase smoked herring and containers of oil

loans.name: Saole

texts.en: Saole is 42 years old with 7 children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Saole requested for a loan to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2013, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals,

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is a married woman. She is living with her parents and is still making bags for food.

Justina has been working hard, but she realized that she can increase her production of bags. She needs another loan to purchase materials for making bags from plastic and jute. Justina hopes you can help her again.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making bags from plastic and jute for her grocery bag sales business.

loans.name: Esquipulas Group

texts.en:
The town of Santa María Chiquimula is located southeast of Totonicapán in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. The Mayan K’iche language is spoken among the indigenous people here but Spanish is also widely spoken. The main products of the region are corn and black beans. The climate is cool and the landscape quite beautiful.

Eleven women have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Esquipulas”. They have a vision of being focused and working hard so that their businesses will grow and expand. Some of these businesses include a bakery, tailor shop, convenience store, and animal husbandry (chickens, pigs, goats). The ladies' average age is 35 years old and 75% of them have between 6-8 children and 80% have had some primary school education.

Antonia, a 46-year-old member of the Trust Bank, is a single woman who contributes earnings to the family home. This is the tradition in rural areas if a grown “child” is not married and lives at home. Antonia has a convenience store and needs a loan so that she can purchase salt, sugar, pasta, corn, eggs, soups, and animal feed in a concentrated form. She wants to be certain to carry the merchandise that her customers desire.

The “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge combines microcredit with basic education on everyday topics including business themes (budgeting, pricing, marketing, accounting, customer service), empowerment and self-esteem as well as nutrition, health and hygiene.

Thank you, Kiva lenders, for your kindness and generosity in funding loans for these ladies. Armed with their new tools, they are poised to step into a brighter future benefitting themselves, their families and their community in Santa Maria Chiquimula.

loans.use: to purchase salt, sugar, pasta, corn, eggs, soup, and animal feed in a concentrated form for her   convenience store.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 62 years old, and has six children to provide for. Due to the early death of her husband , she had to work hard to earn for a living and support the needs of her children and for her grandchildren.She has been selling goods like coffee, noodles, canned goods, sugar and other primary needs of her customers in their local community.

She joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to enable him to engage in business activities. Recently, Rosalia took a loan to buy more goods to sell to her loyal customers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell to her loyal customers

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 42-year-old, married man from Rafah City, in Gaza Strip. He lives with his family in a small, old house, where he is the only breadwinner for his family and they depend on him for support.

Mohammad has a stall for selling fruit and vegetables in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict. Mohammad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of fruit and vegetables to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to cover school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of  fruit and vegetables  to sell at his stall

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock up with five sacks of rice

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 48 years old and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of a son and daughter.
She owns a beauty parlor and is an expert in makeup services. Most of her clients are from the neighborhood and appreciate her services. With the passage of time her beauty products have been diminishing and this time she wants to buy more beauty products for her beauty salon.

Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so she will be able to buy new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion, etc.
She wants to establish a parlor in the main market of town because she wants to enhance her income. Yasmeen thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion, etc. for her parlor.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 49-years-old married woman. She is a mother of three daughters and three sons and she has been making embroidery by hand at home for many years to support her family. Her husband remains sick most of the time and unable to do a job. To look after her children and to meet household expenses, she started to do embroidery at home. A supplier comes to her home and provides her with all the raw materials for making embroidery and she completes her tasks along her daughters over wooden frames.

She wants to sells embroidery directly in the market so that she can earn more profit for her family. She has become expert in her art and wants to buy raw materials her own use, so that she can sell her hand made embroidery in her hometown.

Therefore, Yasmeen has requested a Kiva loan to buy raw material and wooden frames so she can do more embroidered dresses to sell and can generate the maximum income.
She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and wooden frames for her embroidery work. .

loans.name: Gabriela Anabelle

texts.en:
Gabriela is a woman in her late 30s, pictured at the dance floor in her school. She is currently married to a loving husband and she is a fully devoted mother to her two young kids. This family is supported by Gabriela's work and by her husband. They both make a big effort in order to be able to provide for their children.

Gabriela contributes to the house's expenses by giving dancing lessons in a school she owns. She teaches different styles like Salsa, Rumba, Mumba, Danzon, Tango and Zumba. She thinks that besides being a recreation activity, it is great exercise. She wants to make improvements to the school by changing the dance floor and buying an exercise machine. In order to do this, she is asking for a 13,000.00 MXN loan. Her husband is supporting this project and loan as much as he can.

loans.use: to renew her dance school.

loans.name: Tuongozane Group

texts.fr: Fazila est une femme artiste, membre du groupe de crédits «Tuongozane», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un infirmier, âgée de 54 ans, mère de 6 enfants dont un seul étudie et 5 autres sont déjà grands. Elle est vendeuse des paniers préfabriqués dans un marché depuis 4 ans. Elle commença son activité avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va s’approvisionner en materiels de fabrication ( 13 rouleaux de fils). Elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Fazila is a female artist and member of the "Tuongozane" loan group, a client of the field partner MFI Hekima. She is married to a nurse and is 54 years old. She has six children, only one of whom is still in school, and the five others are already grown.

She has been selling pre-made baskets in the market for the past four years. She started her business with money she received from her husband. She will purchase supplies (13 reels of yarn). She hopes to build a house and to pay for schooling and food for her children.

Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for the support that they provide to entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase supplies (13 reels of yarn).

loans.name: Vista Hermosa Group

texts.en:
Uspantán is the one of the largest cities in the northwestern Guatemalan State of El Quiche.  It is almost 6,000 feet high surrounded by lush green forests and higher mountains.  Three Mayan languages, along with Spanish are spoken by the people.  

Uspantán’s beauty is reflected in the Friendship Bridge’s Trust Bank “Vista Hermosa” (Beautiful View).  Seven very dedicated and hardworking women make up the Trust Bank.  They only have had a formal education through the 2nd grade as was customary when they were young.  Young girls were expected to stay at home to help take care of household chores.  Their lack of a formal education  has not deterred them and they have become small business owners in ventures such as animal husbandry, selling medicines, and owning convenience stores.  

Maria, who is 47 years old and married, has a business raising and then selling chickens and pigs at her local market, as well as in nearby markets in towns near her home.  Recently, she has had a large demand for her animals, so she is asking for a loan to buy more.   She is driven to increase her business, thus her income, because she has seven children who are in primary, as well as high school.  Maria wants her children to have a good education so that they can become professionals to break the current stereotypes of the Maya being uncultured and uneducated.  She also wants to have a higher quality of life for herself, her family and her community. 

The women of “Vista Hermosa” are very grateful to KIVA investors for providing the loans that help them grow their businesses which in turn helps them build their homes little by little.  In Guatemala it is impossible for women, like Maria who have little or no education, to get credit from banks.  Friendship Bridge with its “Microcredit Plus” program of combining credit with education helps the women build their businesses, their self-esteem and create a better future for themselves, their families and their communities.  It is a win-win for all.  Thank you KIVA investors!!!

loans.use: to buy more chickens, and pigs to sell. .

loans.name: Nayeli Guadalupe

texts.en:
Nayeli is woman on her early 20s and she has two sons and a loving husband. She currently works at a clothing store and to make an extra income she sells clothes through a catalog.

She had a previous loan with Kiva and Kubo. With it she financed her catalog selling business. She repaid the loan and now she is asking for a new 15,000.00 MXN loan in order to fix her house floor and some parts of the roof to avoid water leaks.

loans.use: to make house improvents

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 120 liters of oil.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan lives with his wife and three sons. He retired from the New York City Police Department in 2007 and has always had the idea of starting his own security company. However, he felt that he needed to wait for the right time. When he retired, he worked part-time as a security guard for other companies and made the decision to launch his own business last year. Due to his law enforcement background and passion for safety, it was natural for Jonathan to start his own security business. He now currently employs a staff of 40 people.

The greatest success he has had so far has been the ability to be contracted by many companies. However, he has faced several challenges because he is operating with very little capital. So far, he has been doing his best to make it work.

Jonathan is currently seeking a loan to continue the growth of his company. He recently signed a contract that requires him to increase the size of his staff, buy new equipment such as radios, earpieces and uniforms for his employees. He is also in need of purchasing additional equipment for his office. He hopes to be able to continue to grow his business for his family. Through the success of his business, he wants to show his sons that hard work does pays off.

loans.use: to hire additional employees and purchase new equipment

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a businesswoman from Danao, Plaridel. She is 52 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Susan is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Susan continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en: Rene is a strong-willed man who pushes his ability when it comes to his piggery business. He is a hands-on businessman and father who never gets tired of supporting his family. Recently, he availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from his project of concreting the pig pens, he thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed

loans.name: Andrelie

texts.fr: Andrelie est âgée de 29 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a 2 enfants. Depuis 3 ans, elle vend des produits alimentaires( maïs, petit-mil, riz, haricot, etc) au marché de Croix-des-Bouquets. Elle aspire à réaliser beaucoup de changements au niveau de son activité. Une activité qui l’aide à prendre soin de sa famille. Andrelie désire agrandir son commerce et s’offrir de meilleures conditions de vie. Elle demande un microcrédit pour pouvoir augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Andrelie is 29 years old. She lives with her partner and has two children. For the past three years, she has been selling food products (maize, pearl millet, rice, beans etc...) at the market in Croix-des-Bouquets.

She hopes to make a lot of changes with regards to her business. This business helps her take care of her family. Andrelie wants to grow her business and give herself a higher standard of living. She is requesting this micro-loan in order to increase her stock.

loans.use: to increase her stock of rice and wheat.

loans.name: Yawa  Ahoefa

texts.fr: Yawa est une femme mariée résidant à Agoè avec six enfants à charge. Agée de 35 ans, Yawa est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile et à divers détaillants. Pour financer son achat, Yawa  nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation à leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Yawa is a 35-year-old married mother to six children who lives in Agoè. Yawa earns a living selling wood charcoal which she purchases monthly from market then resells out of her own house and to various retailers.

Yawa needs this loan to purchase sacks of wood charcoal so she can earn a greater profit and support her husband with their household expenses, thereby allowing their children to receive a good education.

loans.use: to purchase 27 sacks of wood charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his capital and purchase a large amount of rice and beans to resell and make a profit.

loans.name: Las Gemelas Group

texts.en:
“Las Gemelas” (The Twins) is a very active Trust Bank of Friendship Bridge that is located in San Juan La Laguna, a quaint and picturesque town, on the shores of Lake Atitlan.  The town is known for its colorful textiles dyed with natural dyes - shawls, scarves, purses, “huipiles” (traditional blouses) and drapes.  San Juan La Laguna is also known for its beautiful tie-dying designs.  Because of its fabulous textiles, tourists from all over the globe come to visit.

The members of “Las Gemelas” are finishing their second loan cycle with KIVA.  They are happy to report that they have seen their incomes increase which, in turn, has had a very positive impact on their families.  To continue to see changes in their lives, the women are asking for another loan to invest in their businesses.

Isabela, who is 26 years old and a mother of a small child, has an unusual business for women.  She drives a “Tuk Tuk”, a three-wheeled covered motorcycle taxi that can transport people around the town, as well as to the nearby town of San Pedro La Laguna.  The “Tuk Tuk” requires a great deal of maintenance in order to keep it in excellent condition, as well as keep it safe for her passengers.  Thus, Isabela is asking for a loan to purchase a variety of necessary vehicle parts.

Thanks to the Friendship Bridge “Microcredit Plus” program of non-formal education along with microcredit loans, the empowerment of the Maya women in Guatemala is becoming quite noticeable.  Through the program’s non-formal education, the women learn important topics like better business practices, investing wisely and saving for the future.  They also learn the importance of good health through healthy eating habits and the use of medicinal plants.  As they grow healthier both mentally and physically, so do their families and their communities.  This is a winning combination in which KIVA investors play an important role.  Thank you for helping the Maya women to have a brighter and more prosperous future!!!

loans.use: to buy new parts for her motor taxi or tuk-tuk.

loans.name: Auxiliadora

texts.es:
AUXILIADORA DE 60 AÑOS DE EDAD, ORIGINARIO DE MANAGUA MADRE SOLTERA CON TRES HIJOS MAYORES DE EDAD E INDEPENDIENTE, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORA, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL,LAMENTABLEMENTE NO PUDO ESTUDIAR POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONOMICOS, TUBO SUS HIJOS A TEMPRANA EDAD, LO CUAL LA OBLIGO A TRABAJAR PARA PODER BRINDARLES A SUS HIJOS LO NECESARIO. EN LA ACTUALIDAD A TRAVES DE SU PERSEVERANCIA HA PODIDO CUMPLIR SUS SUEÑOS Y METAS COMO FORMAR A SUS HIJOS EN PERSONAS DE BIEN, MEJORAR SU  VIVIENDA,HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO EL CUAL LO INICIO DE FORMA AMBULANTE POR UNOS DE LOS MERCADO DE LA COMUNIDAD HOY EN DIA TIENE UN TRAMO DE VENTA DE ZAPATOS EL CUAL LO HA HECHO CRECER DIA A DIA INVIRTIENDO EL CAPITAL EN EL NEGOCIO.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD  LA VENTA DE ZAPATOS  DESDE HACE TREINTA Y SEIS AÑOS QUE SE DESEMPEÑA EN DICHA ACTIVIDAD,ACTIVIDAD A LA QUE DEDICA UNAS DIES HORAS DIARIAS, PARA SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y COMPRAR UNA NUEVA VARIEDAD Y ESTILO DE ZAPATOS Y APROVECHAR LAS FIETAS PATRIAS DE LA LOCALIDAD Y DE ESA FORMA INCREMENTAR SUS VENTAS EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO. AUXILIADORA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Auxiliadora, age 60, is a native of Managua. She is a single mother, with three children who are now grown up and independent, and she is characterized by being hardworking and responsible, with the will for personal improvement. Unfortunately, she was not able to study because of a lack of economic resources, as she had her children when she was very young, which obligated her to go to work in order to be able to give her children what they needed.

Today, because of her hard work and perseverance, she has been able to achieve her dreams and goals, such as raising her children well, improving her home, and growing her business. She started it on foot in one of the community markets, and today she has a shoe store. She has made it grow day by day, investing the capital in the business.

Thanks to her will for personal improvement, she has had her shoe sales business for thirty-six years. She works approximately ten hours a day in order to satisfy her customers' demands.

The loan's purpose is the investment of working capital, and the purchase of new varieties and styles of shoes in order to make the most of the national holidays in her town. In this way, she will increase her sales in the very near future.

Auxiliadora appreciates the help that the Kiva lenders are giving to people with few resources, and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have decent work.

loans.use: to stock her business by purchasing shoes in different styles and sizes for men, women, and children.

loans.name: Marie Carmen

texts.fr: Carmen, 54 ans, est veuve.  Elle a deux fils. Elle vend des produits alimentaires chez elle sous la galerie. Elle a recours au crédit pour éviter des ruptures de stock. Palmis lui a déjà octroyé plusieurs microcrédits qui ont beaucoup contribué dans le développement de son commerce. Pour sa nouvelle demande de financement, elle compte acheter des boites de beurre et caisses d’huile.
texts.en:
54-year-old Marie Carmen is a widowed mother to two sons. She sells food products out of her own house. She has had to resort to taking out a loan in order to avoid running out of stock.

Palmis has lent her several micro-loans in the past which have greatly contributed towards developing her business. For this latest request for financing, she plans on purchasing pots of butter and containers of cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase pots of butter and gallons of cooking oil.

loans.name: Carene

texts.fr: Carène a 38 ans. Elle est propriétaire d’une petite entreprise de revente de pièces de rechange pour véhicule.  Mariée et mère de deux enfants, elle travaille sans relâche pour multiplier les revenus de son activité afin de pouvoir mieux prendre soin de sa famille et envoyer ses enfants dans de bonnes écoles. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Carène is 38 years old. She is the owner of a small business which sells spare vehicle parts. A married mother to two children, she works tirelessly to increase the revenue from this activity in order to better provide for her family so she can send her children to good schools. She is requesting this loan in order to increase her stock.

loans.use: to purchase motor oil.

loans.name: Giovanni

texts.en:
Giovanni works as a tour guide. He is very skillful and he loves his work. Giovanni takes care of his 2 sons, as Giovanni is still living at his mother's house.

Giovanni this time is asking for a loan to fix the walls of his local tourism agency. Giovanni works hard and he would like to have a bigger business , so he hopes you can help him again

loans.use: to fix the walls of his tourism agency

loans.name: Net

texts.en:
Net is 22 years old, a single and from the Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. Currently, she is studying as the accounting major in her third year at a university in the province. Net is also working as a teacher since 2014, earning approximately $3.66 per day.

This is her second loan cycle with Kiva. Due to the fact that she lacks the finances to pay her tuition fees for the third year, therefore she would like a loan. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to cover her university fee and earn a bachelor’s degree. For her future goals, she wants to fine another better job with a reasonable salary, so she will be able to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees for her third year studies in Accountancy

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, su nieta y su sobrino, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 4 años la cual inicio con capital propio, desde esos años su trabajo le ha ayudado a salir adelante con su familia, ella quiere aumentar mas la mercaderia para tener surtido su negocio por esa razon esta solicitando un credito para la compra de más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dora, age 46, lives in her own house with her husband, her granddaughter, and her nephew. She has had a small store located in her place of residence for four years that she started with her own capital, and in those years, her work has helped her and her family to move forward.

She wants to increase her merchandise more, in order to have her business stocked. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snacks, sweet bread, etc. Thus, she will be able to have a better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snacks, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is a carpenter and he works with his father. The workshop is the property of his father but Juan wants to be more involved with the business, so he needs a loan to buy carpentry machinery and wood.

Juan is single, so he doesn't have children but he helps his parents. He is living at his parent's house

loans.use: to buy carpentry machinery and wood

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is known in Puntod, Lopez Jaena for her delicious "pan bisaya" (native way of cooking bread). This has been her major source of income for more than 30 years. She is 53 years old and a widow. She is also a member of Paglaum MPC, which provides her the needed capital for her business expansion. She has recently asked for a loan to purchase bags of flour, margarine, sugar, baking powder, and other ingredients. She hopes that she can maintain her good membership and continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, margarine, sugar, baking powder and other ingredients.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 57 years old and married with eight children.

Alma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Alma has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Alma aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Guerlande

texts.fr: Guerlande a 38 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a deux enfants à sa charge.  Elle tient une petite boutique chez elle. Elle y vend des produits alimentaires, cosmétiques et boissons gazeuses. Elle souhaiterait apporter un changement dans l’activité et dans sa vie financière. Avec le crédit, elle va acheter des sacs de riz et des sucreries.
texts.en: Guerlande is 38 years old. She lives in an "open union" and has two children. She runs a small store out of her own house. Here, she sells food products, cosmetics and carbonated drinks. She would like to bring about a change in her business and her financial situation. With this loan, she will purchase bags of rice and candy.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and candy.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 46 year old woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mary has a food vending business in the Philippines. Mary requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as bananas, oil, sugar, vinegar, etc..

Mary has been in this business for one year. In the future, Mary would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as bananas, oil, sugar, vinegar, etc.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 35 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Rhodora works very hard to provide for them.

Rhodora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Rhodora has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Rhodora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Suchean

texts.en:
Suchean is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 26 years old. She lives in a wooden pile house with her husband and her 2 young children. Her family owns 3 hectares of rice fields, 8 pigs and a half hectare cassava field.

In 2005 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.Suchean makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her family expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for her field, food for the pig and to develop her business.

Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 60 years old, married with ten children.

Rosa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosa requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Rosa has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Rena

texts.fr: Rena est revendeuse de chaussures et de vêtements usagés. Elle a 32 ans, célibataire et mère de deux enfants. Grace aux revenus gagnés de son activité, elle contribue aux dépenses de la famille. Mais elle aimerait avoir plus de revenus. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Rena earns a living through selling second-hand shoes and clothing. She is a 32-year-old single mother to two children. Thanks to the income generated from her activity, she is able to contribute to her family's expenses. But she would still like to have a larger income. She is requesting this loan in order to increase her stock.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Qorichaska Del Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORICHASKA DEL CUSCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yaneth Eliana ella es soltera y tiene 72 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labial y perfumes.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de bazar, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de internet.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “QORICHASKA DEL CUSCO" communal bank which is located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

Yaneth Eliana is one of the members. She is 72 years old and single, and has two children. She is in the business of beauty products sales, she sells lipsticks, creams and perfumes. She is an enterprising, persevering woman who wants to get ahead through this business. She is requesting this loan to buy creams, lipsticks and perfumes.

The members who have their photo attached to the group photo had their picture taken after the meeting.They had permission due to their work commitments. 

The other members of this group have various businesses: bazaar sales, clothing sales, a grocery store and an internet business. 

Yaneth Eliana is grateful to all who form part of her dream through this loan, and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy creams, lipsticks and perfumes.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ruth is 38 years old now.

Ruth has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. Ruth requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items for her business such as hair color, etc..

Ruth has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Ruth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items for her business such as hair color, etc.

loans.name: La Victoire Group

texts.fr: Masika est commerçante, conseillère du groupe de crédits «La Victoire», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 58 ans, mère de 6 enfants qui n'étudient plus. Elle est propriétaire d’une buvette à son domicile dans une avenue mouvementée de la ville depuis 15 ans. Elle commença son activité avec de fonds reçu de son mari, lors de son vivant. Elle va acheter 10 caisses de boissons Primus et 10 caisses de sucrées. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Masika is a shopkeeper, a counselor for the "La Victoire" (The Victory) credit group, and a client of IMF Hekima. She is 58 years old, a widow, and has six children who are no longer in school. She has run a refreshment bar out of her home for 15 years, and is located on a busy street in town. She began her business with funds from her husband when he was still alive. She will buy 10 cases of Primus beverages and 10 cases of sweets. She would like to increase her capital and feed her children. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for supporting unbankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 10 cases of Primus beverages and 10 cases of sweets.

loans.name: Corsamie

texts.en:
Corsamie is 45 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Corsamie works very hard to provide for them.

Corsamie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, eggs, personal care products, and other groceries.

Corsamie has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Corsamie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, eggs, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia, 40 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  For the past 10 years, Amalia has operated a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets, bamboo sticks and other supplies to use in her business. In the future, Amalia would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, bamboo sticks and other supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Marie Josiane

texts.fr: Josianne, 30 ans, est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle vend des produits divers (articles menagers, produits cosmétiques, etc.) depuis déjà 4 ans. Dans le but d’assurer la croissance de son activité, elle est à la recherche de financement pour augmenter son stock. Elle espère avoir suffisamment de marchandises pour répondre aux demandes de ses clients.
texts.en: 30-year-old Josianne is a married mother to four children. She has been selling various items (household products, cosmetics, etc...) for the past four years. In order to ensure the growth of her business, she is looking for financing in order to increase her stock of wares. She hopes to have enough merchandise to respond to her customers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase saucepans and cooking pots.

loans.name: Marie Linda

texts.fr: Marie Linda, âgée de 40 ans, est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Ils sont tous scolarisés. Depuis plus de 4 ans, elle a ouvert une boutique de produits alimentaires tout près de chez elle. Elle a beaucoup de clients. Marie Linda désire agrandir davantage son commerce et s’offrir de meilleures conditions de vie. Sachant que son stock est insuffisant pour répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle, elle a demandé un microcrédit pour pouvoir augmenter ses marchandises.
texts.en:
