40-year-old Marie Linda is a married mother to three children. All of them are currently attending school. For over four years, she has been running a store which sells food products close to her home. She has many customers.

Marie Linda wants to further grow her business and give herself a better quality of life. Knowing that her stock isn't enough to meet her customers' demands, she is requesting a micro-loan in order to expand her merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase carbonated drinks for her store.

loans.name: Lismène

texts.fr: Lismène est propriétaire d’une boutique de produits cosmétiques et produits alimentaires. Agée de 34 ans, elle n’a pas encore d’enfant. Elle vit avec son compagnon dans la ville de Croix-des-Bouquets. Elle demande un microcrédit pour acheter un stock de lotion de beauté et de savon de toilette.
texts.en: Lismène owns her own store which sells cosmetics and food products. She is 34 years old and has yet to have children. She lives with her partner in Croix-des-Bouquets. She is requesting this micro-loan in order to purchase beauty lotion and soap.

loans.use: to purchase beauty lotion and soap.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma operates a motor transport business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

For her to continue her business, Alma availed a loan to pay for spare motorcycle parts and repairs. She dreams of owning additional motor units and hopes to be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for spare motorcycle parts and repairs.

loans.name: Babuya Group

texts.fr: Mutoo est commerçante, membre du groupe solidaire «Babuya», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un agent de l’Etat, âgée de 43 ans, mère de six enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des matériaux de construction dans un marché de l’entrée de la ville depuis 4 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 200 planches madriers. Elle commença son business  avec le capital reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, construire en dur, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mutoo is a businesswoman and member of the "Babuya" Group, a client of the field partner Hekima. She is married to a state official and is 43 years old. She has six children, all of whom are in school.

For the past four years, she has been selling construction materials in a market at the entrance to the town. She will be purchasing a supply of 200 plank boards. She started her business with funds received from her husband.

She would like to increase her credit, to build a permanent home, and feed and school her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support it provides entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of 200 plank boards.

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra is a 35-year-old married woman living with three children and her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She does hand embroidery work at home and financially supports her family. Her husband’s income is very poor so Sidra decided to start embroidery work at home. She learned this art in her childhood and has now adopted it for her occupation. Sidra enabled her independence and ability to earn a sufficient income.

Sidra has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase stocks of threads, silk, fancy sequins, and pearls of various colors. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family. Sidra is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stocks of threads, silk, fancy sequins and pearls of various colors for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Marie Lourdes

texts.fr: Marie Lourdes, 49 ans, vit en union libre. Elle a assure les études de ses 3 enfants grâce aux revenus de son petit commerce de linges usagés. Souhaitant améliorer son activité et pour en tirer plus de revenus, elle sollicite un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: 49-year-old Marie Lourdes lives in an "open union". She has been able to send her three children to school thanks to the income earned from her second-hard clothing business. In the hopes of improving her business in order to make a larger income, she is requesting a micro-loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formó en la ciudad de Luque, son 18 mujeres que se unieron para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través del trabajo unido de todas. Quieren poder capacitarse y otras quieren emprender una nueva labor.
Una de las integrantes que se destaca por ser una mujer muy sacrificada y trabajadora es la Sra. Sonia, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas variadas. Ella comenta que todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano en la mañana para poder preparar las comidas que vende, y gracias a que son muy ricas sus comidas ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos variados para hacer comidas, como ser: verduras, carne, condimentos, panificados, hortalizas y otros, para poder seguir con sus ventas de comidas, luchando por mejorar cada día.
texts.en: This group was established in the city of Luque and comprises 18 women who teamed up to improve their living conditions through working together. Some wish to improve themselves, whilst others want to start a new occupation. One of the members who stands out because of her self sacrifice and hard work is Sonia, who makes a living by selling a variety of foods. She remarks that she gets up very early in the morning every day to prepare the food that she sells. Her food is very tasty and as a result she has many customers. She is asking for this loan so that she can invest in a variety of ingredients to prepare food, such as greens, meat, seasonings, baked goods, vegetables and so forth. This allows her to continue selling her food, struggling to improve every day.

loans.use: to buy a variety of ingredients to prepare food, such as: greens, meat, seasonings, baked goods, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
La señora Petronila, es de la ciudad de Santaní, está casada, vive en casa propia, su marido se dedica a la agricultura, la señora es dueña de una despensa bien surtida y de esa forma ambos se ayudan para mantener el hogar.
Es un persona muy trabajadora, responsable y muy honesta, ella empezó a trabajar como vendedora ambulante, su sueño de siempre era de tener una despensa y ventas de bebidas en general, ahora ya cuenta su propia despensa bien surtida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser lácteos, panificados, verduras, frutas y otros, y así seguir con sus ventas, mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Petronila is from the city of Santani, is married, and lives in her own home. Her husband works in agriculture. She is the owner of a small grocery store which is well-stocked with assorted products. Through their jobs, they both help to support the household.

She is a very hardworking, responsible and very honest person. She started working as a street vendor. Her dream has always been to have a small grocery store and to sell drinks. Now, she has her own small grocery store which is well-stocked with assorted products.

She is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of products for her small grocery store, including dairy products, baked goods, vegetables and fruits and in doing so, continue with her sales and improving her business.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store including dairy products, baked goods, vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Komeza I Group

texts.fr:
Pamphile  fait partie du groupe  Komeza I et  habite à Muramvya. Il a 65 ans et est marié à Pauline, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 20 à 25 ans, dont  1 étudie.
Il a sous sa charge sa petite fille. 

Il fait le commerce de bananes, de pilons, et de mortiers  depuis  20 ans. 

Il est à son quatorzième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de banane et beaucoup d’arbres pour fabriquer des  mortiers et de pilons  à  vendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une  vache, une chèvre pour l'élevage et d'une  moto d pour son déplacement.
texts.en:
Pamphile is a member of the Komeza I group and lives in Muramvya. He is 65 years old and married to Pauline, a farmer. Together they have four children aged between 20 and 25, of whom one is studying. He is also responsible for his grand-daughter. He has been selling bananas and mortars and pestles for 20 years.

Pamphile is on his fourteenth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan he has requested, he will grow his working capital and buy a large quantity of bananas and lots of trees to make mortars and pestles out of so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy a cow and a goat to raise and a motorcycle to bring him where he needs to go.

loans.use: to grow his working capital and buy a big quantity of bananas and lots of trees to make mortars and pestles to sell so as to earn more.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a 38-year-old Ugandan woman. She is married with four children and lives in Kagadi, Uganda.

Harriet is a teacher by profession where she earns a salary from the local government. She also does alcohol brewing as a side source of income. These activities have given her the courage to continue serving the community based on her returns.

Harriet hopes to finish up her house but she is challenged by low and delayed salary payments. Harriet describes herself as a hardworking lady and requests a loan to buy bricks and iron sheets to complete her house.

loans.use: to buy bricks and iron sheets to complete her house.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a married businesswoman. She is requesting a loan of $600.00 to improve her business.

Veronica has a very high interest in doing business. She has been involved in business activities since 2013 with her own working capital of $100.00, and she makes the best of it. She is earning good money but she still wants to improve the management of her business. Therefore, she requested a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional items to keep in her store including salts, detergents, sugar, candles, cooking oils, noodles, cigarettes, aqua, candies, soft drinks and hard drinks, and other things to sell.

Veronica is happy with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy additional goods.

loans.use: to buy salts, detergents, sugar, candles, cooking oils, noodles, cigarettes, aqua, candies, soft drinks and hard drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Don Manuel vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica a la venta de panes de manera ambulante por los mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa tiene mas de 5 años de dedicarse a esa actividad y empezo por la falta de empleo con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de los panes como: mortadelas, mayonesa, panes, carnes, lechuga, etc. todo por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Don Manuel lives in his own home with his wife and daughter. He sells sandwiches for a living as a street vendor in the markets that are near his home.

He has more than 5 years in this activity and began because of a lack of employment. With his profits, he is able to handle some of his household expenses. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of raw materials to make sandwiches, such as bologna, mayonnaise, breads, meats, lettuce, etc. He will purchase everything in wholesale in order to continue his work with good profits.

loans.use: to purchase bologna, mayonnaise, breads, meats, lettuce, etc. All wholesale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia signed her membership with PMPC and borrowed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (convenience store) business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time borrower like her.

Lydia has been able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of her good fortune. She recently borrowed a loan to restock her store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil and soy sauce. In the future, Lydia hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en: Roberta is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. Roberta recently borrowed a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. In addition to her project of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale, Roberta hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman living with her husband and three children. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year, Mwanakombo has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of high transportation costs. Additionally, Mwanakombo operates a coconut selling business that earns her another source of income.

With the 20,000 KES loan, Mwanakombo wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 45-year-old vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work and her client demand is strong.

However, business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Robina ’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household.

Robina is the mother of six children. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet continually increasing demands. She hopes to gain more profits and fulfill her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet the continually increasing demand.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan engages in fishing. He catches and sells fresh fish to the locals in his hometown. He is a 45-year-old married man with two dependents (ages 18 and 14 years old). He has been engaged in fishing for more than 15 years. He needs capital to support his livelihood.

Allan is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets. These will help improve his catches and augment his income. With these, he could provide healthy meals and continue to support the needs of his family.

In the future, Allan dreams of expanding his business to make it productive and profitable. He also hopes to continue financing the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is a 54-year-old widow. She has had a beauty parlor business for many years, offering her customers many services such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Zahida has become very famous in her street for providing the best services. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, Zahida is interested in buying more varieties of cosmetic products for the parlor.  She has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers to gain profits to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers to gain profits to build her own house.

loans.name: Marianita Sofia

texts.es:
Marianita es una señora de 38 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en el recinto Libertad del Toachi, un sector turístico y productivo perteneciente a la provincia de Santo Domingo.  
Marianita y su esposo son personas muy trabajadoras, ella trabaja en un pequeño comedor de la zona donde es ayudante de cocina y su esposo trabaja en una empresa como operador, ambos han podido salir adelante con sus pequeños, con su esfuerzo diario han podido brindarles  un hogar propio y darles la educación para que ellos se superen.
Marianita y su esposo siempre han querido emprender en algo propio, como la zona es muy productiva, turística y comercial han visto la necesidad de ponerse un criadero de pollos, es por ello que desde hace meses atrás han venido ahorrando y adecuando un espacio para los animales, con este crédito Marianita podrá comprar los pollitos, el balanceado y las vitaminas para comenzar con su negocio propio; está muy feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que dan de emprender su negocio, agradece a Kiva y a la institución por permitir que los sueños se hagan realidad.
texts.en:
Marianita is 38 years old. She lives with her husband and their four children in the town of Libertad del Toachi, a tourist and productive sector that belongs to the province of Santo Domingo.

Marianita and her husband are very hardworking people. She works in a small cafeteria in the zone, where she is a kitchen helper, and her husband works as an operator in a company. Together they have been able to provide for their little ones, and through their daily efforts, they have been able to give them a home of their own, and an education so that they may succeed.

Marianita and her husband have wanted to start something of their own, and they have seen the need for setting up a chicken farm, as the zone is very productive, appealing to tourists, and commercial. This is why for several months, they have been saving and setting up a space for the animals, and with this loan, Marianita will be able to purchase the chicks, the feed, and the vitamins in order to get started with their own business.

She is very grateful for the opportunity that Kiva is giving her to start her own business. She thanks Kiva and the institution for making it possible for her dreams to become reality.

loans.use: to start her chicken raising business, and to purchase feed.

loans.name: Zeveria

texts.en:
Zeveria is married and has three children. For the past three years, she has operated a retail business selling tomatoes and cereals. Her business is located in an area with potential.

Zeveria describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes and cereals. This is Zeveria's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank; her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes and cereals.

loans.name: Derlis

texts.es:
Derlis es de la ciudad de Santaní, es dueño de un lugar de venta de celulares y accesorios para los mismos, también vende saldos y activaciones de líneas, es una persona muy trabajadora y conocida en su barrio.
Tiene una buena clientela que siempre va a su negocio, es muy trabajador y comenta que su meta es poder seguir con su emprendimiento para poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar celulares para la venta, y también para la compra de saldo electrónico para la venta. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar.
texts.en:
Derlis is from the city of Santaní, He is the owner of a business selling cell phones and accessories for them. He also sells electronic credits and phone activation. He is a very hard-working person, well-known in his neighborhood.

He has a good clientele who regularly go to his business. He works hard and comments that his goal is to continue with his entrepreneurship in order to continue to help his family.

He is requesting this loan to buy cellphones to sell and also buy electronic credit to sell. He is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving to improve.

loans.use: to buy cellphones and electronic credit for sale.

loans.name: Olandina

texts.en:
Olandina is a businesswoman who lives in Atsabe. She sells clothing from her shop in the market. Olandina is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more clothes such as trousers, shorts, short-sleeved shirts, long-sleeved shirts, children's clothes and other clothes to sell.

Olandina started her business in 2006 with working capital of $700. She is earning a good income every day because she sells in the center of the market so many people are interested in her clothes. Olandina is very happy to do her business and hopes to get good management for her business with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts, short-sleeved shirts, long-sleeved shirts, children's clothes and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa, 52 years old, is married and has three children. She sells clothes, blankets and other ready-to-wear items for income.  Teresa is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more clothes and blankets to resell for profit. She hopes to keep increasing her sales to earn extra income for the family’s emergency reserves.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and blankets to sell

loans.name: Praveen

texts.en:
Praveen is a 36-year-old married woman living with her three children and her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a small crockery shop where he sells glasses, plates, spoons, cauldrons, etc.

Praveen's husband is the family's only source of income; he has to afford the costs of utility bills, his elderly parents' medical expenses and household expenses. He sold his present stock and does not have cash in hand to buy new stock for his shop. Therefore, Praveen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can increase his inventory and earnings. Praveen is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new stock of glasses, plates, spoons and cauldrons for her husband's crockery store.

loans.name: Mariely

texts.es: Mariely es una microempresaria habitante de Cartagena de Indias un municipio del departamento de Bolívar y en su comunidad identificó falencias de diferentes servicios y decidió crear su propio negocio con la finalidad de generar sus ingresos y promover un motor de desarrollo y una mejor calidad de vida entre los integrantes de la comunidad. Ella adecuó un espacio de su vivienda para instalar un café internet, en donde ofrece servicio de navegación por internet, fotocopias, impresiones, transcripciones entre otros, así mismo inició un alquiler de lavadoras con dos máquinas de lavado, pero su éxito fue tan contundente que tuvo que ampliar el número de electrodomésticos a ocho; no obstante entre su misma clientela oferta mercancías varias.  Hoy en día los residentes del sector gozan de servicios ofimáticos que les aportan en sus labores académicas, búsqueda de empleo, esparcimiento y demás, así como las amas de casa que no poseen en sus viviendas lavadoras realizar esta labor con menos esfuerzo y les ofrece facilidad de pago en sus compras de mercancías varias.  Mariely está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar tres lavadoras, realizar mantenimiento a dos computadores e invertir en mercancías, con este capital pretende abastecer la demanda del sector y ofrecer un mejor servicio.  Su meta a futuro es ampliar su capacidad de servicios y ampliar el local.
texts.en:
Mariely is a micro-entrepreneur from Cartagena de Indias, a municipality of the department of Bolivar. She found a lack of different services in her community and decided to create her own business with the goal of earning an income and promoting a catalyst for development and a better quality of life for the members of her community.

She adapted a space in her home to install an internet cafe where she offers services including browsing the Internet, photocopies, printing, and transcriptions. In the same way, she started a washing machine rental with two washing machines. But, her success was so overwhelming that she had to increase the number of appliances to eight. She also offers a variety of goods to her clientele.

Presently, the residents of her neighborhood enjoy the use of office equipment which helps them with their school work, in their job searches, for recreational purposes and more. In the same way, the housewives who do not have washing machines in their homes can do this chore more easily. She also offers payment in installments for purchases of varied goods.

Mariely is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase three washing machines, perform maintenance on two computers, and to invest in merchandise. With this capital she intends to provide for the demand in her neighborhood and offer better services. Her goal for the future is to increase her service capability and enlarge her workspace.

loans.use: to buy three washing machines, perform maintenance on two computers, and invest in merchandise.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob built his house a long time ago, and now it is destroyed. He has plans to repair his house, but he does not have enough money to buy materials. He is requesting a loan to buy stone, sand, iron, cement, wood, zinc, nails and other materials to use for his house repair. He will use the loan of 600 USD from Tuba Rai Metin, along with his own money, to purchase the materials. He hopes with this loan he can repair his house in a short time.

loans.use: to buy stone, sand, iron, cement, wood, zinc, nails and other materials to repair his house.

loans.name: Gabriela Milena

texts.es:
La señora Gabriela es una mujer emprendedora de 19 años vive en unión libre su esposo trabaja en construcción tienen un hijo de 5 meses, vienen de familias de bajos recursos económicos pero tratan de salir adelante por tener un futuro mejor.

La señora Gabriela desea emprender en el negocio de venta de ropa en varios sectores del Cantón, aledaños y también en instituciones cuenta con el apoyo de su suegra quien le está ayudando con la capacitación y sabe en donde se compra la ropa más económica, Gabriela está lista para iniciar en el negocio al mismo le dedicará un promedio de 6 horas diarias.  

Doña Gabriela agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la ayuda que brindan a personas como ella que solo buscan salir adelante.
texts.en:
Gabriela is an entrepreneurial woman. She is 19 years old and is in a common-law marriage. Her husband works in construction and they have a 5-month-old son. They come from low-income families but try to get ahead to have a better future.

Gabriela wishes to start her own business selling clothing in various sectors of the district, in adjacent areas, and also in establishments. She has the support of her mother-in-law who is helping her with training and who knows where to buy clothing at the most economical price. Gabriela is ready to begin her business to which she will dedicate on average six hours per day.

Gabriela gives thanks to Kiva for the support and help they provide to people like her who are just looking to get ahead.

loans.use: to start her business selling clothing and get ahead with her partner and child.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married and has four children whose ages range from 9 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. For the past six years, Joyce has operated a retail business selling maize, beans, cow peas and other cereals. Her business is located in an area with many customers; her primary customers are locals.

Joyce describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of beans, maize, cow peas and other cereals. Her business goal is to have a very big cereals store within 5 years. Joyce hopes that, in the future, she will educate her children to university level. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and save the rest to invest in dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beans, maize, cow peas and other cereals

loans.name: Tuvshinbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Tuvshinbayar, 26 years old, lives with his mother and two siblings in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his mother mainly run the grocery store and his siblings regularly help while studying at university. Using his previous loan, he has stocked lots of foodstuffs for his grocery store.

Now he is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD to buy spare parts in order to repair his automobile, which is used for a taxi service. Since last year as a means of extra income, he has been rendering taxi services to local people. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who is carrying his family on his shoulders.

loans.use: to repair his automobile.

loans.name: Jose Mario

texts.es: Don Jose de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hija, el se dedica a la venta de agua de coco y al servicio de transporte en su pick up desde hace 10 años con lo que obtiene de ganancias de su trabajo es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas cocos por mayor y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Jose is 51 years old and lives in his own home with his life companion and daughter. He has worked selling coconut water and in the transportation business with his pick-up for 10 years now. With what he earns from work, he manages to satisfy some of the household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy more coconuts wholesale and with that improve his economic income.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts wholesale.

loans.name: Llapanchis Tticarisunchis Group

texts.es:
El grupo pertenece al banco comunal “LLapanchis TTicarisunchis” en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco.
La socia Betty tiene 34 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de desayunos como pan con leche,quinua con manzana entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia agradece la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, azúcar entre otros.
Los socios  que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron  permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
This group is part of the Llapanchis Tticarisunchis communal bank in the Cusco province, department of Cusco. 

Betty, 34, has a partner and a child. In addition to her daily activities, she has a business selling breakfast foods  such as pan con leche [bread pudding], quinoa with apples, and more. She's been doing this work for a long time and it is going well thanks to the daily efforts she puts into the business. Betty provides for her family through this work.

She is applying for this loan to buy milk and sugar, among other staples. She is grateful for this opportunity and committed to making her payments on time.

The members who have their photo attached to the group photo asked permission to be late for the meeting due to work commitments.

loans.use: to buy milk and sugar, among other staples.

loans.name: Fozia's Group

texts.en:
The woman in the photo with raised hand is Fozia, 41 years old, and living in the populated area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been running a general store for several years but it is not working very well due to a shortage of inventory. His shop is situated in a populated area where it can offer miscellaneous general store items to many available customers. Fozia's son wants to stock all inventories; however, due to lack of available funds, he is unable to buy most demanded inventories such as flour, pulses, detergents, rice and cooking oil.

Fozia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her son would be able to buy inventories such as flour, pulses, detergents, rice, cooking oil, etc. In this way, he will be successful in selling more products and can grow his income as well.

Fozia is very glad after receiving this loan and hopeful that her son will be successful in fulfilling each request from his customers and avoid disappointment. She is very thankful to the Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory of items such as flour, pulses, detergents, rice and cooking oil for her son's general store.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas is married and lives in Atsabe. She is an entrepreneur who runs a business selling pigs and goats. Her husband is very supportive of her business selling animals.

Domingas started to sell animals in 2014, with own working capital of $1,000. She is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her capital to buy more pigs and goats, She was very happy with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin because she could use it to improve her management.

loans.use: to buy pigs and goats.

loans.name: Rosal

texts.en:
Rosal is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 37 years old and has three children who are in school. She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Rosal has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts, and other materials needed in her business. She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rosal would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is married and has no children. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over two years, Monica has operated an open air business selling food from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

Monica wants to use this KES 50,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en: Haleema is married and has six children; one of her sons is shown in the photo. Haleema's husband has been running a business selling fruit for many years. He manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support his family. To improve her husband's business, Haleema has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR  to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas to meet market demands consistently to ultimately enable her family to cover their utility bills.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas to meet market demands consistently to ultimately enable her family to cover their utility bills.

loans.name: Felipa De Jesus

texts.es: Felipa de 64 años de edad se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace 5 años con lo que ha logrado salir adelante junto a su esposo que habitan en casa propia. Ella anteriormente obtuvo un crédito el cual invirtió en poner las puertas y encementar el piso de la vivienda y desea continuar mejorándola, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lamina, polín C y la mano de obra para hacer el cambio de techo y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Con el crédito anterior Felipa compro las puertas de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Felipa is 64 years old and has worked selling pupusas for 5 years. She has managed to get ahead, together with her husband. They live together in their own home.

She previously got a loan, which she invested in installing doors on the house and putting in cement floors. She hopes to continue fixing it up, so she is requesting a new loan through FUSAI to invest in: corrugated sheet metal, C-purlins and the labor to replace the roof and improve her quality of life. With the previous loan, Felipa bought the doors on her home.

loans.use: to invest in: corrugated sheet metal, C-purlins and labor to replace her roof and improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Oyunchimeg, 53 years old, lives with her husband, daughter and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a barbershop for 23 years. Her husband repairs damaged automobiles for a living. Their children go to universities. They live in a Mongolian traditional ger, felt dwelling. She is again requesting a loan of 1000 USD to pay tuition fees for her daughter. Her daughter is a third year student in agriculture at university.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Jeanlie

texts.en:
Jeanlie is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jeanlie is 22 years old now.

Jeanlie has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business.

Jeanlie has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Jeanlie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed woman and has been blessed with seven children, one of whom attends school. Together with her children, she lives at a rental house that has electricity, but no piped water.

Fatuma has operated a fish selling business for over 20 years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability, leading to losses.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Renita

texts.en:
Renita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Renita is 43 years old and one of her children is in school.

Renita has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business.

Renita has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Renita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Ma. Magdalena

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalena is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Magdalena is 52 years old and one of her children is in school.

Ma. Magdalena has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more varieties of fish to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Ma. Magdalena would like to save enough to provide a secure for her family.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of fish to sell.

loans.name: Alba Noemi

texts.es: Alba de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus hijas de 17 y 7 años de edad. Alba tiene muchos deseos de superación y es muy trabajadora por lo que tiene a la venta fruta fresca y productos de belleza y es con lo que mantiene la economía de su hogar. Anteriormente Alba obtuvo un crédito el cual utilizó para construir un sanitario de fosa séptica y afinar las paredes de un cuarto y ella desea seguir mejorando su vivienda y en esta ocasión solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: alambre eléctrico, toma corriente, caja térmica y mano de obra para la instalación de energía eléctrica, ya que no cuenta con dicho servicio y de esta manera darle una mayor calidad de vida a su familia. Con el crédito anterior Alba construyo su servicio sanitario y el baño de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alba is 37 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and daughters, 17 and 7 years old. Alba has great hopes to better herself and is very hard-working. She sells fresh fruit and beauty products and with that she manages the household budget.

Alba previously got a loan which she used to build a bathroom with septic tank and finish the walls in one room. She hopes to continue improving her house. This time she is requesting a new loan through FUSAI to invest in: electrical wiring, outlets, breaker box and the labor to install electrical service, as she currently doesn't have electricity. That way, she can give her family a better quality of life. With the previous loan, Alba built the septic system and bathroom for her house.

loans.use: to invest in: electric wiring, outlets, fuse box and the labor to install electric service.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of four children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries items like, soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures.

Erlinda dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries items like, soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Samoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Samoeurn, 63, is married and has two dependent children. She lives in Kandal province where she, along with her husband, has been growing rice for 43 years. This farming business earns her about USD 12 per day and saves approximately about USD 6 each day, after deducting daily expenses.

Limited rainfall, which causes her crop to grow unhealthily and return low outputs, is the main challenge to the rice farming business. Samoeurn has been with VisionFund for a loan cycle already and the past loan has enabled her to better support her family and to buy a water filter. As the leader of a group comprised of two members, she will use her loan to buy a motorcycle to commute from home to work. She hopes that this purchase will enable her to save much time and reduce the cost of commuting. She wants to get high yields from her rice farming.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to commute from home to work.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 49 year old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband has been running a crockery shop for past 20 years. Her husband is the only one responsible to fulfill the financial needs of his entire family and to manage the household.

Shaheen's husband wants to purchase a different type of crockery (e.g jugs, glasses, dinner sets and etc.) to fulfill the demands of his customers, but due to financial constraints her husband is not in the position to buy this merchandises for reselling purposes. To fulfill his business needs, Shaheen has applied for Kiva Loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these things to fulfill his business needs. This will also be helpful for him to increase his daily sales and to earn more profitable income to manage the business and family's needs.

Shaheen is very happy and thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his crockery business.

loans.name: Xiomara Abigail

texts.es: Xiomara de 41 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora y con deseos de superación por tal motivo ella desde hace 14 años decidio poner su negocio de venta de platos tipicos y venta de productos por catálogo y es con ello que ha podido sacar adelante a su familia comprendida por su esposo y su hijo de 14 años de edad. Xiomara desea mejorar su negocio por lo que solicita un credito a FUSAI para invertir en: reparación de puertas de su chalet y para la compra de sillas y mesas y asi ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 41 years old.  She is an entrepreneurial woman who wishes to succeed.  With that motive, 14 years ago she decided to start a business selling typical dishes and selling products through catalog.  It is with that that she has been able to get ahead with her family comprised of her husband and her son who is 14 years old.

Xiomara wants to improve her business.  That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in repairing the doors of her chalet, and to buy chairs and tables and thus offer a better service to her customers.

loans.use: To invest in repairing the doors of her chalet ,and to buy chairs and tables and thus offer a better service to her customers.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
La Sra. Elvira tiene 68 años, está acompañada con el Sr. Ramón, con quien formo una familia y tiene hijos, todos ya mayores, que con mucho esfuerzo ha criado y sacado adelante.
Doña Elvira se dedica al comercio, tiene un puesto de ventas de mercerías ubicado en un lugar estratégico ya hace como 15 años, manteniendo una clientela formada de varios años.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtirlo con productos variados para poder surtir su mercería con productos como calzados, prendas, artículos de bazar y otros.
texts.en:
Elvira is 68 years old and shares her life with Ramón, with whom she formed a family and has children, all of whom are now of age. She worked hard to raise and support her children.

Elvira works in commerce and has a market stall where she sells sewing items. She has had this stall for about 15 years and it is located in a strategic place. She maintains the clientele that she has formed over the years.

She is asking for this loan in order to stock her stall with various products such as shoes, garments, and household items, among others.

loans.use: to buy various products such as shoes, garments, and household items.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACION COMUNAL CORAZON DE JESUS ESTA CONFORMADA POR NUEVE INTEGRANTES, MADRES SOLTERAS ORIGINARIAS DEL SAUCE LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGION, SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORAS, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL. TODOS TIENE DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONOMICAS A LA CUAL SE DEDICA CON MUCHA PERSEVERANCIA, ENTUCIASMO, DEDICACION, PORA HACER CRECER SUS NEGOCIO, YA QUE ES LA FUENTES DE INGRESOS PARA LA SUBSISTENCIA DE SUS HIJOS. EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN PARA SEGUIR ADELANTE Y CUMPLIR METAS Y OBJETIVOS COMO FORMARA A SUS HIJOS EN PROFESIONALES, MEJORAR SUS VIVIENDAS, HACER CRECER SUS NEGOCIO ETC.
GRACIAS A LAS GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL LA CORDINADORA ES LIDUVINA Y TIENE PORA ACTIVIDAD ECONOMIA LA ELABORACION Y VENTA DE TORTILLAS, EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION, LA RUTINA DE TRABAJO DE ESTA MUJER ES DE UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIA DESDE LA PREPARACION DE LA MASA HASTA LA VENTA DE LAS TORTILLAS, EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA COMO : MAIZ, LEÑA, CAL, GAS, BOLSAS PLASTICAS, COMALES, DELANTALES ETC.
texts.en:
The communal bank Corazón de Jesus is made up of nine members who are single mothers. They are native to El Sauce, which is located in the northern zone of the region. They are known to be hard workers and responsible, with desire for self-improvement.

They have different economic activities that they carry out with perseverance, enthusiasm, and dedication to grow their businesses. This is their source of income to provide for their children. They strive to get ahead and achieve goals and objectives such as providing education for their children to become professionals, improving their homes, and expanding their businesses.

Thanks to her desire to improve herself, the coordinator is Liduvina. Her business is the production and sale of tortillas from her home. Her work routine takes about twelve hours a day from the mixing of the dough to the selling of the product.

With this loan, Liduvina will invest in work capital and stock basic supplies such as corn, firewood, lime, gas, plastic bags, grifddles, aprons, and more.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make tortillas, such as corn, firewood, lime, gas, plastic bags and more.

loans.name: Jimmy Haroldo

texts.es: Jimmy de 34 años de edad vive con su abuela de 82 años de edad él es la única ayuda que ella tiene él es un hombre muy trabajador y honrado. Él es empleado de un restaurante que está ubicado en la playa. El está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en la compra de ventanas, cemento, arena etc. Para reparar las ventanas de su casa y encementar el patio ya que este se hace grandes charcos  de lodo cuando llueve y teme que su abuela sufra algún accidente, espera una respuesta favorable a su crédito y comenzar con la mejora en su casa de inmediato.
texts.en:
Jimmy is 34 years old and lives with his 82-year-old grandmother. He is the only help she has. He is a very hardworking and honest man and is employed at a restaurant that is located on the beach.

He is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in the purchase of windows, cement, sand, etc. to repair the windows of his house and pour a cement patio because it gets big puddles of mud when it rains and he is afraid his grandmother might have an accident.

He hopes to get a favorable response to his loan request and can begin the improvements on the house immediately.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of windows, cement, sand, etc. for his house.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa, a 68-year-old married mother of five, works very hard to provide for her family. For five years she has operated a general store in the Philippines that sells a variety of items.

Rosa has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell including bread, junk foods, beverages, canned goods, home care products, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as bread,  junk foods, beverages, canned goods, home care products, etc.

loans.name: Clara Eliza

texts.es:
La señora Clara siempre ha querido salir adelante y tener su propio negocio, en la actualidad tiene un local de lavado y secado de ropa aprendió de este negocio por iniciativa propia, ella trabaja un promedio de 8 horas diarias ya que tiene gran demanda de clientes que la buscan por su amabilidad y cumplimiento en las entregas.
En este negocio no hay muchas actividades difíciles pero tiene el apoyo de todos sus hijos y su esposo, su más grande sueño es tener un local más grande para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, este préstamo ayudara a la Sra. Clara a mejorar sus ingresos económicos y ampliar su negocio ya que el mismo se invertirá en comprar una máquina adicional de lavado, además la señora Clara agradece a Kiva por la oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Clara has always wanted to get ahead and have her own business. She currently has a laundry business washing and drying clothing. She learned about this business through her own initiative. She works an average of 8 hours a day because there is a big demand from clients who seek her out for her friendly service and timely delivery.

In this business, there are not many difficult activities, but she has the support of all her children and her husband. Her biggest dream is to have a larger establishment so she can satisfy the needs of her clients.

This loan will help Clara to improve her financial income and grow her business, as she will invest it in an additional washing machine. Clara thanks Kiva for the opportunity to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an additional washing machine, which will allow her to give better service to her customers.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.es: Hellen es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de joyería. Ella solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000), para la compra de mercadería que le permita ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes y de esta manera incrementar las ventas de su negocio.
texts.en: Hellen  is an entrepreneurial woman who works selling jewelry.  She seeks a loan of one million colones (₡ 1 000 000), to buy merchandise that will permit her to offer a greater variety of products to her customers, and thereby increase the sales of her business.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blankets, blouses, pants, socks, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in milk, flour, butter, eggs, etc., for making her products.

loans.name: Qori Ttica Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco  comunal QORI TTICA, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maranura, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Vicentina continua con su negocio de agricultura, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua dedicándose a l negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia continua criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de animales entre otros.
Los socios en general  agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Una de las socias al momento de tomar la foto se tapo ya que la socia es tímida pero se compromete a tomarse una mejor foto en el próximo desembolso.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the QORI TTICA communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Maranura, in the province of La Convención, in the department of Cusco.

The borrower Vicentina continues with her agriculture business. She is a responsible and diligent person. She continues raising small animals. She raises them in order to later sell them to customers who want them. This is how she moves her family forward.

She seeks a loan for the purchase of animals, among other things. The borrowers in general are grateful for the loan provided, and promise to comply with the scheduled payments. One of the borrowers, at the moment the photo was taken, covered her face because she is shy, but she promises to take a better photo at the next disbursement.

loans.use: to buy animals among other things.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Amina operates a grocery stall where she sells vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rods, hooks, and barbed wire to build a perimeter fence.

loans.name: Dorian Noel

texts.es:
DORIAN DE CUARENTA Y DOS AÑO DE EDAD, ORIGINARIO DE MANAGUA, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGION, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADOR, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, ES CASADO CON TRES HIJOS TODOS MENORES DE EDAD LOS CUALES ESTAN ESTUDIANDO EN PRIMARIA Y EN LA UNIVERSIDAD LAS EDADADES DE SUS HIJOS COMPRENDEN ENTRE LOS 7, 17, 18 AÑOS DE EDAD,  EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN PARA SACAR ADELANTE A SUS HIJOS.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE REPUESTOS DE VEHICULOS Y REPARACION, EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION, TIENE VEINTE Y SEIS AÑOS DE DESEMPEÑARSE EN DICHA ACTIVIDAD. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN LA CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGCOCION EL COMPRA DE REPUESTOS DE VEHICULOS PARA SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES, HACER CRECER EL NEGOCIO Y EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORER INGRESOS.DORIAN AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Dorian is 42 years old. He is a native of Managua a place that is in the north of the region. He is hard-working, responsible and has the desire to better himself. He is married with three children who are all minors and are studying in primary school and university. They are aged 7, 17 and 18 years old. He currently is striving to get his daughters ahead.

Thanks to his desire to progress he has a business selling vehicle parts and repairing vehicles. The business is located at his house. He has been engaged in this business for twenty six years.

The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock his business buying vehicle parts to satisfy his customers, make his business grow and in the short term he can make more income. Dorian is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide for people of low resources in poor countries like Nicaragua to have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy vehicle parts like tires, rims, lubricants, etc.

loans.name: Jovenes Ecologistas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JOVENES ECOLOGISTAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Celia ella es soltera y tiene 48 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como carne, verduras y pollo.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the Jóvenes Ecologistas communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Santa Ana, which is part of the province of La Convención, in the department of Cusco.

The borrower is Celia. She is 48 years old, and is single with 4 children. She works in her restaurant business. She prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners. She has several years in this business and does very well at it. Through her business she wants to get ahead. Her dream is to expand her restaurant business. She seeks a credit to buy products to cook, such as meat, vegetables and chicken.

The borrower whose photo is next to the group photo asked for permission to have his photo taken after the meeting, due to work obligations. The other borrowers work in a business selling animals, a business selling clothes, a grocery store business, and a business selling food. The borrower thanks those who take part in her dream through this means, and promises to comply with the scheduled payments.







La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: to buy products to cook such as meat, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 34-year-old woman who has one son and three daughters. All of her children are in school. Saima lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. For the past five years, her husband has been running his own business selling clothing. He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household finances. Saima’s husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk to resell but he does not have the financial means.

Saima is requesting a Kiva loan through the field partner BRAC Pakistan to assist her husband to purchase bulk clothing to resell. She will use her loan to help her husband increase the size of his business and earn a maximum profit. Saima is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase bulk clothing for her husband to sell

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi is a married woman who has two kids who attend school. For the past 10 years, she has operated a motorcycle spare parts business from her home. Mwanaharusi’s potential customers are motorcycle owners and her major business challenge is competition. She owns a house with electricity but no running water and her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. Mwanaharusi decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

Mwanaharusi is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase a stock of motorcycle parts to sell.

loans.use: to purchase spare motorcycle parts

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: Karla es una mujer emprendedora de 33 años de edad, soltera y madre de dos niños de once y seis años por quienes trabaja día a día para sacarlos adelante y darles un futuro mejor, desde hace cuatro años ella emprendió su negocio de venta de plantas ornamentales, tiene un vivero donde la mama le ayuda a cultivar una variedad de especies de plantas, una de sus metas es mantener y desarrollar el negocio por lo que solicita por segunda vez el financiamiento de los socios de kiva para la compra de plantas, maceteras y abono.uno de sus logros con el crédito anterior fue pagar a tiempo en la institución y abastecer las necesidades de sus dos hijos.
texts.en: Karla is an enterprising 33 year old woman, single,  and the mother of two children ages 11 and 6 years old for whom she works day after day to help them get ahead and to give them a better future. Four years ago, she started an ornamental plant business. She has a small nursery where her mother helps her grow a variety of plants. One of her goals is to grow and develop this business, thus she is asking for a second loan from the members of Kiva to buy plants, pots, and fertilizer. One of her accomplishments with the last loan was to pay the loan off on time and to cover the needs of her two children.

loans.use: to buy plants, pots and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jenaida

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jenaida works hard to support her family. She runs a furniture-making business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from operating a general store. Jenaida has been sustaining her business activities with her past 10 loans for NWTF.

Jenaida is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials such as lumber, paint, nails, and other items for her furniture business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase lumber, paint, nails, and other items for her business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 32-year-old married woman with five children. Four of her children are in school. For the past three years, Helen has operated a business making woven cloth in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Helen is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fabric and other materials needed in her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Reyna Liliana

texts.es:
Reyna Liliana tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Reyna se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (patos, gallinas y pavos, se dedica a este rubro hace varios años, con buenas referencias personales y laborales ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de mayor cantidad de animales menores para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna Liliana is 40 years old and does not have any children in her care. She lives with her partner in their own home in the district of Oyotún, a community that works primarily in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock, located in the province of Chiclayo, part of the region of Lambayeque, in the northern coast of Peru.

Reyna works raising and selling barnyard animals (ducks, hens and turkeys). She has been doing this type of work for various years and has good personal and professional references. She has asked for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a greater amount of small animals to offer to her clients and thus generate a greater income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater amount of small animals.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is 55 years old and married with nine children. For the past five years, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. Eugenia has borrowed 11 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Eugenia is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: German

texts.es: German es un microempresario residenciado en Cartagena de Indias, un municipio del departamento de Bolívar en donde identificó su oportunidad de negocio, tras la creciente demanda de construcciones y empresas industriales, quienes por normatividad compran dotaciones industriales para suministrar a sus trabajadores y que consiste en una serie de elementos de protección a su integridad para garantizar que cumplan de manera segura y efectiva con su trabajo.  Él ofrece los productos en su local comercial y también realiza visitas a empresas en donde promociona un amplio surtido de guantes, cascos, gafas, botas, ropa y todo lo relacionado con seguridad industrial, en la actualidad cuenta con nueve años de experiencia y una solidez en su negocio con el que aporta a su familia bienestar. German está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en nuevo surtido de elementos de seguridad industrial como extintores, gafas, camisas y bombachos, con la finalidad de ampliar su gama de productos y motivar más ventas.  Su meta a futuro es ampliar su base de clientes llegando a nuevas empresas.
texts.en: German is a micro-entrepreneur who lives in Cartagena de Indias, a municipality in the department of Bolivar where he identified his business opportunity after the growing demand of construction and industrial companies who,  by law,  must buy industrial equipment to supply and offer a safe and effective protection to their employees at work. He offers these products at his store and also visits companies where he promotes a variety of gloves, helmets, goggles, clothing and everything related to industrial security. He has nine years of experience and a business strength which helps him cover his household needs. German is applying to his first Kiva loan thru the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to invest in a new assortment of industrial security products such as extinguishers, goggles, shirts and sweatpants, with the goal to expand his product lines and encourage sales. His goal in the future is to expand his client base and to reach new companies.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of industrial security products such as extinguishers, goggles, shirts and sweatpants.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, él posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 7 años tambien posee una panadería en el cual elabora pan francés y pan dulce, tiene muchos clientes y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como ha podido salir adelente con su familia, el esta solicitando nuevamente un credito pero en esta ocasion es para la compra de agua, jugos, golosinas, gaseosas, etc. todo por mayor para surtir su negocio y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Oscar is 44 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife. For the past 7 years, he has owned a store located in his house. He also owns a bakery where he makes french bread and sweet breads. He has many clients and with his earnings he has been able to get ahead with his family. He is once again asking for a loan, this time to buy water, juices, candy, soda pop, etc wholesale,  to supply his business and get better earnings.

loans.use: To buy water, juices, candy, soda pop, etc.  wholesale.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 47 years old and has five children, one of whom is in school. She is married.

Rosario is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosario has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosario would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel has worked in technical support for many years. He now owns a business where he offers repair, installation, and support for computing and networking devices. He is from Akron, Ohio and lives at home with his two kids.

Some of Emmanuel’s experience includes working for companies like Time Warner Cable and AT&T. He also served as an automated logistic specialist for the Army Ohio National Guard.

Emmanuel is currently seeking a loan that would allow him to purchase office items, stock tools, equipment/computers and software to increase production. He would also like to invest in a part-time employee and marketing material to broaden his workload.

His vision for the future is to grow his business and expand to neighboring communities.

loans.use: to purchase office items.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila signed up for her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Mila was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of her good fortune. Recently, she took out a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, such as canned goods, oil and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Shere Mae

texts.en:
Shere Mae is a 33-year-old married woman with two children. One of her children is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Shere Mae has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Shere Mae requested a 6,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell. In the future, Shere Mae would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia believes that it is better to be prepared for unprecedented life events. She always makes a point of renewing her life insurance every year. She is grateful that Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative makes it more accessible to all its members to renew their insurance through its loan products. She asks the cooperative for a loan intended to pay for her insurance premium.

loans.use: to pay for her life insurance premium.

loans.name: Anacorita

texts.en:
Anacorita is 61 years old and married with adult children. She fishes and personally sells their catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities. To minimize chances for a low catch, they must have as much fishing equipment as they can. She already has floaters to help guard their fish cages.

Anacorita has been a member in good standing of Paglaum MPC for almost nine years. She has applied for a 6000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner Paglaum MPC to get new nets. She also wants to buy catches of her neighbors so she can sell more fish at the nearby fish market where they will fetch higher prices.

In the future, Anacorita would like to buy a new fishing boat with savings she has put aside from her daily sales. She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to buy new nets and her neighbors' catches to sell at the nearby fish market where they will fetch higher prices.

loans.name: Sumber Rahayu Group

texts.en:
The Sumber Rahayu group repaid their loan to MUK of 20,000,000 IDR. The group is led and managed by Ni Luh. She was chosen as the leader when they formed the Sumber Rahayu group. Ni Luh used her previous loan to renovate her pens. She already has six sows. In the last six months her sows gave birth to 10 – 12 piglets each. Ni Luh has become a piglet seller in her village. Ni Luh piglets have good quality in their type and size. She has sold them all and earned a satisfactory profit.

To buy superior piglets and more feed, Ni Luh and the Sumber Rahayu group are continuing their loan. Ni Luh will use her portion of the loan to buy superior feed to make sure the piglets grow fat and healthy. Ni Luh will maintain the quality of her piglets. Now she has plans to build new pig pens to enlarge her business. She hopes all will come true. She said she is grateful to lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting her pig business and making her life better than it was previously.

loans.use: to buy superior feed

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Renalyn is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Renalyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Renalyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other supplies to use in her business.

Renalyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Renalyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 32 years old and has two children. Analyn is married and one of her children is in school.

Analyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Analyn has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a bag of beans.

loans.name: Jaylin

texts.en: Jaylin is 36 years old, married and has two young children. She is managing a variety store for income. Her spouse also helps her in the business. Jaylin will gain more profits if she will sell additional products in her store. So she is asking for additional capital of PHP 50,000 to buy grocery items (canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, and soap) to sell. She will continuously offer good products and services to gain more income. She will save additional revenue for her family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy grocery items (canned goods, soft drinks) to sell.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is 54 years old and residing at Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Mis.Occ. He is married and blessed only with adult-aged children. He joined PMPC in 2007 in order to access the programs and services of the said co-op. Recently, he's accessing his eighth loan in the amount of PHP 14,000 for additional working capital of his existing business. He will use the loan to buy a variety of commodities and then sell a variety of food products in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities.

location.town: Plaridel - Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is a retailer of consumable goods in Katipunan, Plaridel. She finds this business easy to market because her products household basics. She is also a member of Paglaum MPC where she can access financial assistance for her business. She wishes to restock her store with commodities such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, soaps, shampoo and others, so she has asked for a loan from the cooperative. She hopes that she can give the best to her family through her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with commodities such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, soaps, shampoo and others.

loans.name: Conie

texts.en: Conie is 49 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena. She is married and has school-aged kids. To earn a living, Connie owns and operates a business providing transport to local community members, with her husband as one of the drivers. She has been doing this for eight years. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase a slightly-used motorcycle. Conie is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Connie hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase a slightly-used motorcycle.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is a businesswoman who earns through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Recently she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 43 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care, and other supplies.

Helen has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care, and other supplies

loans.name: Ma.luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 56 years old and married with 12 children. With two children in school, Ma. Luisa works very hard to provide for them.
