Ma. Luisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like home product care, eggs, canned goods, and other groceries.

Ma. Luisa has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like home product care, eggs, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Conception is 53 years old and has two children who are in school.

Conception has a business buying and selling personal product care in the Philippines. Conception requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like lotion, lipstick, etc.

Conception has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Conception would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like lotion, lipstick, etc.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a woman with 11 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Alicia is 53 years old now.

Alicia has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed such as thread, garments, and other supplies.

Alicia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Alicia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed such as thread, garments, and other supplies.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Virginia is 53 years old now.

Virginia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Virginia has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Virginia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Celda

texts.en:
Celda is 55 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Celda works very hard to provide for them.

Celda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, and other groceries.

Celda has been in this business for 32 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Celda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, and other groceries

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 45 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, Lucia works very hard to provide for them.

Lucia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, junk foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

Lucia has been in this business for 31 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, junk foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en:
Faiza is 34 and lives with her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband runs a general store where he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages to cover his household necessities from his own store. Due to his good behavior, he has built up very good relations among his customers. Due to good relationships, his sales have increased a lot. However, he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand.

Therefore, Faiza has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband, so he can buy sacks of rice, sugar, flour, etc. She is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will successfully fulfill each request for any item and not disappoint his customers. She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as sacks of rice, sugar, flour, etc. for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Bahati Yetu Group

texts.fr: Bizibu est commerçante qui s’entraide avec son mari, membre groupe de crédits «Bahati Yetu», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 43 ans, mère de six enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est propriétaire d’une quincaillerie sur la route principale et vendeuse de divers matériaux de construction depuis 10 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en clous, ciment, ferre à béton, etc. Elle commença son business avec capital reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, construire en dur, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Bizumbu is an entrepreneur. She and her husband support each other in their work.  Bizumbu is a member of the Bahati Yetu borrowers' group and a client of the IMF Hekima. She is married, 43 years old, and has six children, all of whom are in school. Bizumbu has been running a hardware store on the main street and also selling various construction materials for 10 years. 

Bizumbu will stock up on nails, cement, reinforcing bars etc. She launched her business with funds received from her husband. She would like to take out bigger loans, build a concrete house, and provide for her children's schooling and food. To conclude, Bizumbu thanks Hekima for its support of entrepreneurs who lack access to traditional banking.

loans.use: to stock up on nails, cement, reinforcing bars etc.

loans.name: Ruth Aminta

texts.es: Ruth es una mujer laboriosa de 44 años de edad, casada y madre de una niña de siete años, por quien trabaja día a día para darle un futuro mejor, ella se dedica a la venta de pasteles de manera ambulante desde hace diecisiete años, solicita por octavo ciclo el financiamiento en la institución para la compra de harina, pollo, queso y piña, una de sus metas es tener una tienda de ropa usada. Con las ganancias que obtuvo con el crédito anterior logro comprar un televisor.
texts.en: Ruth is a hardworking 44 year old woman. She is married and the mother of a seven year old daughter, for whom she works day to day to give her a better future. She has sold pastries as a street vendor for seventeen years. She is asking for her eighth loan from the institution to buy flour, chicken, cheese and pineapple. One of her goals is to have a used clothing store. With the profits she earned from the previous loan she was able to buy a television.

loans.use: to buy flour, chicken, cheese, and pineapple.

loans.name: Sonia Esmeralda

texts.es: Doña Sonia es una mujer emprendedora y ejemplo de vida para muchas personas, tiene la edad de 39 años, acompañada y madre de un joven quien está estudiando en la universidad, ella es una mujer perseverante que ha logrado desarrollar su negocio el cual es la venta de ropa nueva, una de sus hermanas le ayuda a movilizarse y a comprar la mercadería, ella está solicitando por tercer vez el financiamiento de los socios de kiva para la compra de blusas, pantalones, faldas y zapatos, la buena administración de su negocio le permitió maximizar sus ganancias y logro comprar un carro, además emprendió un nuevo negocio que es la venta de electrodomésticos. Una de sus metas es tener su propia tienda en su localidad.
texts.en: Sonia is an entrepreneurial woman and a life example for many people. She is 39 years old, married and the mother of a young man who is in college. She is a persevering woman who has been able to develop her business, which is selling new clothes. One of her sisters helps her to get around and buy the merchandise. She is asking for a loan for a third time from one of the Kiva partners to buy blouses, pants, skirts and shoes. The good management of her business allowed her to maximize her profits and she was able to buy a car. In addition, she started a new business, which is selling appliances. One of her goals is to have her own store in her locality.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, skirts and shoes.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is a 57-year-old widower who provides motorcycle transportation for people to make a living. He has applied for a loan of 6,000 PHP through Kiva's field partner ASKI to buy gasoline for and perform maintenance on his motorcycle.

Rogelio hopes to continue improving his services and profits and save money for family emergencies.

loans.use: to buy gasoline for and perform maintenance on his motorcycle.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: Nazira is 44 years old, married and a mother of two children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni tiene 32 años de edad, casada, con 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Niepos, en una zona rural, de la provincia de San Miguel, Región Cajamarca, Sierra norte de Perú.

Marleni se dedica a brindar servicios de limpieza, lavado y cuidado de niños, cuenta con una máquina lavadora la cual le facilita para realizar sus labores; con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para mantenimiento de equipos de trabajo como su lavadora, Marleni piensa en incrementar sus ingresos, con gran influencia en el negocio; tener un mayor equipamiento y confort para poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona. Así aumentarán sus ingreso y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marleni is 32 years old. She is married, with two children. She lives with her family in the district of Niepos, in a rural zone in the province of San Miguel, in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

Marleni offers cleaning, laundry, and child care services. She has a washing machine that makes it easier for her to do her work. She has more than five years of experience in the business. Her business is located in her home. She is applying for a loan to maintain the equipment for her work, such as her washing machine. Marleni is thinking of increasing her income, with a great influence on the business. [She would like] to have more equipment and greater comfort to be able serve the various needs, requirements, and tastes of her customers in the zone. Thus she will increase her income and will be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain her work equipment

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
María es una señora de 38 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en la ciudad de Santo Domingo. Cuentan con una pequeña casa en el sector Juan Eulogio, ahí tiene su negocio, un taller de costura que gracias a sus otros ingresos de venta de ropa ambulante pudo mejorarlo y adquirir maquinas necesarias para seguir con su actividad.
María dice que no ha sido fácil, ella poco a poco fue comprando ropa para ir vendiendo de casa en casa, fue duro al principio porque no es fácil comenzar con un  negocio pero luego ya adquirió experiencia y le ha ido muy bien hasta ahora, gracias a esos ingresos y al apoyo de su esposo que es albañil se ha compró máquinas de coser y pudieron adecuar un espacio en la casa para ponerse su taller. Ahora cuenta con este ingreso más que le ha dado más ingresos para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, dos de ellos están estudiando mientras el pequeño pasa al cuidado de doña María.
Con este crédito ella podrá comprar telas e hilos para fortalecer el taller de costura, además invertirá en ropa para seguir con recorriendo los fines de semana.María agradece a KIVA por esta oportunidad que le da de crecer y superarse.
texts.en:
María, 38, lives with her husband and three children in the city of Santo Domingo. They have a small house in the Juan Eulogio area. In her home she runs a business, a sewing workshop that she was able to improve and furnish with the necessary machines thanks to her other income selling clothing as a street vendor.

María says it has not been easy. She bought clothing little by little to sell door to door. It was hard at first because it is not easy to start a business, but she gained experience, and it has gone very well for her so far. Thanks to that income and the support of her husband, who is a construction worker, she bought sewing machines and they were able to set up a space in the house for her workshop. Now she has this additional income to be able to support her children. Two of them are in school, and María takes care of the youngest one.

With this loan, she will be able to buy fabric and thread to improve her sewing workshop. She will also invest in clothing to continue selling on the weekends. María thanks Kiva for this opportunity to grow and succeed.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread and improve her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta, 36, is mother of two children and lives with her husband and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a greengrocer by profession and he has sold seasonal and fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. He has been feeding his family through the income generated from his shop.

Nowadays, the needs of Shagufta’s family have suddenly increased, and her husband does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So she has applied for a 35,000 PKR loan through Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan to give her husband to buy more vegetables to sell daily.

Shagufta is very thankful for Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more seasonal and fresh vegetables for her husband to sell.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is 42 years old and married. In order to contribute to the family’s expenses, she started selling animals. She buys baby goats and calves at low prices, raises them and then sells them in the market at a profit. She also sells milk to make extra money.

Irshad would like to enlarge her business so as to cover household expenses. For this reason she contacted Kiva's field partner Kashf Foundation and applied for a 45,000 PKR loan to buy more animals to raise and then sell. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to buy more animals to raise and then sell.

loans.name: San Antonio De Padua Group

texts.es:
La socia perteneces al banco comunal SAN ANTONIO DE PADUA; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Coya en la provincia  de Calca departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda Higidia ella es conviviente y tiene 47 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maiz y papa, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de carpintería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the communal bank San Antonio de Padua [St. Anthony of Padua]. This bank is located in the Coya district of the Calca province in the department of Cusco.

The borrower is named Hilda Higidia. She is a 47-year-old who lives with her partner and works in the farming business. She has a plot of farm land where she grows corn and potatoes. She works from 8am until 6pm. She has been in the business for many years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her farming business. She is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

The borrower who is attached to the group photo had her picture taken after the meeting because she asked for special permission due to work obligations.

The other borrowers work in the farming business, carpentry business, grocery store business, and restaurant business.

Hilda Higidia is grateful to those who form part of her dream in this way, and she commits to completing the repayments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Khilola

texts.ru:
Честная и ответственная женщина Хилола. Она жительница города Курган-Тюбе. Хилола замужем и мать троих детей. У нее один сын и две дочери. Сыну 19 лет. Дочкам 17 и 5 лет. Сын учится в университете. Хилола бизнес-леди, она занимается торговлей деятельности на рынке города. Хилола продает мобильные телефоны, панели, запчасти и чехлы для телефонов. Она перевозит товар из города Душанбе. Его сын помогает ей в работе после учебы. Хилола зарабатывает, и обеспечить семью. 
Хилола обратилась за кредитом, чтобы оплатит за годового обучения сына. Она не смогла копить денег для обучения сына, потому что ей нужно кормить и одевать детей. По этой причине Хилола обратилась к Вам за кредитом. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Khilola is an honest and responsible woman.  She is a resident of the city of Qurgan-Tube.  She is married and the mother of three children (one son and two daughters).  Her son is 19 years old, her daughters 17 and 5.  Her son is a university student.  Khilola herself is a business woman; she is involved in retail activity at the local market.  She sells mobile phones, panels, spare parts and phone cases.  She brings her merchandise from Dushanbe.  Her son helps her with her work during his free time.  Thanks to the money that she makes, Khilola supports her family.

Khilola has requested a loan to pay for her son's annual tuition fees.  She was not able to save enough money for this expense because she needs to feed her children and to buy them clothes.  For this reason, she is turning to you for a loan and she hopes that you will support her.

loans.use: to pay for her son's annual tuition fees.

loans.name: Syeda

texts.en: Syeda is 59 years old and married. She has been involved in the business of cloth trading. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells it in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Syeda has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with two children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water.

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a retail shop in the near future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Angela Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Ángela es una señora laboriosa de 59 años de edad, casada, quien hace siete años emprendió su negocio de venta de comida, solicita por sexta vez el financiamiento en la institución porque desea invertir en la compra de arroz, cebolla, tomate, carne, papa y tortillas, una de sus metas es tener su propio comedor bien acondicionados para que sus clientes lleguen a deleitarse con sus platillos, con el crédito anterior logro mejorar su cocina con la construcción de un pantri.
texts.en:
Ángela is a hard-working, 59-year-old married woman. Seven years ago, she founded her business selling food.

She is requesting a loan from the institution for the sixth time, because she wants to invest in the purchase of rice, onion, tomato, meat, potatoes, and tortillas.

One of her goals is to have her own well-outfitted dining room, so that her customers can come to enjoy her dishes. With the previous loan, she succeeding in improving her kitchen with the construction of a pantry.

loans.use: to buy rice, onion, tomato, meat, potatoes, and tortillas
